job_summary:
Plan de carrera|Buen paquete de beneficios
 
 Acerca de nuestro cliente

 Gran empresa del sector asegurador, ubicada en Madrid centro, en la que encontrarás un equipo numeroso, ambiente de trabajo cercano, alta posibilidad de crecimiento y un entorno que favorece el aprendizaje y el desarrollo tanto a nivel personal, como profesional.   

Descripción

 Se trabajará en el departamento de analytics donde se desarrollarán e implementarán modelos analíticos para los distintos departamentos de la empresa. Para ello, se utilizarán herramientas de modelización y entorno cloud.   

Perfil Buscado (H/M/D)


 Formación STEM (Matemáticas, Física, Estadística o similar) 
Buen expediente académico
Experiencia con modelos analíticos
Dominio en estadística y matemáticas
Programación avanzada con R/Python 
Se valorará: PySpark, SQL, Java, Vertex AI, tensorflow..
Imprescindible interés por la programación, tratamiento de información y desarrollo de modelos analíticos. 
Valoramos buen nivel de inglés


 Qué ofrecemos


 Salario a valorar según recorrido, banda 25-35K + 11% de variable. 
Contrato indefinido
Horario 9:00 a 18:00 con flexibilidad. Viernes y meses de verano jornada intensiva. 
Paquete de beneficios como seguro médico, cheques restaurante, seguro de vida, plan de pensiones, retribución flexible. 
Modalidad: presencial + 1 día a la semana teletrabajo (a elegir).

En Sopra Steria trabajamos para hacer posible la transformación digital de nuestros clientes y para conseguirlo necesitamos seguir creciendo y sumando gracias a personas como tú.  Nuestros empleados coinciden en el gran equipo y ambiente que formamos en Sopra Steria. Somos más de 46.000 personas trabajando en 25 países y nuestra misión es unir talento y tecnología, tratando de ayudarte a que encuentres un lugar en el que poder desarrollar todo tu potencial. ¿Te atreves a crear el futuro? 
Requisitos 
No buscamos la perfección, pero, nos gustaría que tuvieras al menos 3 años de experiencia en un rol de machine learning orientado a soluciones de negocio, dominio de python y fuerte formación matemática. 
Se ofrece


 Porque sabemos lo que necesitas…
  


Facilidades para ti, para tu tiempo. ¡No todo va a ser trabajo!
Participa en proyectos retadores. ¿Te animas a aprender algo nuevo?
Crece con un programa de desarrollo continúo personalizado.
Disfruta de nuestros Beneficios y accede al Plan de retribución flexible.
Continúa formándote con nosotros: Tecnología, habilidades, metodologías e idiomas.
Para que te sientas parte del equipo: andjoy, pádel, running… y un fisio por si acaso!

 ¡Atrévete a trabajar de una forma diferente y conócenos!

We are looking to hire a full time Data Scientist, who will develop, train and deploy machine learning and image processing algorithms for the diagnosis of medical images.
 Your responsibilities will encompass:

 Developing solutions for medical image analysis using neural networks and automatic image processing.
 Preparing the working environment to organize and clean the data, the ground truth, and everything needed to evaluate different algorithms and pipelines.
 Interacting with medical specialists and product managers to understand the needs and assess technical feasibility.
 Deploying algorithms in real time operational conditions working together with the engineering team.
 Drafting the technical documentation of the technology developed.


 Proven experience developing solutions in the fields of machine learning, image processing or computer vision. Experience with biomedical image processing is a plus.
 Strong software engineering skills in Python and experience with the Python scientific ecosystem.
 Knowledge of artificial intelligence frameworks and in particular deep learning libraries (Keras, TensorFlow, Caffe or Torch). Knowledge of programming with GPUs is a plus.
 A master's degree or a doctorate in computer science, Mathematics, Biomedical Engineering or another relevant discipline is a plus.
 Willingness to make and impact and change the world.

En WayOps buscamos un perfil Data Scientist que quiera continuar su carrera profesional formando parte de un equipo Data & AI de primer nivel y trabajando en proyectos cloud con las últimas tecnologías.
La persona seleccionada participará en múltiples proyectos encargándose de realizar el análisis exploratorio de los datos, tratamiento de variables y elaboración de modelos científicos utilizando técnicas de aprendizaje automático. Además, participará en la industrialización del código científico y elaboración de cuadros de mandos.
EXPERIENCIA & CONOCIMIENTOS
El perfil a incorporar deberá contar con 3-4 años de experiencia como Científico de Datos utilizando Python, 1-2 años de experiencia en entornos Cloud, así como 1-2 años de experiencia en modelado de datos y elaboración de cuadros de mandos. Además, se valorarán conocimientos en Spark y experiencia previa en industrialización de código científico.
Se deberá aportar experiencia en las tecnologías:

Machine Learning (Python, sklearn, h2o)
Analytics (SQL, PowerBI)
Herramientas (Jupyter, Databricks, Git, Azure DevOps)

Además se valorará experiencia en tecnologías como:

Machine Learning (mllib, sparkling water)
Deep Learning (tensorflow, keras, pytorch)
ETL (ER, Relational-model, Star-model, MDM)
Azure (Databricks, Storage, SQL Databases, ML Services)
Spark (RDDs, Dataframes)
Property Graphs (Neo4j+Cypher, Tinkerpop+Gremlin)

CONTRATACIÓN * & * UBICACIÓN
La contratación será como indefinido o autónomo en jornada completa. El trabajo se desarrollará en remoto aunque podría ser necesario realizar reuniones puntuales en nuestras oficinas. Banda salarial negociable en función de la modalidad de contratación y experiencia.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: 30,000.00€ - 60,000.00€ per year

job_title: Trainee Data Scientist at Havas Group
job_summary:
Agency :
  Havas Media Group
 

   Job Description Summary :
  We are looking for a Data Scientist Trainee role to be based in Madrid to help in providing support to products and services developed for both account teams and global clients.
 
 This role will transform data into insight and insight into business decision.
 
 He/she will collaborate with both Global Measurement Product Manager and Global Data Scientist on the creation, development and support of new products and services offered by the Global Measurement team.
 

   Job Description :
 

   Key responsibilities:
 


 Collect and interpret data from variety of sources, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
 Analysis of global data (homogenization from different sources, analysis, drawing of insight conclusions)
 Efficiently and confidently report the results back to senior members of the business
 Identifying patterns and trends in data sets and provide explanation to aid current projects
 Working alongside teams within the business and the management team to establish business needs & solutions



   Required Skills and Experience:
 


 University degree in mathematics / statistics or comparable
 Proficiency in English is a must, other languages desirable
 Code tech stack: Python (mandatory), R.
 Advanced knowledge of mathematics and experience performing statistical analysis on large datasets with the ability to interpret results.
 A good understanding of statistical modelling techniques with the ability to create and interpret comprehensive models and reports
 Analytical and organized mindset, with an ease to structure information aimed at communicating complex topics to both technical and non-technical teams in a clear and unambiguous manner.
 Solid understanding of office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI, Word)
 Proactive and collaborative attitude.
 Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
 Strong intellectual curiosity with the ability to structure and solve difficult problems.
 Strong communication skills with the ability utilize agile methodologies to ensure an efficient working environment.
 Ability to work autonomously with a keen attention to details and a high sense of prioritization



   Please submit your CV in English.
 


   Skills :
  Data Analysis, R Code, R Statistics
 

   Contract Type :
  Intern
 

   Here at Havas across the group we pride ourselves on being committed to offering equal opportunities to all potential employees and have zero tolerance for discrimination. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applicants irrespective of age, sex, race, ethnicity, disability and other factors that have no bearing on an individual’s ability to perform their job.
 


   Due to high volume of applications, only eligible or matching candidates will be contacted by us.

Descripción
  Participar en el desarrollo de modelos analíticos para resolver problemas de negocio y facilitar la extracción de conclusiones sobre los datos.
 
   1. Participar en la definición de requerimientos a partir de las historias de usuario enviadas por las áreas de negocio para ser desarrolladas por el CoE y participar en la documentación de los proyectos que sean llevados a cabo por el CoE.
   2. Colaborar en el análisis de técnicas y casos de uso existentes en el mercado en lo referente a modelos analíticos de datos para identificar aquellas cuya aplicación pudiera ser útil para el CoE Analytics.
   3. Desarrollar algoritmos usando estadística y matemáticas para ejecutar funciones analíticas que sean requeridas por las áreas usuarias del CoE. Así como aplicación de algoritmos de Deep Learning para realizar los proyectos de analítica avanzada de la compañía.
   4. Preparación y análisis de datos estructurados y no estructurados, para extraer conocimiento que pueda aprovecharse para el desarrollo de soluciones.
   5. Revisar los datos empleando métodos estadísticos de cara a descubrir anomalías y contradicciones, monitorizar el rendimiento y la efectividad de los modelos implementados y aportar análisis que faciliten la toma de decisiones a las distintas Áreas de Negocio de la compañía.
 


   ¿Qué buscamos?
 

   Titulación Universitaria afín
 

   Experiencia previa de al menos 5 años desarrollando las funciones solicitadas
 

   Nivel alto de inglés.
 


   ¿QUÉ OFRECEMOS?
 

Plan de pensiones
Flexibilidad horaria
Ayuda a comida
Teletrabajo
Formación continua y desarrollo profesional
Retribución flexible (formación, guardería, seguro de salud y transporte)
26 días de vacaciones + días de libre disposición
Contrato indefinido
Ambiente de trabajo internacional y oportunidad de trabajar con otros países
Empresa certificada con los sellos Top Employer y Empresa Familiarmente Responsable.

Who You Are:
You are a team player who loves creating things and is deeply interested in Data Analysis and Data Science. You are willing to work in projects in:

A novel forecasting and financial analytic model for intraday automatic trading.
Predictive analytics for the maintenance of robotic-inspected pipelines.

It would be essential for you enjoying getting your hands dirty in the data. You should also be comfortable in a dynamic work environment. Furthermore, it would be best if you had fun solving challenging problems. You should be someone who makes decisions based on a strong foundation of theoretical knowledge, but curious enough to tinker and devise new solutions to problems. You should have a sincere interest in new and innovative solutions. We encourage a passionate attitude to bring those ideas to life, and we expect you to be open enough to collaborate with your teammates. These teammates shall challenge and be challenged to get the best of you. You should not be afraid to take ownership in your part of the company, and you should feel proud of being an integral player. And most of all, you should be excited to be part of a fun and growing team making a difference solving several major real-world problems.



What You Bring:
We require the following qualifications:

Curiosity, resilience, and drive.
Ability to pitch in wherever necessary.
Ability to show initiative in improving processes and culture.
Demonstrated record of being a kind and trustworthy teammate with high standards.
Fluent in professional English with native speakers from different nationalities.
Spain Working Visa or Spanish Citizenship.
Experience in Data Science with Python.
Experience in delivering production-ready algorithms & models.
Python Scikit-learn, Pandas and NumPy fast prototyping and testing of model.

We encourage the following qualifications:

BSc or MSc degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
1-2 years of experience in Python programming for Data Science applications.
Desirable: Parallel computing, image processing, and data visualization.
Desirable experienced in an application domain: 
     
Finance, trading, market forecasting, quantitative analysis.
Predictive maintenance for infrastructure/engineering, sensor-based data.
 


Please note: You do not need to match every single bullet point listed above to apply for this position. At LURTIS, we believe that diverse perspectives are vital to nurturing the spirit of innovation and success. We are committed to building a dream team that encompasses a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.



What We Offer:
Lurtis, we strive to cultivate a fun and exciting work environment where you can have a direct & immediate impact. We offer the opportunity to work on an innovative product designed to tackle a real, significant, and immediate challenge to a major economic sector. You would join a team that was founded on mutual respect and support, a company that prioritizes professional growth, and an organization who knows the importance of work-life balance for long term success. In addition to salary, we offer equity and benefits.

Option of working either remotely or at the company office with flexible models and hours.
Teammates who respect and cherish you and your ideas.
Salary progression in a growing company.







España 
Indefinido
Experiencia de 6 meses a 2 años
Titulación Universitaria Grado (4+ a.)

En Grupo Teknei seguimos creciendo y aportando valor para nuestros clientes en el entorno del Dato.
 Con un ambicioso plan de crecimiento ampliamos nuestro equipo y seleccionamos a expertos en Analítica de Datos que mediante la aplicación de técnicas de Inteligencia Artificial sobre los datos de negocio puedan repercutir en mejoras.





Requisitos 





Funciones:

Desarrollo de modelos de Machine Learning, desde la obtención de datos a la puesta en producción y monitorización



 Conocimientos requeridos:

Machine Learning
Python






¿Qué te ofrecemos? 





Te ofrecemos muchas posibilidades de evolución profesional en la compañía. Posibilidades de promoción, retribución flexible, posibilidad de teletrabajo, jornada continua los viernes y durante el verano y muy buen ambiente de trabajo.



























Ubicación: Bilbao y Madrid








Contrato: Indefinido








Jornada: Completa








Experiencia mínima: 2 años








Estudios mínimos: Ciclo formativo de grado superior








Número de vacantes: 1








Modalidad: Presencial y teletrabajo






Sobre Teknei 





Teknei es una empresa especializada en ofrecer servicios integrales y soluciones innovadoras de tecnología. Contamos con gran experiencia en consultoría y gestión de procesos intensivos en tecnologías de la información, así como en la creación de soluciones tecnológicas propias, que diseñamos, desarrollamos e implementamos.
 Las personas que componen la compañía son el activo más valioso. Contamos con un equipo excepcional formado por más de 200 empleados distribuidos en las oficinas de Bilbao, Donostia-San Sebastián, Vitoria-Gasteiz y Madrid.





















Si te interesa esta oferta puedes enviar tu CV a seleccion@teknei.com indicando en el asunto el puesto de trabajo.

Equifax is looking for a Data Scientist for its headquarters in Madrid. We are looking for someone with a strong technical background in Advanced Analytics and Data Science, and passionate about the development of innovative projects. Ideally the candidate will have experience in managing client projects, and supporting sales teams in offering analytics-oriented solutions. 
What you’ll do 

Reporting to the Head of Data Science and Data and Analytics Innovation, your main objectives will be to: 
use cutting-edge statistical techniques to develop innovative projects based on data and analytics, with a focus on the fields of Credit Risk Management, Finance (including Open Banking), Marketing, and Fraud Detection 
demonstrate to Equifax clients the power of our analytics solutions based on Machine Learning and Big Data 
Use agile methodologies to accelerate the development of new products and prototypes 
Have the creativity and technical knowledge to translate business requirements into mathematical solutions 
Use data-driven story-telling and visualisation to communicate complex concepts to non-technical audiences 
Support the migration of our analytical teams and platforms to the cloud 

 The profiles we’re ideally interested in are those who are comfortable coding in Python, proficient in developing statistical models, and who are capable of translating business requirements into mathematical solutions. What we offer is the opportunity to work in an ambitious team, in an international environment, with flexible conditions and many opportunities to grow. 
What experience you 

High level of English 
University degree, preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial and Financial Disciplines, Economics, Engineering, Computer Science or Physics 
At least 3 years of experience in Data Science and Big Data projects, in the development of analytical solutions, segmentation analysis, scoring models, etc. 
Experience in the field of credit risk management, either in marketing processes or in a credit information services company, will be highly valued 
Experience in some of the different vertical markets where Equifax operates (Financial Institutions, Telco, Utilities, Retail, Insurance, SME) 

Technical Skills 

Python (required) 
R 
SQL, with experience in distributed databases such as Hive 
experience in developing Machine Learning models 
cloud-based analytics environments (GCP, AWS) 
processing of structured and unstructured data 
agile methodologies 

What could set you apart 

Spark 
Hadoop 
Spotfire 
Tableau 
Alpha-beta testing 
Professional experience in a Product-Owner role 

We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks. 
If this sounds like somewhere you want to work, don’t delay, apply today - we’re looking for you! 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Somos una compañía global, líder en el desarrollo de infraestructuras regenerativas que generan un impacto positivo en la sociedad. Nuestra plantilla, formada por más de 41.500 profesionales y presente en más de 40 países de los cinco continentes, contribuye a nuestra misión de diseñar un planeta mejor. Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.
        























                 Descripción del puesto
               
















    Misión:
  


    Dar apoyo al área de Organización y HR Analytics, desarrollando capacidades de análisis para la gestión de personas
  


    Funciones:
  


    Encontrar patrones y tendencias en conjuntos de datos para revelar información que no se aprecia a simple vista.
  


    Crear algoritmos y estructuras de datos para crear modelos predictivos.
  


    Apoyo en la recopilación y almacenamiento de los datos, con especial énfasis en aquellos que afectan al área de Organización.
  


    Apoyo en la distribución del conocimiento a los distintos grupos de interés.
  

















                 Requisitos del candidato
               















   Formación Universitaria: Grado en Estadística, Ciencia de Datos, Matemáticas, o estudios afines
 


   Formación Complementaria: Postgrado Big Data y Analytics.
 


   Conoc. informática: Python y R
 


   Nivel alto de inglés (C1 o equivalente).
 


   2-3 años de experiencia realizando las tareas anteriormente mencionadas.
 


   Disponibilidad para viajar.
 


 Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021 y 2022, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.

Menhir Financial is an early-stage startup aiming to radically transform how Distressed Portfolios are analyzed. We bring Quantitative Investing to this complex asset class. 

 We are building the next generation of Distressed Investing technology by combining machine learning models that already manage +800M€ worth of loans, a carefully crafted WebApp and the power of network. 

 We are a bootstrapped business working with Top Tier financial institutions. Working with us will give you an incredible exposure to the top executives of the financial world (Banks, Investment Funds, Asset Managers, ...) 

 We are looking for a Data Scientist who is proficient in AI development, testing and deployment. As an early technical hire in this exciting venture, you'll design, implement, review and deliver the artificial intelligence algorithms that power or asset management. 

 You'll solve hard problems and have deep impact on the end-product. Expect to work in a fast-paced environment, with amazing engineers who believe in our mission. We're looking for passionate engineers who love building and learning. 

 Tasks 


The job:


You'll be developing and deploying new AI algorithms. These algorithms will be used to analyse portfolios, predict behavioral outcomes, and understand the financial markets for our customers to have a seamless portfolio management experience. All covered by tests. Untested code is broken code..
We like to put models into competition to assess which are best, and most important, why.
We make technical decisions as a team. You'll get to make critical decisions on how we evolve our platform and stack.
We know for a fact that talent attracts talent. We'd love for you to help bring on board the people you've most enjoyed working with.
 Requirements 


The Requirements:


\+1 year of experience in a challenging Data Scientist role.
Engineering or Mathematics background, and being obsessed with performing at your peak.
You are proficient in Python and the state of the art frameworks and algorithms for AI model development.
English is a must.

We will value:


You are acquainted with Google Cloud Platform.
You are familiar with financial platforms and investing jargon (ROI stands for Return On Investment)
You understand CI/CD, build and deployment tools (e.g. Jenkins, Github Actions) and monitoring systems.
Experience with Docker or containers in general.
You've worked in fast-paced startup environments.
 Benefits 


Benefits:


Above market pay.
Partially remote: we are flexible, so if you are in Madrid you can work from our office, but we don't mind if you need days of full focus working remotely.
Flexible hours and unlimited vacation (given common sense is used).
Stock options.
 We solve complex problems, apply and we'll email you a challenge you can prepare for the interview!

About the job 
 Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.  Danone’s mission is Bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
 Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Blédina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?
 At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission: bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don’t wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement: your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!

 About you 
 Profile & Experience



2 years of experience in Data Science




A MSc, PhD or other Advanced Degree in a field linked to computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or closely related fields





Experience in Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry is a plus.





English is a must




 Competencies


 We are looking for people having the following technical skills:



Programming: python (pandas, numpy), Spark, Git





Modeling: supervised & unsupervised learning





Data Science tools/modules: Databricks / MLFlow




 Experience in all or several parts of Advanced Analytics process will be challenged:



Explore the potential of a raw data set





Build relevant and performant models and analyses





Experience in data pipeline and industrialization is a plus




 Mandatory skills:



Ability to work with a variety of competencies, from business, to Data Engineers





Excellent written and verbal communications skill. In particular, a strong proven ability to communicate statistical and modeling results in a clear manner.



 About us 
 The Danone Data & Analytics organization (D&A) is looking for a Data Scientist. Data & Analytics has the mission to deliver-leading edge, business-focused data powered products & services that will help strengthen Danone transformation & growth.


 The global Data Science team mission is to develop some new Data Science & AI tools to provide valuable insights to everybody at Danone, from Commercial to Operations. Danone is accelerating its data transformation, and we are strengthening our Data Science team, by creating new positions around Europe.


 Your mission, as a Data Scientist, will be to deliver state of the art, pragmatic, and creative data science solutions to answer complex business problems. Our target is to work for all of Danone’s businesses and address topics such as demand/supply forecasting, commodity pricing, milk collection optimization, marketing optimization and environmental impact reduction.
 Data has no frontier, the team will be located in various European cities to be close to business partners we develop data sciences product for. This is a unique chance of being part of an international fellowship of data scientists.


 Responsabilities & Duties



Apply state-of-the-art algorithms and predictive models (Machine Learning/Deep Learning) to answer business problems.




Build data pipeline and industrialize algorithms





Share results with technical and business teams (Data Visualization/Story telling).

Seleccionamos una persona amante de los retos, con experiencia como Data Scientist 
/ Data Strategist y sólidos conocimientos técnicos de estadística y programación que 
lidere junto a nuestros ingenieros el diseño y desarrollo de las soluciones intelligence y 
discovery del Proyecto SENDAUDIT©. Formará parte del equipo de desarrolladores de 
software y especialistas en ciencia de datos y estadística con base en nuestro Centro 
de Desarrollo de Madrid Capital. 
Conocimientos: 
Los candidatos deberán acreditar una experiencia profesional mínima de 2 años y 
titulación en Matemáticas / Estadística / Ingeniería Informática / Telecomunicaciones o 
estudios híbridos en estas materias. 

Debes tener habilidades demostrables en: 

o Programación en R (R-Studio) o Python 
o Ciencia estadística 
o Técnicas data mining 
o Herramientas ETL 

Valoraremos muy positivamente que tengas conocimientos en: 

o Programación en C# y .net (Visual Studio 2015) 
o Interrogación y gestión de bases de datos (SQL) 
o Tecnologías de visualización y reporte de datos 
o Técnicas de data quality 

Los siguientes conocimientos no son imprescindibles sino un plus: 

o Contabilidad, fiscalidad y economía (nivel básico). 
o Inglés (nivel básico) 
Funciones: 

Aportarás soluciones novedosas y sólidas, desarrollando las siguientes funciones: 

o Inmersión en nuestro proyecto de I+D+i consistente en (i) la reingeniería de la 
suite de aplicaciones SENDAUDIT ©); y (ii) su integración con sistemas de 
información y administración electrónica de nuestros clientes corporativos. 
o Análisis funcional y técnico para selección y evaluación de las herramientas 
y tecnologías bigdata disponibles en el entorno más adecuadas para las 
soluciones intelligence y discovery (ver apartado Nosotros). 
o Colaboración en el desarrollo del modelo de Data Strategy (ETL) para 
aprovisionamiento de datos masivos de nuestros clientes y su integración en 
SENDAUDIT ©. 
o Desarrollo e implementación del modelo de Data Science (algoritmos y 
modelos de análisis) en colaboración con nuestros especialistas en 
economía/fiscalidad y nuestros clientes corporativos. 
o Realización de labores de depuración y mejora de calidad de datos 

Participarás en todas las fases de desarrollo: investigación, diseño, implementación, 

pruebas y mantenimiento de software. También realizarás labores de consultoría 
para adaptación a la metodología de trabajo de cada cliente y formativas. 

Cooperarás en un equipo multidisciplinar integrado por 11 profesionales altamente 

cualificados en distintos campos como la informática, las telecomunicaciones, el 
derecho y la economía dentro de una cultura horizontal, de debate de las 
soluciones y las decisiones estratégicas, aprendizaje y mejora continua.

 






Ofrecemos: 
Conscientes de la cualificación requerida y considerando las buenas perspectivas 
comerciales del Proyecto, estamos en disposición de ofrecer condiciones ventajosas: 

Integración en un proyecto muy innovador pero estable dentro de un sector en 

expansión, con posibilidades de progresión profesional, conciliación y retribución 
competitiva. 

Contrato laboral indefinido a jornada completa (L-J de 9:00 a 18:30 h. y V de 9:00 a 

15:00 h. con flexibilidad) 

Salario fijo negociable más salario variable del 10% por objetivos. 


Buen ambiente y vestimenta casual en nuestro Centro de Desarrollo en zona Ríos 

Rosas (Madrid Capital). 

Aprendizaje continuo mediante formación interna y externa. 

Importante: solo valoraremos candidaturas de residentes en España/UE. 
Nosotros: 
Somos una empresa de Ingeniería de Software y Consultoría de TI pionera en el diseño 
y desarrollo de nuevas tecnologías en la lucha contra el fraude a través de la aplicación 
de técnicas de auditoría informática y ciencia de datos al ámbito de la auditoría 
financiera y la comprobación fiscal. 
Desarrollamos la suite de aplicaciones SENDAUDIT©, cuyas soluciones (analytics, 
intelligence y discovery) soportarán el procesamiento de datos financiero-tributarios, 
aportando enfoques de comprobación detallada, análisis de riesgo y análisis de red 
(grafos) útiles para el control. Nos encontramos al inicio del desarrollo de las soluciones 
intelligence y discovery en las que ofreceremos a nuestros clientes corporativos 
novedosas funcionalidades de análisis soportadas en técnicas del universo big data, risk 
analysis y data mining enfocadas al nacimiento del concepto Tax Intelligence. 
Además, prestamos servicios asociados de consultoría, formación, asistencia técnica, 
mantenimiento evolutivo y programación de adaptaciones metodológicas que 
completan un producto de alto valor añadido. 
SENDAUDIT analytics© se está implantando con éxito en varias administraciones 
tributarias a las que ha permitido mejorar significativamente su productividad y sus cifras 
de detección. Nuestro objetivo último en este sentido es promover el cambio cultural en 
el uso de nuevas tecnologías en la lucha contra el fraude, ayudando a nuestros clientes 
a mejorar la asignación de recursos corporativos, racionalizar los procedimientos de 
selección y toma de decisiones e incrementar la eficacia de las actuaciones de control. 
La persona seleccionada se incorporará a un proyecto estratégico enmarcado en el 
proceso de expansión orgánica de la empresa, gracias al apoyo continuado de 
nuestros clientes Administraciones Públicas, que nos confían proyectos de larga 
duración y elevada complejidad técnica. 
El tamaño de la empresa permite una estrecha colaboración entre todos sus 
profesionales, facilitando una visión integral del proceso de desarrollo, desde la 
interacción con el cliente/usuario en la preventa y toma de requerimientos y 
especificaciones, hasta la entrega de producto, validación por usuario final y procesos 
posteriores de formación y mantenimiento. La actitud proactiva en la resolución de

 






problemas, la vocación de servicio al cliente y el compromiso ético en nuestro día a día 
son nuestras señas de identidad. 
Más información en www.sendaudit.com

Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here. And there’s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

Sobre nosotros Ferrovial es uno de los principales operadores globales de infraestructuras de transporte y mantenemos un firme compromiso con el desarrollo de soluciones sostenibles. Tenemos presencia en 6 mercados principales; cotizamos en el IBEX 35 y formamos parte de prestigiosos índices de sostenibilidad como el Dow Jones Sustainability Index y FTSE4Good. Corporación tiene como misión principal diseñar la estrategia de la Compañía, estableciendo las políticas, directrices y guías de actuación globales asociadas a los distintos ámbitos funcionales de la Organización (Finanzas, Recursos Humanos, Asesoría Jurídica, Sistemas de Información, etc.), que posteriormente son desarrolladas y adaptadas a las particularidades de cada Área de Negocio. De igual manera, desarrolla una función de prestación de servicios corporativos a las distintas Compañías del Grupo, a la vez que consolida su información. Misión Cada año, millones de personas en todo el mundo, usan nuestros aeropuertos, autopistas, coches y grandes infraestructuras. Y nuestra misión es mejorar la experiencia de usuario en los servicios que ofrecemos a través de los datos. ¿Cómo lo hacemos? Con un equipo, Digital Hub, en el que encontrarás excelentes profesionales, con un conocimiento técnico amplio y sobretodo, con un gran espíritu de transformación, innovación y cambio. Actualmente, contamos con un equipo de unas 30 personas aproximadamente, focalizados en su gran mayoría en extraer valor a partir de los datos (Data Engineers, Data Architects, Data Scientists y Data Analysts). ¿Y en el futuro? Seguimos apostando por impulsar nuestro áea y buscamos para ello jóvenes con talento que quieran formar parte de éstos y otros retos. Así que, si te apasionan los datos y te gusta trabajar en entornos flexibles, con gente muy proactiva, proyectos dinámicos y un enfoque innovador, ¡únete a nosotros! Habilidades y experiencia • Graduado/a en ciencias o ingeniería (preferentemente matemáticas, física, o estudios con fuerte componente cuantitativa). • Tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia laboral en tareas relativas a analítica, ciencia o ingeniería del dato. • Posees la capacidad de sintetizar problemas complejos, extrayendo las principales preguntas a las que dar respuesta, así como la creatividad para proponer soluciones sencillas y eficaces. • Tienes experiencia en el análisis estadístico de datos, incluyendo estadística descriptiva y análisis estadístico avanzado - test de hipótesis, análisis de regresión, series temporales, etc. • Conoces y tienes interés en aprendizaje automático (ML), teniendo experiencia en las principales herramientas de trabajo (Python/R y sus principales librerías), conociendo los principales tipos de tareas y algoritmos disponibles. • Eres capaz de dar una interpretación matemática a las soluciones propuestas, entendiendo los fundamentos matemáticos de los algoritmos utilizados y generando hipótesis que te permitan trazar planes de acción relativos a la selección y mejora de algoritmos (selección de muestras, complejidad y eficiencia de algoritmos, parametrización, etc). • Tienes familiaridad con el ecosistema cloud, conociendo el paradigma de trabajo y el uso de servicios con alguno de los proveedores cloud principales (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud...). • Te apasiona la idea de aplicar tu conocimiento y herramientas de decisión automatizada para solucionar problemas industriales, incluyendo tareas en los dominios de Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Robótica, etc. • Orientación a negocio. • Capacidad de interlocución y comunicación, tanto en inglés como español. Trabajo en equipo, especialmente bajo metodologías ágiles. ¿Por qué Ferrovial? Nos gustaría que nos conocieras más fondo y supieras lo que significa unirte a nuestro equipo. Unirte a Ferrovial es dar el salto a: • Formar parte de una empresa líder en su sector, con presencia en 6 mercados principales. • Trabajar con los mejores profesionales. • Un proyecto sólido e innovador. • Desarrollo profesional. • El mejor ambiente de trabajo. • Los mejores beneficios. ¿Qué te ofrecemos? • Estabilidad laboral con contratación indefinida desde el inicio. • Plan de desarrollo individual con formación técnica y en soft skills. • Movilidad internacional y entre negocios. • Tarjeta restaurante (11 euros al día por cada día que tengamos jornada completa). • Medidas de conciliación: flexibilidad horaria, jornada intensiva los viernes, en navidad, semana santa y verano, días festivos extra y compra de vacaciones. • Clases de inglés (2 horas a la semana en horario laboral). • Acceso al Plan de Retribución Flexible (Seguro médico, Tickets guardería, Renting de vehículo, Seguro de vida, Seguro de accidentes, Stock Bonus, Seguro Colectivo de Ahorro y Tarjeta transporte). •Gympass. • Acceso al Club del Empleado (ofrece descuentos a empleados en compras de artículos, reservas de entradas, viajes…Etc.). • Tarjeta cafetería (para consumiciones gratuitas en las máquinas de vending del edificio). ️ • Fruta en la oficina. Si crees que encajas en el perfil descrito y te apasionan los retos, no dudes en inscribirte a nuestra oferta. ¡Da el salto! ¡Te estamos esperando! Job Reference: CORPORATION00572

location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Barcelona provincia
job_summary:
The Position
 


 Data Scientist


 Global Customer Support (GCS), is the global organization responsible for technical services in the Diagnostics Division. GCS supports the service organizations of the Roche affiliates and the Lifecycle-Teams.

 GCS is also making sure that service requirements- & concepts are considered in the product development process to ensure that the design of instrument and software products facilitates effective and efficient service, maintenance and customer support processes.

 Currently, approximately 7,500 Service employees work around the world for world class Customer Service. Roche Diagnostics is ranked number one in overall Customer Service satisfaction.

 As a Data Scientist, you will design, develop and program methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement.

 Key Responsibilities


 Work with stakeholders throughout the Service organization to identify opportunities for leveraging Customer Support data and other data to drive business decisions.
 Mine and analyze data from the SIQ database and other company databases (e.g. Salesforce.com, SAP) to drive optimization and improvement of product development, Customer Support and business strategies.
 Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
 Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
 Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
 Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
 Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
 Monitor operational activities of the Diagnostics Service organizations
 Drive Product Care activities together with GCS TPMs & Finance to improve instrument performance in the market and improve customer experience
 Shape KPI landscape to address Senior Management needs to steer the organization
 Translate problems into actionable data analytics solving the problem
 Define reporting and alerting requirements to identify improvement areas early
 Close collaboration with other members of GCS PLG and Global Service Finance as well as the wider GCS organization
 Main Service Business Analytics contact for GCS and Affiliates
 Drive Product Care activities together with GCS TPMs & Finance to improve instrument performance in the market and improve customer experience
 Shape KPI landscape to address Senior Management needs to steer the organization
 Propose corrective actions to improve Service business operations or to improve product designs


 Who You Are

 You have a Bachelor’s degree (master preferred) in Data Science, IT, Economics, Applied Math or equivalent.
 You are proficient in English (Excellent verbal and written communication skills).
 You have approx. 4-5 years of working experience in a Data Scientist or Data Warehousing position.
 Ability to translate data analytics in actionable results for the senior management
 You are self-motivated, proactive, taking initiative and going beyond call of duty
 You have exceptional problem-solving skills and you are a good team player
 You have the ability to work comfortably in a cross-functional setting and with business senior executives
 You have experience working with SQL, Tableau, Data Management, Snowflake Data Cloud, Salesforce


 If you have any questions, please visit our FAQs and videos at you have any questions, please visit our FAQs and videos at https://https://www.roche.com/careers/jobs/faqs.htm


   Who we are
 
 At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

 Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About this opportunity
 Within the Solution Area Network Design and Optimization Software R&D (SA NDO SW R&D), we offer the opportunity to collaborate with highly qualified team all around the world and enable success stories for our customers. You will be working with groundbreaking technology (5G, ML/AI, Automation, Cloud computing, and Security) and will be involved in developing the software of tomorrow. Bring on a new career step for enthusiastic professionals who are ready to write the future with us.
 The Data scientist will be responsible for developing scientific methods, processes, and systems to extract knowledge or insights to drive the future of applied analytics. Provide thought leadership, perform Advanced Statistical Analytics, and create insights into data to deliver to the business useful insights, identify trends, and measure performance that addresses business problems. Collaborate with business and process owners to understand business issues, and with engineers to implement and deploy scalable solutions, where applicable.

 What you will do

 Drive Data science leadership
 Synthesize problems into data question(s)
 Decide approach for data science
 Design & perform data science experiments
 Develop Data Science Infrastructure &Tools
 Convert data into useful insights.
 Act in external relations


 You will bring:
 Theoretical Knowledge:

 Common and advanced Clustering algorithms including probability density and distribution based.
 Convolutional Neural networks
 Recurrent Neural Networks
 Bayesian-based probabilistic graphical models
 Deep Autoencoders
 Latest machine reasoning techniques
 Reinforcement learning
 Quantum computing

 Application of ML/AI:

 Clean clustering of high dimensional data with noise
 Application of autoencoders to high-dimensional data
 Application of CNN to high-dimensional temporal data
 Application of RNN to high-time series data for forecasting
 Application of Bayesian dimensional networks for causal reasoning
 Auto learning of network structure from data for probabilistic graphical models
 Application of supervised and unsupervised technique

 Frameworks, Languages, & General skills:

 Deep experienced programming skills in Python, ability to write object-oriented and scalable code
 JupyterHub and notebooks
 Solid skills in the use of current pioneering machine learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, scikit-learn, etc.
 Capable to handle large amounts high dimensional data (knowledge of MapReduce or PySpark is a plus) on daily basis
 Excellent data Visualization skills
 Ability to work independently and be a self-starter with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence


 Why join Ericsson?
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

 What happens once you apply?
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

What you will do
 
Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Present information using data visualization techniques
 
What we are looking for
 
Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Programming skills with Python and SQL
Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
Experience with data visualization tools and packages
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

1 year of industry experience

Extra qualifications
Experience working with huge amounts of data
Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)
Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git).
 
Why Tendam
 
One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc.
Working with cutting edge technologies and building machine learning models to solve real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
Ability to immediately test the model results in real pilots: quick time to market!
Exposure to agile methodologies
Working with senior Data Scientists to accelerate your professional development
Working in a challenging and dynamic industry
 
Ubicación: Madrid zona norte (accesible en metro, cercanías y autobuses urbanos)
Horario: jornada flexible de lunes a jueves de 7:30-9:30h y salida de 17-19h y viernes jornada intensiva que se mantiene todo el año de 7:30-9:30h y salida de 13-15h.
Contrato indefinido.
Incorporación mes de Septiembre.





Madrid, España 
Indefinido
Experiencia de 6 meses a 5 años
Máster

Estamos buscando Data Science para apoyar a nuestro equipo en proyectos complejos de análisis de datos utilizando enfoques estándar de modelado y transformación de datos.
Buscamos una persona que se sienta comoda/o trabajando con base de datos muy grandes los cuales se encuentran en diferentes almacenes de datos y en diferentes formatos; ha de ser fuerte con la implementación práctica.


Tus responsabilidades serán:

Llevar a cabo análisis cuantitativos y cualitativos, incluida la obtención de los datos, su limpieza y exploración para su precisión
Implementar las técnicas de optimización y modelado estadístico más adecuadas para el problema comercial (usando SQL y/u otras herramientas relevantes)
Implementar (y diseñar parcialmente) soluciones para un problema definido relacionado con la ciencia de datos
Interpretar los resultados de los modelos estadísticos y los resultados para traducir los aportes de los análisis cuantitativos en recomendaciones e implicaciones comerciales específicas y procesables.
Proporcionar documentación detallada de técnicas de modelado, metodologías, suposiciones realizadas y pasos del proceso.
Proporcionar investigación sobre temas
Identificar áreas para una mayor investigación, así como la creación de métodos innovadores de análisis



Estamos buscando una persona que:

Tenga disponibilidad para trabaja a tiempo completo y de manera presencial
Comprenda algoritmos complejos
Conocimiento de teoría de grafos aplicada o cualquier lenguaje de consulta DWH (como SQL, hive, Teradata, MySQL, etc.)
Habilidades/experiencia en visualización de datos (Power BI)
Sólidos conocimientos de teoría de probabilidad y estadística y algunos de los principales algoritmos de ciencia de datos.
Buenas habilidades para resolver problemas
Buenas habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita
Capacidad para escribir programas en algún lenguaje de programación (p. ej., R/Python) para crear prototipos y probar ideas analíticas



Requisitos
Estudios mínimos: Ciclo Formativo Grado Medio
Experiencia mínima: Al menos 1 año

  Conocimientos necesarios:
  

SQL
Algoritmos
Análisis de datos
MySQL
Python

Role Summary:


   Data Scientists at Sensor Tower are hybrid data scientists and software engineers. You would take data all the way from doing initial analysis to building data pipelines to final model implementation and monitoring. Data Scientists take full ownership of the back-end of the products they’re working on.
 


 We are looking for a hands-on thinker to help harvest new insights from our constantly growing foundation of quantitative information collected from the mobile app ecosystem.
 


 We are a remote first company and at this time are only able to hire folks who reside in the following states: California, Colorado, Florida, Iowa, Massachusetts, Illinois, New Mexico, New York, Oregon, Texas and Washington.
 
 What you will be focusing on

 Prototype machine learning models in Python or Ruby
 Work with MongoDB and analyze query performance to ensure calculation efficiency
 Write tests for the implementation of machine learning models
 Collaborate with back-end engineers to understand the raw data being collected
 Collaborate with front-end engineers to create data visualizations for both external and internal customers
 Present results of various data analysis

 Experience which will be beneficial

 Degree in mathematics, statistics, or computer science
 Experience in business intelligence, data mining, analytics, or statistical modeling in technology or mobile industries OR 2+ years applied experience in data science in mobile market intelligence
 Ability to write code that is ready for production (Python and Ruby preferred)
 Experience with adjusting data for bias
 Ability to communicate effectively with technical developers and non-technical marketing business partners
 Ability to critically analyse given data, ask probing questions, and perform own research
 Knowledge of statistical modeling techniques


 About Sensor Tower



 Sensor Tower is a high-growth SaaS company that provides accurate, comprehensive, and customizable mobile market economy analytics to app developers, game developers, industry analysts and investors. Founded in 2013, Sensor Tower has grown from a $1M seed investment to being profitable and in 2020 we received a $42M growth investment from Riverwood Capital.
 


 Why Sensor Tower?



 Our flexible work environment allows employees to live in greater connection with the people, places, and activities they love!
 


 Our benefits include:
 

Flexible time off so employees can shape their time away from work.
Health and wellness stipend to achieve and maintain a healthy lifestyle through physical and mental fitness.
Monthly internet stipend and a one-time $500 home office stipend.



 We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, and veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. If you have a disability or special need, please do not hesitate to let us know and we'll do our best to accommodate.
 


 #LI-Remote

This is Us.

 A team of more than one thousand people sharing an idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.

 In today’s world, we know this happens because we are a fully online bank. We were born out of that idea and 20 years on, technology, simplicity and transparency continue to be the ingredients of the recipe that leaves the best taste in our mouths: being more than just a bank, someone useful in the lives of the millions of clients who have chosen us.

 The way we do things also mirrors our eagerness to innovate. We are proud to be one of the very first banks to work with agile methodologies. It doesn’t ring a bell yet? No worries, we will be delighted to tell you all about it. You will find it’s one of those things you’ll want to repeat over and over.

 And although we are based in Spain, we like to cross borders. We are lucky to work with international teams every day across 44 countries, composed of women and men as equal as they are diverse. Because here you are completely free to be who you want to be, love whomever you choose, and even go for pineapple as your pizza topping.
 
Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead—that’s our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working…we are looking forward to meeting you!

 Your role and work environment:

 Are you willing to take a new challenge increasing the value for client and business with predictive models? Are you a team player and like to have fun while you are working? Then this is your place
 
We are looking for a Data Scientist to work in the Modelling team within the Customer Interactions and Monetization tribe. In our tribe, we take decisions based on data, give support to other tribes to define analytical solutions, and we continuously challenge the status quo.

 We are looking for a Data Scientist used to work near business, understand the challenges, who proposes solutions proactively, and defines the appropriate advanced analytical solution.
 
We are looking for a value-oriented person, who has always in mind how we can increase the impact of our predictive analytics in client and business. Besides you like to share knowledge, collaborate with the international team, and be a team player

 Your key responsibilities:

 Work together with different areas in the company to understand their situation, and proactively define solutions based on advanced analytics. 
Measure the value to give with the solutions provide and define common success KPI
 Assess business with the best predictive solution we can define
 Think out of the box, finding solutions to implement, in an iterative incremental aproach
 Build/improve predictive models/neural networks using statistical and machine learning techniques.
 Design, analyse and interpret business hypothesis and explore datasets through using available tools.
 Recommend ideas to business when data/results are available through good visualizations / predictive algorithms.
 Assist users to understand the data science principles and when needed provide an explanation for the model behaviour and possible correcting actions.
 Automate and standardize recurrent machine learning activities to enable efficiency gains
 Provide end-to-end data / analytical support for the stakeholders’ actions
 Work with our international stakeholders following our quality standards

 What are we looking for?

 A leader of our Orange Code culture displaying the following behaviors:

 MSc or PhD with excellent academic results in a technical field (Econometrics, Computer Science, Physics, Artificial Intelligence, etc.), but this can be substituted with excellent capabilities.
 Knowledge of the latest developments in the analytics community (methods and tools) combined with the ability to decide which of these are most relevant to ING and translate them into opportunities. You have an in-depth understanding of algorithms like Random Forests, Neural Networks, MCMC, reinforcement learning and NLP.
 Strong programming skills in Python and Spark are a must. 
You are experienced in explaining complicated analysis to a non-technical audience with your storytelling and data visualization skills.
 You have excellent oral and written communication skills at technical and business level.
 We consider 3+ years of work experience in the Data Science field a strong plus.
 Fluent in written and spoken English.

 Moreover
 You have a learning attitude. Not only to master new algorithms and technologies, but also on the interpersonal level. You realize that the value of your work is quality x acceptance and want to become better at both. You are proven to be able to give, ask and incorporate feedback.
 You have experience in building data products. From inception to production. With your full-stack capabilities, you can build a prototype, but also improve an issue within the existing models in production. You love coding.
 You feel at home in a high-performing team and you make the other team members feel at home as well. You have the independence to speak up when needed. 
You have exceptional problem-solving capabilities. You understand that understanding the problem is at least 90% of the solution. You have displayed creativity and tenacity in cracking the problem and finding a solution to it.

 What do we offer?

 The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but… What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest detail.
 Check out what is waiting for you!

 Flexible schedule and 100% flexible e-working.
 Work or e-work? We have a totally flexible model: keeping our customers in mind, and also your colleagues, choose the one that best suits you all.

 Restaurant card.
 So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn’t take up your time or your cravings.
 
Our house will be your home.
 In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, urban orchard, The Good Service (to help you in your arrangements) and much more!

 Life insurance. 
We hope you don't need to use it!

 Health insurance.
 For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).

 Flexible remuneration.
 In addition, you can enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through which you can access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids…

 Free company shuttle. 
It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to work comfortably.

 Banking benefits.
 Special loan or mortgage terms after 6 months working at the bank.
 And benefit from our pension plan after 2 years with us.

 More health, more sports.
 Runners club with your own trainer.
 Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.
 Physiotherapy service on site.
 Gympass.

Descripción:

¿Te apasionan los retos de la ingeniería y de la innovación?
 En CT Ingenieros, vemos los obstáculos como nuevas oportunidades, y crecemos porque convertimos las ideas en progreso. Por ello, buscamos constantemente nuevos talentos para incorporarlos a nuestros equipos. Personas que disfruten aprendiendo, con vocación, iniciativa y proactividad. Favorecemos la autonomía y el aprendizaje, y no creemos en vigilar lo que haces, cómo lo haces y para qué lo haces.
 Con más 1.700 ingenieros, tenemos una gran presencia en España, Francia, Alemania y Reino unido, y somos una compañía líder en servicios de ingeniería a lo largo del ciclo de vida del producto. Si estás interesado en formar parte de CT, permítenos conocerte.
 Seleccionamos un Data Scientist (H/M) que trabajará dentro de nuestro equipo de DevOps para el proyecto de digitalización DAST.

Requisitos:


Esperiencia de al menos 3 años en puesto similar.
Formación en ingeniería informática, de software, matemáticas o estadística. Dobles grados de las anteriores. Másteres relacionados.
Valorable conocimiento MLOps.
Conocimiento de técnicas de inteligencia artificial orientadas a analítica de datos.
Experiencia en el desarrollo, entrenamiento, evaluación y validación de algoritmos.
Machine learning mediante aprendizaje supervisado y no supervisado.
Técnicas estadísticas: modelado, clusteting, análisis predictivo, visualización de datos.
Conocimiento de lenguajes: Python, R, SQL, NoSQL, Julia.
Familiarización con entornos de big data: Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, HIVE, Vertica, Microstrategy.
Soft skills.
Nivel mínimo de inglés B1.

At Deepnote, we are building the next generation of data science tools. A platform where teams can explore, analyze and present data from start to finish. No more barriers — we want to make notebooks the focal point for any data team.
 We're looking for a Frontend engineer to join our core team. You'll work on some of the most difficult problems in the field.
 Your responsibilities will range from writing beautiful and performant code to gathering user feedback, all the way to crafting delightful user experiences. You'll become an expert in data tooling and we'll trust you to make the call which technologies we use and which features we implement.
 Our stack:

 Typescript, React, GraphQL
 Design system based in Figma, with components in Storybook
 Backend running on Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis
 Infrastructure in Kubernetes, AWS

 What you'll work on:

 You will implement and improve features on our real-time collaborative notebook interface.
 You will improve and add new components based on our design system. You will also define how we the implemented design system should be used internally.
 You will improve the rendering performance by working with virtualization and memoized components.
 You will learn about data science tools and form opinions that will ultimately drive the product.
 You will support our community of data scientists and developers and help them succeed using Deepnote.

 About you:

 You have 4+ years of relevant experience.
 You were part of a team where you built complex web applications in TypeScript and React.
 You are familiar with build tools like Webpack or esbuild.
 You have experience with owning large projects that you are comfortable to break down or delegate.
 You are user-first oriented and interested to talk to our users to make sure we are building the right experiences and features.
 You don't define success by only delivering a feature, but also by making sure it is well-understood and used by users.

 Bonus points:

 You have experience with working with designers through Figma.
 You have experience with our backend stack, like Node.js or PostgreSQL.
 You have experience in data analysis and/or data science.
 You have worked on notebooks, visualizations, BI tools, or data pipelines.

 Benefits:

 Competitive compensation package with equity options
 25 days of PTO + sick days
 Health benefits package
 Kick-start bonus to set you up
 Unlimited budget for learning
 Semi-annual company retreats
 Budget for travel to our offices in Prague / San Francisco

location: 38003 Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Santa Cruz de Tenerife provincia
job_summary:
Job Description & Summary 

Si estás interesado en formar parte de equipos multifuncionales, con foco en la analitica y ciencia del dato haciendo uso y certificarte en las nuevas tecnologías BigData con las principales compañías a nivel nacional/internacional no dudes en hacernos llegar tu CV. 

Ubicación: Santa Cruz de Tenerife 
Formación: Grado o Ingeniería en Telecomunicaciones, Informática, Matemáticas, Física, Estadística.. 
Formación (máster, postgrado) en Big Data 
Interés por desarrollar la carrera profesional en un entorno tecnológico, y en concreto por el análisis y ciencia de los datos 
Abierto a aprender nuevas tecnologías y lenguajes de programación para el tratamiento, limpieza y enriquecimiento de los datos. 
Se requiere habilidades de comunicación, mente analítica y aptitud para resolver problemas 
Habilidad para encontrar soluciones simples a problemas complejos. 
Se requiere conocimientos en extracción de datos con SQL 
Experiencia desarrollando modelos con Python, así como librerías Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn,... 
Deseable conocimientos y experiencia en metodologías agile y scrum 
Deseable conocimiento en arquitecturas y sistemas multicapa en sistemas heterogéneos, orientadas a servicios,o que requieran escalabilidad, alta disponibilidad o alto rendimiento. 
Se valorará la experiencia profesional en entornos tecnológicos Cloud (Azure,AWS,GCP), conocimiento Java, Django, Apache Spark, Hadoop, Github, Linux, Jira, IDEs de desarrollo, SQL, bases de datos tanto NoSQL (Elastic Search, MongoDB,...) como relacionales (Postgre, SQL Server…), PowerBI y manejo de datos, etc. 
Idioma: Inglés deseable

Actualmente buscamos un Data Scientist que se incorpore al área de I+D+i participando en el desarrollo de soluciones para las necesidades de la empresa, elaborando y/o manteniendo el código utilizado y coordinando la integración de algoritmos.
 Funciones:

Análisis de series temporales de variables meteorlógicas y de producción energética de todas las tecnologías.
Desarrollo de algoritmos de predicción de producción energética, consumo energético, y precios de mercado.
Desarrollo de herramientas de integración y procesamiento de datos.
Identificar carencias en los algoritmos y desarrollar soluciones específicas para resolverlos.
Desarrollo de herramientas para realización de ejercicios de benchmarking de rendimiento de algoritmos.

Requisitos:

Conocimiento avanzado de R y librerías Tidyverse. Valorable Python
Experiencia desarrollando modelos de aprendizaje automático
Conocimiento de Bases de Datos: SQL y NoSQL
Grado Matemáticas/Física/Ingeniería
Nivel alto de inglés

Requisitos valorables:

Estadística avanzada
Predicción de series temporales
Técnicas de aprendizaje automático: Métodos autorregresivo, Árboles de decisión, Redes neuronales, Máquinas de vector soporte, etc
Proyectos de Data Science aplicados al sector energético
Gestión de algoritmos en entornos de producción
Tecnologías Big Data

Netquest is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Data & Analytics team. At Data Analytics, we are responsible for providing the company with the right data to make informed decisions. Specifically, the data science team owns the entire data knowledge of the company, helping all the areas exploring the data, extracting KPIs or optimizing their processes. Our current data tech stack involves both open source tools like R, Python, Apache Airflow, dbt or Apache Spark, and AWS services like Redshift, AWS EMR, AWS Batch or S3.
 
We are now expanding our horizons. Netquest wants to generate extra value by merging data from various and unique origins such as declarative, behavioral data and many more. And who better to carry it out? Us! We aim to revamp the existing data pipelines with state of the art architecture and machine learning processes. With it, we will transform huge amounts of data to generate fruitful insights for our clients. We will be providing our customers with a full understanding of how users behave, with special attention to Ecommerce. We are ready to apply our knowledge to create Data Products, and we need a hand.
 
Are you looking for a new technical challenge? Come help us start on the right track! Your opinions will be heard and you will have an impact from the get go.
 

The main responsibilities of the Data Science team are:
 

Increase the company's knowledge of the data, giving fruitful results and sharing KPIs in different formats such as presentations, reports, products or dashboards with Tableau & Qlik.
Build, evolve and maintain data products working closely with the Product team.
Collaborate with the Data Engineers and Analysts to solve the business needs.
Design and revamp existing Clickstream Data Pipelines to create new Data Products for Netquest.
Become a crucial part of the business knowledge communicating between technical and business parts.

 
Your main responsibilities will be:
 

Understand current and future needs of the clickstream data.
Evaluate current approaches to data solutions to improve them and evolve them.
Build and maintain algorithms to increase the data quality of our products.
Search for innovative ways to explode our data to provide new products.
Respond for business questions with agility and resolutive solutions.
Help the team building MLOps paradigms.

 

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
 You´re a great candidate if…
 

You have at least 1 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
You are proficient with an analytical programming language (Python, R) and the respective ecosystem.
You have solid skills regarding database handling as SQL.
You are knowledgeable with reporting and visualization tools such as RMarkdown, Shiny, Dash, etc.
You feel comfortable with statistical concepts such as distributions, atypical observations, confidence intervals, etc.
You have experience with Machine Learning techniques (Classification, NLP, clustering, neural networks).
You are able to work-out effective solutions under uncertain or ambiguous circumstances.
You’re always willing to learn something new and embrace a healthy debate.
You are proactive proposing solutions, asking for questions and debating ideas.

 

It’s a bonus if you:
 

Have a Bachelor degree in physics, mathematics, statistics or engineering.
You have been using Amazon Web Services, Azure or similar platforms.
Are fluent in presentation and communication regarding technical or mathematical aspects.
Are fluent in both Spanish and English.
Have some experience working with agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban/SAFe).
