Short Description


   Internship
  

Job Description


We are looking for a Data Scientist who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. 
They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. 
They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.




Responsibilities 






        Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
       



 Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
       



 Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
       



 Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
       



 Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes.
       



 Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality.
       



 Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.
       



 Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
       










Job Summary





Offered Salary

       No
      







Career Level

       Internship
      







Experience

       Fresher 
      







Qualification

       MCA M.Tech (CSE/IT/ECE/ME)

Descripción
 Nuestro cliente, una empresa líder a nivel mundial en la venta muebles y decoración, necesita incorporar a su equipo a un Data Scientist que se encargue de:


 Asegurar, promover y asumir la responsabilidad de la toma de decisiones basadas en datos para mejorar el rendimiento empresarial.
 Realizar exploración y análisis de datos avanzados utilizando técnicas modernas de minería de datos (incluido el Machine Learning), herramientas de visualización o una combinación de ellas, para proporcionar información que ayude a los compañeros de trabajo y a las partes interesadas a tomar mejores decisiones.
 Evaluar el potencial y la usabilidad de las fuentes de datos internas y externas sin estructurar y sin procesar para su uso en el análisis de productos y la toma de decisiones basada en datos.
 Administrar de manera proactiva los procesos organizacionales relevantes, incluidas las reuniones con las partes interesadas y/o equipos relevantes para impulsar un resultado previsto.

 Requisitos

 Mínimo 3 años de experiencia profesional como Analista de Datos o Científico de Datos.
 Amplio conocimiento de Python.
 Amplios conocimientos de probabilidad y estadística, incluidas las pruebas de hipótesis mediante experimentos controlados (ej. pruebas A/B).
 Amplio conocimiento de SQL.
 Familiaridad con los entornos en la nube como Azure, Azure Databricks, GCP.
 Desarrollo de modelos estadísticos/ML relacionados con problemas comerciales con herramientas de la industria.
 Amplio conocimiento del procesamiento de datos para grandes conjuntos de datos.
 Capacidad para traducir la entrada del negocio en hipótesis comprobables, características/modelos o métricas.
 Habilidad para comunicarse tanto en inglés como en español.
 Formación universitaria en informática, econometría, ingeniería, matemáticas o equivalente.


 Ofrecen:

 Contrato indefinido directo.
 Modalidad 60% remoto 40% presencial.
 Horario de 8 a 17h.
 Salario hasta 40K.

Data Scientist – SCF 
 Boadilla del Monte, Spain 
 
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 

Santander Consumer Finance (SCF) está buscando un/a Data Scientist para nuestras oficinas en Boadilla del Monte. 

POR QUÉ DEBERÍAS CONSIDERAR ESTA OPORTUNIDAD 

En Santander ( www.santander.com ) somos actores principales en la transformación del sector financiero. ¿Quieres unirte a nuestro equipo? 

Santander Consumer Finance se orienta hacia el desarrollo de negocio relacionado con productos de financiación al consumo, canales de venta y acuerdos comerciales con concesionarios, fabricantes de vehículos o establecimientos de distribución minorista, así como funciones comerciales que llevan asociada la venta directa (oficinas, call centers o canales digitales) e indirecta (a través de terceros) de productos de financiación al consumo. 

Santander se enorgullece de ser una organización donde hay igualdad de oportunidades, independientemente de raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género. 

QUÉ HARÁS EN TU TRABAJO 

Como Data Scientist, tu objetivo será trabajar en una mejor comunicación y adaptación de las comunicaciones con nuestros clientes. La relación con el cliente debe ser omnicanal y en tiempo real. Por tanto, necesitamos técnicas que nos permitan identificar a los clientes más propensos, mediante modelos de propensión a la contratación, y dedicar nuestros esfuerzos comerciales en las acciones con más retorno. 

Necesitamos a alguien como tú para que nos ayude en distintos ámbitos: 

Automatización de procesos recurrentes. 
Diseño de test de forma rigurosa para poder posteriormente analizar de manera consistente, resultados significativos, y tomar decisiones de negocio. 
Foco en el ciclo de vida completo del cliente, no sólo a corto plazo, sino teniendo en cuenta propensión a la compra y comportamiento a largo plazo. 
Identificación de fuentes de información, creación del modelo de datos, integración y gestión de datos de diferente índole y origen: estructurados, no estructurados, origen interno, open data, etc. 
Construcción y mantenimiento de las estructuras de datos y las arquitecturas tecnológicas. 
Diseño y construcción de los repositorios de datos en bruto. 
Definición y ejecución de procesos ETL: EXTRACT, TRANFORM AND LOAD para la recogida y transformación de datos para la explotación de modelos analíticos. 
Definición, implementación y mantenimiento de cuadros de mando y reportes para las diferentes unidades de negocio. Definición y medición de los principales indicadores de negocio (CLTV, Valor actual, Valor futuro, Ingresos medios por cliente, tasa de abandono, etc.). Análisis sobre la rentabilidad de las acciones que se llevan a cabo. Y análisis de rentabilidad potencial de acciones a realizar. 
Análisis financiero y estadístico. 


EXPERIENCIA 

Análisis e implementación de nuevos test (precio, canal, campañas) con técnicas estadísticas de tal forma que ya en la definición aseguremos a priori resultados estadísticamente significativos. 
Poner en producción productos analíticos en plataformas en la nube como AWS. 
Segmentaciones (estratégica, cliente, producto) como parte básica de la analítica. 
Desarrollo de modelos de propensión a la compra (contratación de un nuevo producto, utilización): 

Modelos de respuesta 
Modelos de Uplift 
Modelos de prevención del abandono, retención y fidelización selectiva de clientes 
Modelos de Up-selling y cross-selling 

Valor cliente actual, Valor cliente futuro. Segmentación de valor. 
Desarrollo modelos económicos: seguimiento de la rentabilidad de las campañas y beneficio esperado. 
Definición, creación y seguimiento de los indicadores claves de clientes, penetración de productos, producción y cadenas de transformación. 


EDUCACIÓN 

Licenciatura o Grado Superior en Informática, Estadísticas, Matemáticas, o afines. 


HABILIDADES & CONOCIMIENTOS 

Ingles B2 
Python 
SQL 
SAS 
Scala 
AWS y/o Azure 


Si quieres conocer más sobre nosotros, síguenos en https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

job_title: Head of Applied Science Commercial Intelligence - Data Scien...
job_summary:
Head of Applied Science Commercial Intelligence - Data Science & BI (Openbank)Madrid, Spain 
 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 
Head of Applied Science – Data Science & BI (Openbank) 

We are the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group and we are currently undergoing a technological transformation and international expansion. In 2017 the re-launch of the Bank began and since then we have been in continuous expansion and growth, especially in our technological side. We work in a start-up format, using agile methodologies to take our clients' experience to the next level. In 2019 we launched the bank in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal, recently following also the launch in Argentina with others to follow. 
Our culture makes us different; social and diversity clubs are part of our essence and allow us to live our culture every day. 
We are a flexible and fast adapting team that currently works remotely most of the time using all kinds of communication tools, we haven´t noticed the change! 

Mission and responsibilities: 

This role provides the link between the pure commercial business needs with the analytical engines, creating the link between business areas and a team of data scientists. Marketing campaigns, customer intelligence, churn reduction, product definition and other relevant areas of the business have a clear need of data. This role will support on the advance analysis of data in order to obtain business-related insights that foster the development of the data-driven business strategy of Openbank. 

As a Head of Applied Science, you will lead the Commercial Intelligence team and report directly to the Chief Data Science, and we expect someone that knows how to optimize more than ROC-AUC curves; you have proven experience applying ML engines to improve Business areas outcomes (measured in financial gains or savings) and take data-driven decisions. In the past you have faced data-atheists and does not frustrate you to lead them in the path of data conversion. 


You know how to create metrics that measure the performance of certain customer behaviours and enjoy the experimentation of behavioural actions to analyze the evolution of the created indicators. 
You want to find the position where you can participate in the design long-term plans for data-products and strategy, although you understand business urgent requests and sometimes you just need to get the work done. You have worked on several projects at the same time and understand how to balance delivery and progress. 
You enjoy never-faced challenges and data sources, and know how to prioritize opportunities with business needs and Directors’ requests; however our Senior Data Team is composed of ex-members of the most prestigious data-companies and academic programs, and we know that success comes only through collaboration. 
Your critical scientific thinking is normally reinforced by listening to others’ opinions with respect to the best algorithmic decisions; however you easily recognize where a logistic-regression will do the job to achieve an 80% acceptable solution. 
Scalable solutions and production-readiness are two of your mantras; however, we have a ML-Operations team that will support you in achieving technical excellence. 
You are not afraid of designing an ETL for a newly introduced dataset, generating concrete specifications for its automation; despite we have a robust Data Engineering team maintaining hundreds of Scala ETLs, the seniority of this role requires being able to communicate with this highly technical team. 
Supervising other fellow data scientists is an attractive point as it can eventually help you achieve bigger more interesting initiatives. In our team, we nurture a meritocratic culture trying to provide professional development opportunities. 


In our team, we nurture a meritocratic culture trying to provide professional development opportunities!  

To be successful in the role you must have 


+ 4 years of proven experience in an industrial environment. 
Excellent communication skills and influence, with the ability to translate business issues into analytical solutions. 
Successfully managed the end to end delivery of insights and value, including resourcing, budgeting and prioritization. 
Statistical modelling and machine learning: you know the difference of a random forest and k-means, and know how to implement them in different programming languages (ideally Python or Spark). We´ll double-check this with you! 
Dealing with large datasets, and implementing scalable solutions. You know when pandas breaks and have dealt with different distributed solutions such as dask or spark. 
How to solve problems using data: analyze the problem and decompose it into different analytical components, and recycle all the components you can from other projects. 
Software development: you know what git means, and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. Open-source lovers get a plus if you show us your github! 
Data Visualization, and tools like ggplot, matplotlib, tableau, or similar. Bonus points for plotly, and standing ovation for Quicksight. 
For this level of seniority, you have experience on geo-spatial analytics, graph-theory, and natural-language processing. 
Automation Obsessed: Cloud infrastructures are your main asset in order to automate all ML-related problem so the machine does the most of the work for you, or at least you are highly interested in collaborating closely with the ML-Ops team. 


What do we offer? 

Immediate incorporation to a dynamic and agile company with a growth and expansion project. 
Working in start-up mode with the support of Grupo Santander. 
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package. 
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group. 
Collaboration in international projects and possibility of contact with different countries. 
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events (now virtual). 


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team! 

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status. 
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. 

If you´re not currently living in Madrid or Valencia and you are open to relocate yourself, we would still love to consider your application

Estamos ayudando a nuestro cliente, una multinacional del sector retail, a buscar un-a deportista apasionado-a por los datos con experiencia como Data Scientist para incorporarse al equipo de Data & IA.
 ¿Qué nos gusta de ellos?

Son una multinacional que están presentes en más de 170 países 
Desde hace unos años la tecnología ocupa un papel muy importante y la tecnología de IA aplicada al dato, toma un papel muy relevante. Desarrollan y consumen su propia tecnología, por lo que están en continua evolución y mejora a nivel tecnológico y técnico sabiendo adaptar la tecnología a sus necesidades y a las de sus clientes.
Sus valores: vitalidad, responsabilidad, generosidad y autenticidad.
Tienen una Política de RRHH basada en la promoción interna, permitiendo que el crecimiento profesional sea una realidad. Todos los puestos de dirección provienen de la cantera interna.
Tiene una Universidad Corporativa a través de la cual forman a todos sus colaboradores, proporcionándoles herramientas para ser mejores en su trabajo.
Son una gran familia de deportistas, con un alto sentido de la responsabilidad y amantes de los retos y desafíos. Juntos trabajan buscando el progreso y evolución ofreciendo productos de valor, con alto impacto y ofreciendo al cliente una experiencia fluida y sencilla basada en su satisfacción.

¿Cuál será tu misión como Data Scientist?
 Están en un proceso de aceleración y transformación digital con el objetivo de convertirse en LA plataforma deportiva que permita a sus usuarios llegar al ecosistema deportivo (equipamiento, actividades, entrenamiento) con un solo clic.
 Para acompañar en esta transformación, los equipos de Datos e Inteligencia Artificial trabajan a diario en buscar oportunidades para generar valor. Construyen productos digitales basados en datos e IA para la construcción de una gran plataforma digital del deporte.
 Te integrarás en un equipo de datos e inteligencia artificial junto a Data Scientists e Ingenieras e Ingenieros de Datos ( 9 geeks deportistas en España) que está creciendo muy rápidamente, y pondrás tus conocimientos de Data Science e IA al servicio de las personas, para mejorar su experiencia o para simplificar su trabajo. 
Trabajarás colaborando en un equipo internacional junto a equipos datos e IA de otros países o con partners internacionales, y conversarás muy a menudo con equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades y ayudarles a detectar junto al resto del equipo nuevas oportunidades y casos de uso para generar impacto con tu trabajo.  Entre tus responsabilidades estarán:   Participar en el diseño y la construcción de soluciones de Machine Learning First para ser explotadas en sistemas de acceso masivo y alta escalabilidad: Soluciones de optimización de omni-comercio , predicciones climáticas, sistemas de personalización y recomendación , asistentes de toma de decisión comerciales . 
Asesorar sobre la viabilidad o la complejidad técnica de posibles soluciones en casos de uso a equipos de negocio para identificar los mejores casos de uso. 
Vigilar junto al equipo el estado de avance tecnológico de las tecnologías de ML/IA para poder ayudar a encontrar nuevas oportunidades, aplicaciones e identificación de casos de uso.
 Estar en contacto con los analistas de negocio y otros equipos de tecnología para poder dar soporte sobre las posibilidades de la ciencia de datos o el ML en su dominio de actividad y para ayudar a democratizar su uso para que sus beneficios llegue a la mayor cantidad posible de personas. 
 ¿Qué necesitas para tener éxito en este rol?  Tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia construyendo productos de Datos y particularmente ML 
Fluidez en Python. Soltura desarrollando en notebooks como Jupyter
 Eres Data Story Maker; te desenvuelves bien explicando los conceptos de Machine Learning y Data Science para hacerlos comprensible para stakeholders y usuarios
 Conoces bien SQL
 Tienes experiencia en técnicas de Machine Learning o Deep Learning, en algunas de las librerías y algoritmos más representativos en ese área. Entre los que podrían estar algunas de las que usan : PyCaret, Pandas Profiling, MLjar, SHAP, Scikit-learn
 Tienes muy buen nivel de Inglés, hablado y escrito 
Disfrutas trabajando con marcos Agile
 ¿Cómo será tu incorporación?
 ️ En 1 mes
 Las primeras semanas serán de integración en la actividad global del cliente para que puedas conocer el funcionamiento de su modelo de negocio en el terreno, que será muy importante después para aterrizar las oportunidades de lo que podemos desarrollar con ML/IA.
 Comenzarás después la integración con el equipo de Data e IA que compartirán contigo su manifiesto, el proyecto global, cada una de sus misiones y lo básico de su marco de trabajo (Scrumban de un portfolio de productos de data e IA) para que puedas empezar a hacer aportaciones progresivamente.
 El mes continuará con sesiones con todos los equipos de tecnología y de los equipos de negocio con los que trabajan más estrechamente (marketing, comercio digital, supply chain, dirección comercial, ...) para que puedas conocer de primera mano su organización, las personas de sus equipos y su proyecto. Esto te permitirá empezar a formarte tu propio punto de vista de la organización a la que sumarás tu granito de arena con soluciones de Data e IA. 
️ En 3 meses
 Tendrás una visión transversal de la organización, del proyecto y la estrategia. Gracias al acompañamiento del equipo y de tu coach estarás familiarizado con los procesos y las herramientas por lo que ya estarás haciendo contribuciones en algún producto o servicio del catálogo de Data/IA, construyendo y entrenando un modelo o diseñando experimentos para validar hipótesis del modelo que construyes
 Habrás tenido la oportunidad de participar en reuniones con equipos de negocio donde, junto a otros miembros del equipo, que te acompañaran, podéis asesorar sobre posibles soluciones basadas en ML / Data Science para algunos casos de uso
 También estarás trabajando en aprender y aumentar tus competencias (Softskills y competencias técnicas) por lo que tu coach y tú, identificaréis las competencias clave para que puedas ir desarrollándolas de manera progresiva durante el primer año. 
️ En 6 meses
 Habrás consolidado tu conocimiento del sistema de información en torno a la Data e IA que ya conocerás bien. Y ya habrás tenido contacto con equipos de IA en otros países con los que ya estarás colaborando a diario.
 Estarás trabajando en sinergia con un(a) Product Manager y un(a) ingeniero de datos para la construcción de un producto de data science o ML de cuyo desarrollo ya puedes empezar a responsabilizarte. Ya puedes contribuir más activamente en las decisiones de diseño y de implementación y participarás a diario en decisiones que influyen en la priorización del backlog y de los medios técnicos necesarios. 
Ya habrás tenido oportunidad de asesorar en alguna ocasión sobre alguna implementación posible a usuarios de equipos de negocio o analistas. 
Respecto a las competencias que estás desarrollando haréis un primer balance para seguir orientando cómo reforzarlas y puedas seguir creciendo. 
¿Qué te ofrece el cliente?

Te realizarán un contrato indefinido. Buscan personas que quieran crecer y desarrollarse con ellos, no creen en las relaciones cortas.
Ofrecen un salario negociado con cada persona según experiencia y nivel técnico. Además, se complementa con retribución variable. 
Importantes descuentos en la compra de sus productos para que hacer más deporte te resulte más accesible.
Beneficios con importantes descuentos en relación a la salud y el deporte como seguro médico o plan de acceso, a muy bajo costo, a miles de gimnasios a nivel nacional.
Posibilidad de participación accionaria de la empresa.


Estar rodeada/o de personas que disfrutan también de trabajar construyendo colectivamente, de compartir, y que disfrutan de los retos y el deporte al ritmo de cada uno.


 Formación según una trayectoria que tú construirás, en un entorno que te invitara a tomar decisiones a diario y dónde todos consideran que equivocarse también forma parte del proceso.


 Entorno de trabajo muy poco jerarquizado donde la toma de decisión esta muy distribuida y que favorece la promoción interna. 


Plan de desarrollo profesional en una empresa donde el crecimiento de las personas es la prioridad, por lo que lo harás acompañado de un coach. Tú serás el responsable de tu carrera (con misiones anuales), lo que se traduce en que tú fijaras en que te quieres convertir, y decidirás que competencias necesitas adquirir o necesitas aprender en cada momento. Pero no te preocupes, no estarás solo ante dicho reto, siempre tendrás un coach al lado para acompañarte. Es un equilibrio entre un trabajo de equipo y disfrutar de la autogestión. 


Flexibilidad laboral (horario y teletrabajo). Priorizan el trabajo en oficina, pero hay fórmulas de flexibilidad donde cada uno pone sus propias normas.

 ¿Cómo será tu experiencia durante el proceso?

AddYou te realizará una breve llamada telefónica donde querremos conocer un poco más sobre tu interés en la oferta y conocer un poco de ti, además de solucionar cualquier duda sobre la posición.
Realizaremos una video entrevista, para conocernos mejor.
Realizarás una entrevista con el Chief Data Officer, para conocer el proyecto y hablar de tus experiencias y expectativas.
Realizarás un desafío técnico con el equipo de Data donde podrás conocer quienes serán tus compañeros. 

Addyou te acompañará y te dará feedback durante este proceso.
 ¿TE UNES?

job_title: Sr Data Scientist Risks - Data Science & BI (Openbank)
job_summary:
Sr Data Scientist Risks - Data Science & BI (Openbank)Madrid, Spain 
 WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 
Sr Data Scientist Risks – Data Science & BI (Openbank) 

We are the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group and we are currently undergoing a technological transformation and international expansion. In 2017 the re-launch of the Bank began and since then we have been in continuous expansion and growth, especially in our technological side. We work in a start-up format, using agile methodologies to take our clients' experience to the next level. In 2019 we launched the bank in the Netherlands, Germany and Portugal, recently following also the launch in Argentina with others to follow. 
Our culture makes us different; social and diversity clubs are part of our essence and allow us to live our culture every day. 
We are a flexible and fast adapting team that currently works remotely most of the time using all kinds of communication tools, we haven´t noticed the change! 

Mission and responsibilities: 
This role provides the link between the pure commercial business needs with the analytical engines, creating the link between business areas and a team of data scientists. In particular, Openbank’s Data Science-Risk department have clear need of data-based solutions that goes from credit scoring to fraud detection. This role will support on the advance analysis of data in order to obtain risk-related insights that foster the development of the data-driven risk strategy of Openbank. 

This position stands within the Data Science-Risks team, and we expect someone that knows how to optimize more than ROC-AUC curves; you have proven experience applying ML engines to improve Business areas outcomes (measured as a trade-off between financial risks and gains) and take data-driven decisions. In the past you have faced data-atheists and does not frustrate you to lead them in the path of data conversion. 


You go far beyond Scikit-learn. You think out of the box, create novel solutions and tailor well-known methods to the required operational constraints as well as disambiguate problems and develop new metrics for identifying and tracking success. 
You love rigorous analysis, and you are a problem solver that needs to deeply understand the problem to solve, but also understands that an acceptable solution is usually preferred than a perfect solution. 
You like to continuously think and propose new points of improvement for models. 


You want to find the position where you can participate in the design long-term plans for data-products and strategy. 
You understand business urgent requests and sometimes you just need to get the work done. 
You have worked on several projects at the same time and understand how to balance delivery and progress. 
You enjoy never-faced challenges and data sources, and know how to prioritize opportunities with business needs and Directors’ requests; however, our Senior Data Team is composed of ex-members of the most prestigious data-companies and academic programs, and we know that success comes only through collaboration. 
You critical scientific thinking is normally reinforced by listening to others’ opinions with respect to the best algorithmic decisions; however, you easily recognize where a logistic-regression will do the job to achieve an 80% acceptable solution. 
You feel comfortable participating in the development of scalable solutions and productizing; however, we have a ML-Operations team that will support you in achieving technical excellence. 
You are able to design ETL’s and communicating with Data Engineering’s team the needs associated in a high technical level. 


In our team, we nurture a meritocratic culture trying to provide professional development opportunities!  

To be successful in the role you must have 

+2-5 years of proven experience in an industrial environment. 
Excellent communication skills and influence; ability to translate business issues into analytical solutions and ability to convey rigorous mathematical concepts and considerations to non-experts. 
Statistical modelling and machine learning: you know the difference of a random forest and k-means, and know how to implement them in different programming languages (ideally Python or Spark). You know different model evaluation metrics, and when one is preferred versus others. You are also proficient on supervised learning, and know standard ML methods, and how to tune their hyper parameters in order to avoid overfitting/underfitting. We´ll double-check this with you! 
Dealing with large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You know when Pandas breaks and have dealt with different distributed solutions such as Dask or Spark. 
How to solve problems using data: analyze the problem and decompose it into different analytical components, and recycle all the components you can from other projects. Ability to analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context. 
Software development: you know git and feel comfortable using it and how to develop your own code, test it and use it to produce actionable results. Open-source lovers get a plus if you show us your GitHub! 
Data Visualization and tools like matplotlib, bokeh, leaflet, or similar. Bonus points for plotly, and Quicksight! 
You have experience on geo-spatial analytics, feature engineering, and open-data processing. 
Automation Obsessed: you are highly interested in collaborating closely with the ML-Ops team. 


What do we offer? 

Immediate incorporation to a dynamic and agile company with a growth and expansion project. 
Working in start-up mode with the support of Grupo Santander. 
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package. 
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group. 
Collaboration in international projects and possibility of contact with different countries. 
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events (now virtual). 


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team! 

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status. 
We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. 

If you´re not currently living in Madrid or Valencia and you are open to relocate yourself, we would still love to consider your application

job_title: Analyst Data Scientist - Analysis & Monitoring - Advanced An...
job_summary:
Area:

CORPORATE & INVESTMENT BANKING






Company:

001





What are we looking for?
About you
We are looking for a talented Analyst Data Scientist to join the Analysis & Monitoring team. Our ideal candidate should be enthusiastic about quality assessment of models, trading algorithms and quantitative strategies, as well as building strong relationships with our business stakeholders to provide them with the best support on their functional questions. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to oversight all the productive models, algos and strategies from Advanced Analytics & Algorithmic Trading.
Your experience
The ideal candidate will have:

 A master degree in physics, mathematics, statistics, engineering or computer science.
 Outstanding mathematical literacy: you should be able to discuss business problems using mathematical terms on a piece of paper.
 Programming skills in languages like Python or Scala.
 Practical knowledge of standard statistics and machine learning libraries, and big data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark
 Good English level. 
Spanish is valuable but optional: we welcome international applications.
 The team is fully integrated into business units. You will have the opportunity to generate high impact with your work, but a strong commitment to delivery is a must have.

About the area
Advanced Analytics & Algorithmic Trading is the team of Data Scientists in C&IB Global Markets that implement trading algorithms, quantitative investment strategies and advanced analytics models for trading and sales teams. We have a strong focus on analyzing and monitoring the quality of all our implementations and providing first class support to our business stakeholders. That is the reason why we have a specialized team, Analysis & Monitoring, that handles these critical tasks.
About the job

Key Responsabilities:

 Design, implementation and monitoring of quality controls for advanced analytics models, trading algorithms and quantitative investment strategies. These controls ensure that the performance of models and algos does not deteriorate after their release to production.
 Data analysis of the behavior of productive models, algos and strategies. These implementations generate a large amount of data that requires Data Science tools to understand it and explain it to the business. Rigorous evaluation of financial impact and KPIs of productive models, algos and strategies. For instance, by analyzing A/B testing results.
 Challenge Data Scientists from the product teams before releasing models or algos into production, by doing a peer review of their proposal.
 Engage with the Advanced Analytics Discipline in implementing best practices regarding model monitoring. Provide functional support to the business units (traders and sales) regarding data analytics, models, trading algorithms or quantitative strategies.

 To give you an idea, a few examples of topics you would be looking at are:

 From Concept Drift to Model Degradation: An Overview on Performance-Aware Drift Detectors, by F. Bayram, B.S. Ahmed, and A. Kassler: arxiv.org/pdf/2203.11070.pdf .
 Machine Learning in Non-Stationary Environments: Introduction to Covariate Shift Adaptation, by Sugiyama M. and Kawanabe M.
 Advances in Financial Machine Learning, by Marcos López de Prado.
 The Science of Algorithmic Trading and Portfolio Management, by Kissell, R.

 How can you expect that a typical day unfolds if you join the team?

 You will start the day checking that our trading algorithms, models and quantitative strategies, as well as the supporting analytics processes, have a smooth start.
 Later, you will join the rest of the data scientists to discuss their different lines of work and share ideas.
 Sitting on the open trading floor, or working from home (we operate in a flexible 60% office, 40% home scheme), you will have extensive time to engage with our business stakeholders on functional questions; discuss with product data scientists potential quality issues in their implementations; improve and implement new data science based monitoring processes that evaluate the potential degradation of algos, models and strategies; analyze financial impact and KPIs; participate in workflows of approval of new implementations by challenging the product data scientists proposals from a functional point of view; and investigate potential alerts regarding the performance of algos, models and strategies.
 Some time might be also allocated for learning and training, either at campus BBVA or with the rest of the team in our journal and book club sessions, where we discuss in group the latest books and papers relevant to our activity.







Working at BBVA 
BBVA is a global company with over 160 years of history present in 25 countries with over 81 million customers. We are more than 110,000 professionals working in multidisciplinary and diverse teams.   At BBVA, we are ahead of the transformation that is taking place in the banking sector, challenging the status quo, to make life easier to our customers.   Being part of BBVA means developing your career in one of the most innovative companies in finance. 







Responsible banking
We're committed to responsible banking to help drive a more inclusive and sustainable society. The future of banking lies in financing the future.  We started out with the spirit of helping others make the best financial decisions. That spirit remains with us today and encourages us to keep moving forward, prioritizing innovation and digital transformation so that we can put the opportunities of this new era within everyone's reach. 


Diversity
At BBVA we believe having a diverse team makes us a better bank.  For this reason, we actively support diversity, inclusion and equal opportunities regardless race, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. We cultivate a collaborative and inclusive work environment that allows every employee to do their best work. 






Our values
Our values define our identity; they are what drives us to make our goals a reality and they guide all of our actions and the decisions we make. 


Customer comes first


We think big


We are one team

WELCOME TO OLX GROUP
 

 Over 300 Million monthly active users; US $1.6 billion in revenue and 18% revenue growth (FY 2021; 36% growth in FY2020); 
  Part of Naspers’ Prosus, one of the biggest technology investors in the world (An early investor in Tencent and the owner of StackOverFlow). +30 countries. +20 Brands. Powered by +10,000 employees representing 
  81 nationalities. 




That’s what’s on our plate at OLX Group.



 And that's why we need your help. 
  Join Us. Shape your career with us.



 Data Science org



 The Data Science team at OLX Group is responsible for building algorithmic solutions to facilitate transactions between buyers and sellers. We are developing personalization technologies and optimization strategies that have a direct impact on OLX’s users as well as the company’s bottom line.
 


 You will be encouraged to research state-of-the-art machine learning, in the areas of search relevance, ranking, recommender systems, and more. Applying these methods to core OLX product platforms deployed in the cloud that are affecting the user experience for millions of visitors per month, rolling your solutions to production, analyzing model results offline and online, and measuring site impact.
 


 Some of the challenges that we are focusing on are maximizing the relevance of the search results by applying ML-based rankers, combining different sources of ads in search and recommendations to optimize the satisfaction of both buyers and sellers, estimating the impact that the interactions generated by the buyers have on the revenue, and detecting trending products even before they become popular.
 


 The Recommendations Platform team



 The new Recommendations Platform team at OLX Group is responsible for building and scaling recommendation algorithms across OLX Europe. Our main goal is to help our stakeholders to increase efficiency and performance by delivering state-of-the-art recommendation algorithms across our platform to serve our customers when looking for similar items in our vast catalog.
 


 Our team collaborates with product and tech teams from OLX, as well as the Motors and Real Estate verticals like Otomoto and Otodom, across the entire EU region. This means that our solutions need to scale to millions of data points and need to be designed to be reused in markets with similar characteristics. We think of experimentation as a tool to learn what our users want. We always start simple and fail fast. This way we can create solutions that can be adapted to every market.
 


 On a typical day, you will be interacting with other members of your cross-functional team. You may collaborate with a data analyst to analyse the results of an A/B test or discuss different alternatives to impact the team’s KPIs with the product manager, or you may have to present your amazing jupyter notebook to other data scientists to collect feedback. In any case, you will find a group of friendly people that want to collaborate with you to improve our platform capabilities and the user experience and ultimately have fun together!
 

 What you will be doing:

 Work in multi-functional teams with people from different backgrounds to build our Recommendations Platform
 Find opportunities where data science will make an impact
 Help to translate business requirements into machine learning models
 Build effective solutions with machine learning
 Bring machine learning services to production together with engineers
 Measure the impact of your models on company goals
 Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders


 Your skills and experience:

 At least 2 to 3 years of professional experience as a MLE
 Good knowledge of the best engineering practices
 Experience with building data pipelines using tools like Spark and Airflow
 Experience with serving machine learning models at scale
 Strong engineering background: excellent knowledge of Python, exposure to other programming languages (Kotlin, Java, etc)
 Experience in using machine learning frameworks in production settings: Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow (or similar)
 Experience using cloud-based architectures for deploying machine learning solutions
 Proficient in English with excellent written and oral communication skills


 Nice to have:

 Experience with Recommender Systems
 Experience participating in projects related to search relevance and ranking
 Solid understanding of AWS and experience using AWS for deploying machine learning solutions
 Exposure to production infrastructure and best DevOps practices: monitoring, alerting, CI/CD, container-orchestrating platforms, and infrastructure-as-code tools (Grafana, Prometheus, Kubernetes, Terraform)

 What we offer:

 Permanent contract
 Annual bonus of 15% of your base salary
 Strengths-based personal career development
 Company mobile phone, MacBook Pro or Windows Dell along with necessary accessories to make your work comfortable
 Competitive compensation and benefits (medical care, sports package, and others)
 Training and conference budget
 The opportunity to learn from each other and become better every day
 A passionate and diverse team of data scientists spanning several tech hubs in Europe and around the world



 A BIT MORE ABOUT US
 

   Check our careers website here.
 

   Discover why you should join the OLX Group Now
 

   Check out our talent, product, engineering and design blogs here
 

   Follow us on Linkedin
 


 We encourage people of all races, ethnicities, disabilities, ages, gender identity or expression, backgrounds and experiences to consider applying for this role. We are committed to building an inclusive culture that seeks out the diverse perspectives and experiences of our people and becomes a company superpower and strategic competitive advantage.
 


 The OLX Group (OLX Group consists of OLX Global B.V. and its affiliated companies) will handle your personal data with care and will process your personal data to assess your fit for the position you are applying for. You can give your consent (optional) to allow us to store your data for up to 12 months after the application process. So that in case you are not fit for the role at stake we can consider you for other suitable roles.
 


 Please refer to our Privacy Statement to find out more about how your application data will be processed.

FUNCTIONS Mission: The Junior Data scientist is responsible for analysing data and gathering insights around different business questions. Create machine learning models and products to optimize business processes and answer the needs Responsibilities: - Participate / lead optimisation projects to improve Operational decisions for different countries - Act as contact between these countries and the central Analytics team - Discuss and identify potential for data-driven improvements - Contribute in Analytical development projects run from the central team - Based on data discovery creates basic understanding of the business questions context - Creates models, mostly Supervised and Unsupervised, that are trained/ tested/ validated trough evaluation methods Requirements: - Bachelor's or Master´s Degree - 1-2 years of relevant experience (with continuously expanding responsibilities) - Experience with R, Python, or equivalent technologies to perform complex statistical analyses on both internal and external data. - General understanding of DBMS, statistics, linear algebra, probability and data structures. - Familiar with database technologies like SQL or others. - General understanding of bias and variance trade-off to avoid over/under fitting. - Several courses or minor education in machine learning is required. - Fluent in English Offer: - Attractive benefits including "retribución flexible". - Flexible working hours and schedules. - Possibility to work remotely (hybrid model). - Unique learning environment. - Career path and opportunity for professional growth - Part of a great Team with passion for Data. - Part of a great Team to transform Business and to become a truly data driven company

Job Description & Summary 

PwC, firma líder mundial en servicios profesionales, se encuentra en un continuo proceso de expansión y crecimiento de sus distintas líneas de negocio. La División de Consulting está compuesta por más de 900 profesionales que ofrecen servicios de consultoría y asesoramiento empresarial en los ámbitos de Mejora de Procesos y de la Función Financiera, Operating Consulting, Asesoramiento y Planificación Estratégica, Analytics y Business Security Solutions. 

El equipo de Data Analytics cuenta con profesionales con más de 10 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos de analítica avanzada y su aplicación a entornos productivos. También se cuenta con una plataforma propia de big data desarrollada con los componentes más actuales a nivel tecnológico que permite un rápido y eficiente desarrollo de modelos analíticos. 

En este contexto, queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data&Analytics profesionales recién titulados para participar en innovadores proyectos para importantes clientes del sector público y privado. 

Los profesionales seleccionados pasarán a formar parte del Hub de PWC en Málaga. Este Hub es el Centro de Excelencia de tecnologías de Big Data & Analytics de PWC en España. Está formado por un equipo multidisciplinar de profesionales de primer nivel, incluyendo Arquitectos Software, Big Data y de Datos, Data Scientist, desarrolladores especializados en Frontend, Backend y Full Stacks, expertos en UX, y especialistas en plataformas Cloud, dando soporte tanto a necesidades internas de la compañía como a proyectos para terceros. 

En este centro se ha desarrollado y se gestiona un stack completo de Big Data que facilita el trabajo y análisis con grandes volúmenes de datos de forma rápida e intuitiva, lo que facilita la obtención de Insights monetizables por parte de los usuarios del mismo. 

Requisitos 

Estudiantes de último curso de Grado/Postgrado o perfiles de recién graduados, abarcando un amplio abanico de titulaciones: 


Ingenierías (Informática, Telecomunicaciones, etc.). 
Dobles titulaciones de ADE + Ingeniería; Matemáticas + Ing. Informática (o similares). 
Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Física. 


Es IMPRESCINDIBLE tener la titulación finalizada en mayo/junio d 2021 (incluyendo el Proyecto Fin de Grado o Máster) para poder incorporarse. No obstante, ten en cuenta que puedes participar en nuestro proceso de selección sin haber finalizado los estudios. 

¡Te recomendamos que no demores tu participación! 

Otros requisitos: 


  - Nivel de inglés medio - alto. 
  

Valoraremos positivamente un buen expediente académico y carrera cursada según cronología del plan de estudios. 
Valoraremos prácticas en empresa, estancias internacionales (Erasmus) y conocimiento de otros idiomas. 
No requerimos experiencia, pero sí ganas de aprender.

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
 


   The Quantitative Biology and Biophysics Department in Lilly Research Laboratories is seeking a highly experienced 
  in vitro pharmacologist to join our team located at Alcobendas (Madrid), Spain.
 


   SUMMARY OF THE POSITION
 

   The successful candidate will:
 

 Provide support and expertise to drug discovery programs across different therapeutic areas, from target validation to clinical candidate selection.
 Lead project strategy and direction in collaboration with the Therapeutic Area, Chemistry and Structural Biology.
 Determine workflows for hit identification and confirmation.
 Investigate molecular mechanisms leading to pharmacological effect as well as the mode of action of compounds at cellular level.
 Design workplans for target enablement as well as flow-schemes for project progression
 Follow up clinical observations and work backward to uncover their mechanistic basis.
 Participate on multidisciplinary teams, presenting scientific data in support of research projects.



   QUALIFICATIONS
 

   Required Education and Experience:
 

 A Ph.D. is required in biochemistry, cell biology, molecular pharmacology or related disciplines, with a strong publication record.
 Extensive knowledge in mechanistic pharmacology, biochemistry and cell biology.
 Demonstrated experience in Molecular Biology and cell engineering.
 Solid understanding of the drug discovery process.
 Strong capability to collaborate with scientist in multiple disciplines
 Excellent oral and written communication skills
 Strong work ethic. Scientific curiosity. Can do, will do attitude.



   Additional desired skills:
 

 Postdoctoral experience in biological sciences would be considered an advantage.
 Experience in the biology of multiple target classes (enzymes, GPCRs, NHRs, transcription factors …) is highly desirable.
 Experience/knowledge in one or more of the following therapeutic areas: Oncology, Immunology, Cardiovascular, Metabolic Diseases, and Neurosciences.
 Previous positions in biotech or pharma industry would be considered a plus.

 Our team within Ikea
 
 We’re the ones who make it possible for people to have a smarter life at home and a hassle-free and rewarding shopping experience. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. We like to think of ourselves as innovative and modern, and we believe that nothing would actually work without us.

We are looking for a Data Science Intern with good programming skills and business oriented. This new team member will be instrumental in growing our business internationally as we continue to make the retail world a better, more sustainable place. 
At Nextail, we empower retailers to create better experiences while using fewer of the world's resources. The cloud-based platform uses artificial intelligence, prescriptive analytics, and optimization to deliver agile merchandising decisions. To date, we’re backed by more than $12M in funding from leading venture capital investors and are working with global retailers like Versace, River Island, and Pepe Jeans.   The DS Team is part of the Product Team, our goal is to multiply the impact of our product on the business. Data Science Techniques, AI, ML, Optimisation, Simulation, Visualization, are the tools we always have at hand when we face a problem, but we will never use them in vain. We work together with Product Managers, Developers, Data Engineers and Business Experts to solve the end-to-end problem.  


The ideal candidate has a STEM background. We are looking for someone that is curious, analytical and proactive.  


You will be: 

Supporting with data analysis for different clients. 
Collaborating on the development and evolution of DS solutions with experienced data scientists. 
Evaluating the quality and identifying the areas of improvement for DS solutions. 
You will learn about product data science development methodologies, like data ops and agile data science, but also about product discovery and delivery. 

We offer: 

High flexibility: We’re strong believers that what matters most are results. Each Nextailer is empowered, through trust and ownership, to organize their time as they see fit without jeopardizing the time or work of their colleagues. 
Remote-first philosophy: Nextail started as a remote company and continues to offer a nice mix of remote and/or office-based environments around the world. 
International environment: We operate across the globe, with recent operations reaching from Europe all the way to Australia, and our team alone consists of professionals of more than 15 different nationalities. While many of us are multilingual, our working language is English. 
Diversity on all levels: United as a single team, we celebrate diversity at every dimension*. Professionally speaking, are you ready to work alongside tech geniuses, data science magicians, and fashionistas? You’ll have teammates with extensive experience in a wide variety of professional fields, including technology, retail, consulting, and entrepreneurship. 
The laptop of your choice: We want you to work with the tools that are most comfortable for you! 
Paid internship: The internship will be compensated with 800 gross euros per month. 






You must have the ability to work through University “Convenio” and ideally be able to work full-time once internship finishes. 
You are graduating in engineering, mathematics or a similar degree. 
You have proficiency in English (other languages will be a plus). 
You come with a strong mathematical background: statistics, probability, and ideally operations research. 
Knowledge and/or experience in mathematical modelling and solving business problems will be a plus. 
Strong communication skills, being able to communicate complex things in a simple way. 
True interest in programming.



 Nextail is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. 

To all recruitment agencies: Nextail does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Nextail employees or any other organization location. Nextail is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Descripción de la empresa
  ¿Qué es MIOTI Tech & Business School?
 MIOTI es el primer instituto tecnológico aplicado a los negocios, lo que lo convierte en pionero en el sector y referente en formación especializada en Data Science, Internet of Things y eBusiness. Nuestro propósito es formar a personas y empresas en las habilidades tecnológicas más demandadas en el futuro.
 Somos expertos en formación tecnológica en España y Latinoamérica. Nos acompañan los mejores profesionales del sector. Nuestra metodología es única, Learning By Doing - 100% Aprendizaje, 0% Postureo, así ofrecemos a nuestros alumnos una formación experiencial única y hacemos realidad el desarrollo de proyectos tecnológicos con impacto real en la economía digital.
 Y qué mejor forma de aplicar tecnología a los negocios que desarrollar nosotros mismos proyectos de datos para nuestros clientes desde nuestro departamento MIOTI Consulting Services aplicando todas las tecnologías y herramientas en las que formamos.
 En MIOTI Consulting Services ayudamos a nuestros clientes a generar su estrategia de datos IA y aplicarla para capturar valor. Evaluando el estado de sus datos, identificando qué procesos hay que rediseñar y por qué, rediseñando su arquitectura y gobierno de los datos, integrando la inteligencia artificial en la toma de decisiones, desarrollando conocimientos y habilidades en los equipos orientados a la toma de decisiones.
 Nuestro mejor activo son las personas, contamos con un equipo jóven, inclusivo y multicultural que trabaja en lo que ama y que logra cumplir todos los objetivos que se plantean, gracias a una organización horizontal y una cultura empresarial única. Distintos perfiles profesionales se complementan y colaboran entre sí, favoreciendo un ambiente y un flujo de trabajo eficiente, dinámico y muy positivo.
 Somos un instituto en continuo crecimiento y tenemos muy claro que para alcanzar el éxito necesitamos el mejor talento. Nuestros equipos están formados por personas altamente especializadas que trabajan mano a mano todos los días para alcanzar el reconocimiento de nuestros alumnos y clientes y crecer con ellos.



 Descripción del empleo
  Funciones del puesto:

 Análisis de datos y preprocesado de información

 Grado en carreras STEM, Matemáticas, Estadística, ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o Informática

 Información adicional

 Participar de forma activa en el diseño de un producto tanto en la parte de desarrollo de software como de negocio.
 Grandes compañeros con los aprender y trabajar.

 Beneficios sociales de la empresa (seguro de salud, tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte, etc...)

Who We Are
 Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K's portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Cat Daddy, Cloud Chamber, and HB Studios.  Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, problem solvers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically-acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, BioShock, Borderlands, Mafia, PGA2K, Sid Meier's Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM.

Our goal is to develop leaders, testers and associates to meet a constantly evolving and growing studio environment. 2K Madrid's diversity and ambition calls for innovative, pioneering new content and approaches to training. This is an exceptional opportunity and an exciting moment to support and shape the success of training across QA studios.  While this is an individual contributor role, you will work in close partnership with HR, management and leadership development professionals. You will need strong learning and listening skills to rapidly integrate with the culture, and the professional experience to partner with management. This position reports to the Learning & Development Specialist and/or HR Manager. This role is in office 100% of the time.

Facilitate and lead the New Hire Orientation process for training new hires on what we value, policies, procedures and benefits
Train new hires during the first week on how to apply tools and processes for bug testing
Create and update training using the best training methods for a specific purpose or audience

Be a SME in post-learning tests to measure levels of understanding and retention of employees who recently underwent a training program
Coach and support employees through planning and delivering training programs to various group sizes ranging from individual to large groups
Facilitate various Employee Development initiatives and projects to realign the department with our strategy
Meticulously coordinate the full cycle of administrative details surrounding facilitating training space, materials and participants needs
Work in a timely manner and provide valuable input on projects to enhance and customize training processes to exceed operational needs
Diligently provide regular detailed status reports to teams while providing recommendations on corrective actions
Enjoy staying ahead of the curve when it comes to Development, Adult Learning trends, and standard methodologies
Audit training records and progress in the LMS for QA studios

As a team member, you will…

Be the epitome of a great teammate who jumps at the opportunity to lend a hand to their colleagues
Exude your upbeat energy and passion each day
Align your values with the Values of 2K
Be a role model for our organizational culture by creating a positive impact at every touchpoint with people, with every word you say or put in print and everything you do
Communicate in a fashion that is respectful and well understood
Build and sustain working relationships with internal business partners across the organization and external contacts
Collaborate with your peers and partners to add to the collective innovative thinking that can drive new training opportunities
Actively participate in company events as part of our overall commitment to excellence

Passion for learning and development

Ability to handle multiple assignments, assess and analyze data
Outstanding organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management, project management, public speaking, and problem-solving skills
Motivated, results-oriented self-starter with acute attention to detail
Ability to problem solve, deal with ambiguity successfully and accept change in a fast-paced studio
Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly evolving priorities with enthusiasm
Good judgment with ability to make timely and sound decisions
Physical requirements include the ability to lift up to 25 lbs. unassisted or assisted occasionally, stand, sit and walk for prolonged periods of time, climb, crouch, reach, bend at the waist and move between floors to offices

Undergraduate Degree in a related field

Knowledge about learning management systems, instructional design and e-learning platforms
Extensive experience building and maintaining relationships with management and colleagues

The Infrastructure Quantitative Engineering group uses statistical and machine learning techniques to support the operations and enable the continued growth of Facebook’s infrastructure. We partner with teams supporting all of Facebook’s infrastructure, focusing on long-term strategic initiatives that make Facebook infrastructure more efficient, reliable, and scalable. We are “full-stack” data scientists, helping to establish product requirements, gather data, design experiments, create models, build software tools and communicate findings. We are looking for hands-on experienced data scientists who can collaborate effectively with partner engineering organizations, fellow data scientists and leadership. 
  As a Research Data Scientist, you will need to develop subject matter expertise, build trust with partners, recognize the biggest opportunities, create and drive strategy, and leverage data science methodologies to solve hard problems. In your work, you may provide guidance and coordinate with other data scientists to help achieve the goals in broad areas of operation.
 


Research Data Scientist Responsibilities:  

Identify how data science can be applied to improve, optimize, and expand Facebook’s infrastructure across a variety of domains, with emphasis on long-term and strategic initiatives.
 Work cross-functionally as a strategic partner to define priorities and develop project roadmaps in synergy with partner teams. Build consensus and earn commitment from partners. Drive execution through fast iteration.
 Ensure coordination of theirs and others’ projects across related workflows, to maximize impact and avoid duplication and overlaps.
 Employ languages and tools like Python, R, SQL, and others to drive efficient data exploration and modeling.
 Build pragmatic, scalable, and statistically rigorous solutions to large-scale web, mobile and data infrastructure problems by leveraging or developing statistical and machine learning methodologies.
 Generalize methodologies for broader application within and outside their domain.
 Lead and provide technical mentorship to data scientists, to ensure continuous up-leveling of our expertise.




Minimum Qualifications: 

 Degree in quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research or other related field)
 6+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis including experience with SQL, other programming languages (e.g, Python) or statistical/mathematical software (e.g, R, SAS, MATLAB)
 6+ years of experience with statistics methods such as forecasting, time series, hypothesis testing, classification, clustering or regression analysis
 4+ years experience developing production software systems such as data pipelines, deployed machine learning models, or dashboards
 Experience answering big picture questions by framing the question, turning it into an analytical plan, executing and communicating to stakeholders
 Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance




Preferred Qualifications: 

 Advanced degree (Master’s or PhD or equivalent experience) in quantitative field
 4+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis and working with distributed (i.e. Hive, Hadoop or similar databases) or highly complex datasets
 4+ years experience communicating complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
 2+ years experience leading teams of other data scientists

If you want to know more about Big Data, artificial intelligence or machine learning and how they are changing the world, your place is here! We are an engineering and innovation company working in different areas. Within the IT sector we have reinvented the future of data, integrating the most advanced techniques in artificial intelligence, machine learning, cognitive services (IBM Watson, AWS AI, Google AI, etc.), and big data architectures to respond to the needs of a society that is evolving more and more rapidly.  You will be part of our Big Data team whose mission is to participate in projects of design and development of programs for data consolidation and analysis. You will collaborate with leading professionals in data analysis and processing, as well as in advanced research of statistical models, machine learning approaches and data mining algorithms to improve intelligent machine technology.





DO YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM?

 NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4j)

 Python

 Join our GMV team and culture by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.

 Join our team activities, events and sports competitions.
