job_title: COLT Global Digital Supply Chains Data Scientist
job_summary:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.
  
 What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our 
  
   Hybrid Work Model
  .
 


   Job Description
 


   Position Purpose
 

 To assist with continuous transformation of data into insights and the development/implementation of advance analytics models to be integrated in the Supply Chain Control Tower as part of COLT Phase II
 To develop models to predict, classify, cluster, optimize, prescribe, etc. to be integrated into productionize systems and MVPs to provide useful insights to the end users
 To identify new sources of data, work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers on the cleaning and preparation of the raw data to be used in enterprise tools and provide useful insights.
 To work closely with IT, Digital Brambles teams and 3rd party companies to ensure the delivery of Supply Chain Control Tower use cases in regards of advanced analytics models and insights coming from data.



   Major/Key Accountabilities
 

 To assist with continuous transformation of data into insights and the development/implementation of advance analytics models that will be integrated in the Supply Chain Control Tower.
 To evaluate how to use data to extract key trends, predict key indicators and identify business opportunities/risks. Merge this information with CHEP specific business knowledge and develop actionable business insights in line with Supply Chain Control Tower use cases
 Work on data science projects from end to end - responsible for the design, development and execution
 Perform exploratory data analysis and work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers on the cleaning and preparation of data to be used in enterprise tools and provide useful insights to the business.
 Learn about current data available and propose new data sources to current situation.
 Devise testing and execute proof of concept models in line with the SOF “Test, Learn, Pivot or Build”. Work in an agile and iterative way.
 To work closely with IT and Digital Brambles teams to ensure the delivery of Supply Chain Control Tower use cases in regards of advanced analytics models and insights coming from data.
 Work closely with all internal stakeholders
 Ensure best practices implementation to improve service to business stakeholders
 Present ideas, results etc. in a clear manner to stakeholders



   Measures
 

 Delivery of Supply Chain Control Tower use cases on a timely manner and within budget as part of COLT Phase II.
 Works with cross functional teams to develop solutions in a scalable way, standard and automated.
 Ensure model accuracy and similar KPI metrics depending on algorithm applied.
 Ensure solutions created are aligned with Supply Chain Control Tower and COLT strategy
 Internal customers satisfaction



   Authority/ Decision Making
 

 Decisions in line with project delivery



   Experience
 

 3+ years of experience in a Data Science role or managing / analyzing large Data sets in a complex, multinational environment
 Proven experience with SQL and databases
 Proficiency in programing languages required: Python or R.
 Any other skills with AWS (or other cloud like Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud), Databricks, Apache Spark, is a plus.
 Visualization tools: Power BI or Tableau.
 Proved experience with Project Management (manage priorities, standardization, automation, troubleshooting and long-term planning).
 Experience with change management
 Supply chain knowledge is desirable.



   Skills and Knowledge
 

 MS or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
 Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms.
 Knowledge of implementing Data Science or Machine Learning algorithms.
 Experience with common statistical techniques and data science toolkits.
 Great communication and influencing skills, with the ability to utilize data to justify business decisions.
 Strong quantitative and analytical skills and experience with data visualization tools.
 Proficiency in using query languages (i.e. SQL) and big data analytics

job_summary:
IMDEA Materials Institute is a public research organization founded in 2007 by Madrid’s regional government to carry out research of excellence in Material Science and Engineering by attracting talent from all over the world to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment. IMDEA Materials has grown rapidly since its foundation and currently includes more than 120 researchers from 22 nationalities and has become one of the leading research centers in materials in Europe which has received the María de Maeztu seal of excellence from the Spanish government. The research activities have been focused on the areas of materials for transport, energy, and health care and the Institute has state-of-the-art facilities for processing, characterization and simulation of advanced materials. More information can be found at https://materials.imdea.org/
 

DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a person capable of implementing from scratch a data collection system based on open source. Once the system is implemented, will perform data modeling and analysis and preparation. Data preparation includes cleaning, aggregating, and manipulating to accommodate certain types of processing. Analysis requires the development and use of algorithms, analyzes, and AI models. It leverages software that combines data to find patterns and transform those patterns into predictions that support business decision making. The accuracy of these predictions should be verified through scientifically designed tests and experiments. And the results need to be skillfully shared with data visualization tools that allow everyone to find patterns and understand trends.

REQUIREMENTS

Degree in Computer Science Demonstrable database knowledge.
 Command of spoken English is mandatory.
 It will be valued: Knowledge of Grafana, InfluxDB, SQL Server and HPC.
 Candidates must be:

 Be over 16 years of age and under 30 years of age.
 Be registered as an unemployed job seeker in one of the employment offices of the Community of Madrid.

 The curriculum assessment will be carried out using the blind curriculum vitae procedure, ensuring the principle of non-discrimination. Candidates must ONLY submit their CV (in English) following precisely these indications:

 It must not include any personal data except (1) initials of their first and last name(s), (2) year of birth, (3) DNI/NIE number, (4) telephone number and (5) e-mail address that does not contain the first name, surname or any other personal data.
 It must not contain a photograph.

 Candidatures that do not comply with this requirement will not be considered.

CONDITIONS

This contract will be funded by the Call for grants for implementing the INVESTIGO programme within the framework of the Recovery, Transformation and Resilience Plan - funded by the European Union - NextGenerationEU.
 Este contrato estará financiado mediante la Convocatoria de subvenciones para la realización del programa INVESTIGO, en el marco del plan de recuperación, transformación y resiliencia – financiado por la Unión Europea – NextGenerationEU.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

 The working language of the Institute is English. Full command of the English language is required in all positions.

 IMDEA Materials Institute is committed to equal opportunities, diversity and the promotion of a healthy work environment and work-life balance. Female applicants are encouraged to apply to our research and technical positions. See our Gender Equality Plan here.

 Applications are processed upon reception. The position might be closed once the minimum publication days have passed, so we encourage early application.

 Besides on-the-job technical training, IMDEA Materials Institute is committed to training the Institute’s scientists and staff in “soft” or transversal skills. See the available training here.
 Meet some of our alumni.

SOFT SKILLS

Preferred knowledge/skills, education, and experience:

 So, if that opportunity you are looking for is related to working with latest technologies, the opportunity to meet great people (and professionals) and to grow by helping the company to grow, Congratulations! you have come to the right place. 

 Below, you will learn more about what we do, what we offer and what we are looking for. Don’t hesitate to contact us and send us your resume. 

 What we do 

 We help Network Operators and Service Providers to bridge the gap between legacy and innovative technologies with convergence, integration, migration and automation services. We develop and deliver customised services and products that enhance, strengthen and automate business processes and provide new levels of efficiency. Our expert guidance is based on real understanding of business, environment and challenges, knowledge of new technologies and passion for its endless customisable applications. 

 Sounds good, doesn’t it? To achieve our objectives, we created a methodology based on the combination of innovative technologies (such as Cloud, 5G, IoT, Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning and Big Data), with our solid expertise in Telecommunications (planning, design, optimisation and automation of networks). 

 For more information about our services and products, keep browsing our website. 

 Position Summary 

 On this occasion, we are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Network Intelligence area. As a Future Connections Engineer, you will be part of a multidisciplinary team of Telco engineers and SW and you will be the point person in the front-end development of the different projects we work on. 

 As a data scientist you will work on creating and training machine learning models; implement, test and optimise the algorithms associated with the mathematical models created; solve problems analytically… working with Telecommunications data. 

 Anything else? Of course! You will always work on projects for the main wireless operators in Spain and Europe. 

 The position is based in Spain, and with our flexible working model you can choose whether you want it to be 100% remote, hybrid or office-based. 

 Requirements

2 years relevant experience in Data Science related works. 
Professional experience with Python, Tensorflow, SQL and NoSQL databases. 
Experience in develop and training Machine Learning models 
We value experience in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), Linux, Kubernetes, Docker, etc. 
Level B2 or higher of English (spoken and written) 
A valid EU work permit will be required. 
Benefits 

 Competitive salary and Health insuranceas an enterprise benefit 

Annual training budget per employee: being up to date in technologies is essential for us so we help you keep learning. Your professional development is our success. 

Time flexibility: our life is not just a working day; we give you flexibility both in entry and exit. In addition, we enjoy a reduced working day on Fridays and August. 
Our projects are cutting-edge both in technologyand work environment, allowing you to further develop doing things that only a few could do. 
We work in both national and international environments, making your growth global. 

We are committed to a flexible working model: remote, hybrid or office-based, you can choose what best suits your personal and professional needs (within Spain). 
Our employee satisfaction survey tell us that we have a great work environment and great professionals in the company. Do you want to check it out? Join us!

At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our 35,000 employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
 


   The successful candidate will:
 


 Keep safety as top priority at any time, striving to maintain a strong safety culture.
 Formulate hypothesis, design and synthetize novel small molecules to engage disease modifying targets and contribute decisively to the advancement of drug discovery programs from early lead generation to submission of candidate drugs to the clinic.
 Leverage world-class structure-based drug design technologies and partner with expert colleagues in computational chemistry and biophysics to characterize protein-ligand interactions and gain key insights supporting de-novo molecular design.
 Optimize lead compounds to improve potency, selectivity, physicochemical properties and ADMET to meet the desired target product profiles required to invent high-quality medicines.
 Deliver high laboratory synthetic productivity to inform fast-paced SAR iterations through proposal and execution of synthetic routes.
 Team up with colleagues specialized in high-throughput automated synthesis, route optimization and scale-up to maximize the overall efficiency and productivity of the group.
 Reach out across disciplines to interact and collaborate with scientists in areas like pharmacology, translational science, ADME, toxicology and legal to address specific program needs, increase overall business acuity and provide them with Medicinal Chemistry perspectives.



   QUALIFICATIONS:
 


   Required Education and Experience:
 


 PhD in Organic or Medicinal Chemistry with 2+ years’ post-graduation medicinal chemistry or small molecule organic synthesis experience in pharmaceutical, biotechnology or academic environments, or MS in Organic or Medicinal Chemistry with 5+ years’ experience.
 Strong Synthetic Organic Chemistry skills with deep and extensive working knowledge of modern synthetic chemistry methodologies, experimental work, isolation/purification techniques and structural analysis of synthetic organic molecules. Ability to maintain awareness of latest literature of chemical transformations.
 Scientific creativity and ability to work independently solving problems through careful experimental design, analysis of complex data sets and mechanistic insight.
 Robust track record of scientific contributions including peer reviewed publications, patents and presentations.
 Excellent English language oral and written communication skills, ability to engage highly effectively as team player in a multidisciplinary and international environment.
 Excellent collaboration skills, strong attention to detail, strong problem-solving capacity, a high level of learning agility, ability to work across functions and within a global and matrixed organization.



   Additional skills:
 

 Medicinal Chemistry expertise in pharmaceutical, biotechnology or academic environments, with strong knowledge of Drug Discovery will be highly valued.
 Command of scientific informatics and data visualization tools to undertake computationally enabled multi-property optimization approaches will be advantageous.
 Ability to lead projects and initiatives, coordinating multiple scientific activities and team members simultaneously across various sites.

We are TravelPerk: a scaling unicorn valued at $1.3billion that has raised over $400m since our creation in 2015.
 Backed by world-class investors with portfolios including AirBnb, Stripe, Slack, Trello, Gusto, Twitter, Farfetch and Deliveroo, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel and technology industries.
 Over the past few years, we've been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We're revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion— to connect people in real life in an enjoyable and sustainable way.
 TravelPerk are innovators. During the last year we have welcomed and acquired the likes of Click Travel, NexTravel and Albatross to the team. From TravelCare, to FlexiPerk and of course GreenPerk we are shaping the future of the industry. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that's where you come in!If you're ready to take off with us, keep reading!
 If you're ready to take off with us, keep reading!
 As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be one of the first members of the Data Science function within the Data Team at Travelperk, contributing to building an area that focuses on key business and product problems. This is a key new position in TravelPerk and as such, we're looking for a highly motivated senior professional who is able to work closely with stakeholders and peers to truly understand our customers, data, tools and ways of working so that we're able to leverage data science practices, build out a team and help TravelPerk succeed in our product and geo growth. 
What you will do:

Help to define our Data Science Strategy by identifying opportunities within Travelperk
Manage the entire lifecycle of Data Science projects: discovery and research, evaluation, implementation, deployment, monitoring and iteration.
Design and build statistical models and algorithms to solve and optimize critical business and product challenges
Work side by side with Data Analysts and Engineers to build and deliver high-impact data products

What you need:

6+ years of experience as a Data Scientist
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English
Excellent analytical skills

You will need to prove the following:

Experience with a broad set of statistical and machine learning methods to solve and optimize critical business and product challenges
Experience in building models, from design to deployment
Proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with data visualisation & BI tools (ie Looker, Tableau)
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals

What do we offer?

Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Generous vacation days so you can rest and recharge
Health perks such as private healthcare or gym allowance depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary
Flexibility to work from home most of the time with core hours
Unforgettable TravelPerk events including to travel to one of our hubs
Udemy for business account to continue your development
Mental health support tool for your wellbeing
Exponential growth opportunities

Flexible Work Policy

You will need to be based in one of our hub countries, some positions are only open in specific locations
We will require you to travel to the office hub in your country once or twice per week depending on your position
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team
We have flexible working hours to fit around your life
Team members that want to go to the office more are welcome to!

For certain positions we can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, please let us know in your applications and we will assess whether this is possible. English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

Company Description
  Join a movement in which everyone can win. We started a movement in which everyone can win – shoppers, retailers, society and every person on our team. To play fair, trust people and reward them for doing the right thing. We see and feel the impact of our work as more and more people gain financial freedom and retailers grow across the globe.  Founded five years ago in Sydney, Australia, Afterpay (known as Clearpay in the UK & EU) has millions of active customers and is offered by the world’s best retailers around the world including Boohoo, ASOS, Marks & Spencer, JD Sports and many others. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins.  Afterpay is completely free for customers who pay on time – helping people spend responsibly without incurring interest, fees or extended debt. Afterpay empowers customers to access the things they want and need, while still allowing them to maintain financial wellness and control, by splitting payments in four, for both online and in-store purchases. Afterpay is deeply committed to delivering positive outcomes for customers. We are focused on supporting our community of shoppers.  Afterpay has recently been acquired by Block Inc. Block is made up of Square, Afterpay, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL and TBD. One company built from many blocks, all united by the same purpose of economic empowerment.



 Job Description
  As Clearpay's Sales & Marketing Data Scientist, you'll work with our Sales and Marketing teams to drive optimal decision making and support our growth through in-depth quantitative analyses.
 You are just as comfortable diving deep into data sets to deliver detailed and well-structured models and analyses as you are turning around scrappy but well thought out insights to support a fast-moving business. You will succeed by combining analytical insight, technical proficiency, business acumen, and the ability to collaborate and influence your key partners and cross-functional teams.
 You Will:

 Deliver strategic insights to the EU Sales & Client Success teams to drive optimal decision making and support our growth
 Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs relative to both insights and self-service capabilities. Proactively propose, develop and deploy scalable solutions
 Assist the Sales team in developing methodologies and frameworks to accurately assess and measure the projected and realized business impact of various operational strategies
 Partner with our Marketing team to help them understand the performance of their campaigns and deepen their knowledge of our consumer franchise
 Deliver the analyses & meaningful insights to understand regional marketing efficiency/ROI and to help improve marketing effectiveness.
 Collaborate with other data scientists and analysts globally to formulate innovative solutions for advanced features and models
 Lead and support various ad hoc projects, as needed




 Qualifications
 

 Bachelor's/ Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent practical experience.
 3+ years of relevant experience
 Solid grounding in SQL and preferably another language (Python/R)
 Work experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.
 Good communication and organization skills, with the ability to take complex, fuzzy problems and boil them down into concise and actionable insights.
 Work experience in payments or e-commerce is an advantage but not essential.

About the role
At Cognizant we are looking for a Sr. Data Scientist with strong experience in deep learning models for natural language processing (NLP) to lead the design, training and deployment of large-scale machine learning solutions for a wide range of clients and business areas.
Key Responsibilities:

Technical coordination and support to a team of more junior data scientists.

Text pre-processing and data augmentation techniques.

The global financial ecosystem is changing. Revolutionary blockchain technology has unlocked the potential for people around the world to have more equal access to wealth and information. This transformation has begun with the mass global adoption of cryptocurrencies but like all new financial systems, it needs greater trust to realize its full potential and remain safe from bad actors. That's where we come in. The Chainalysis blockchain data platform enables businesses, governments, and banks to solve the world's most high-profile criminal cases, paving the way for an economy built on blockchains. 

The team of investigators at Chainalysis are world-class problem solvers adept at conducting complex cryptocurrency investigations. We utilize our cutting-edge capabilities and skills to provide advanced support to our customers, helping them disrupt illicit activity on the blockchain.
 Investigators are equal parts technical knowledge, tenacity, and intuition. As a Chainalysis Investigator you will measure your success by your impact on our customers' mission and the execution and expansion of investigation support at our key customers.
 In one year you'll know you were successful if you've…

Provided technical advice and investigative support for extremely difficult, complex, and highly sensitive investigations especially as they pertain to cryptocurrencies
Become a sought-after and trusted advisor to investigators, analysts, and leadership within your assigned account and provide training and guidance to other investigators and analysts.
Reviewed the adequacy and completeness of investigations and the data collection methods to determine the authenticity, veracity, and pertinence of that data resulting in more thorough investigations
Prepared in-depth summaries of data from extensive research and analysis to set forth recommendations for investigations, lead follow up, and potential risks that could hamper an investigation that have led to meaningful results related to the customer's mission.

Essential Criteria

Prior experience working for or with law enforcement or other government agencies on investigations on complex cryptocurrency investigations relating to darknet markets, cybercrime, fraud or other crime types.
Experience of combining advanced OSINT techniques and threat intelligence to help progress cryptocurrency investigations.
Experience of producing in-depth reports pertaining to cryptocurrency analysis across a variety of blockchains.
Experience of briefing operational teams and senior leaders on both the opportunities and risks in regards to cryptocurrency investigations.
Speaks English and Spanish

Desirable

Experience of working with data scientists and other technical specialists to proactively exploit on and off-chain data.
Experience of producing evidential material relating to cryptocurrency analysis.
Have completed Chainalysis Reactor Certification (CRC) and Chainalysis Investigation Specialist Certification (CISC), or an equivalent qualification.
Experience of analyzing and combining datasets to generate insights and investigative leads.
Spanish passport holder and resident

 You belong here.
 At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. Overview: 
 
   Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,200 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 70 locations on all continents.
 


 Acuity Spatial Genomics, Inc. is commercializing one of the most powerfully advantageous approaches in spatial biology. The Company brings together the premier spatial omics approach with leading-edge data acquisition and analysis capability. The pioneering in situ technology enables examination of some of the most important questions in genomics and gene expression at the single cell and sub-cellular level. We aim to find the best talent in the field to join and contribute to this extraordinary, exciting endeavor becoming a critical member of this groundbreaking opportunity.
 


 As Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing statistical methods for the analysis of spatial genomics data. You will be using statistical and machine learning algorithms this role will develop tools to analyze spatial 3D genomic data and integrate it with other omics sources. On this position you will work closely with software engineers in the analytics team to deliver easy to use reporting tools to help researchers explore, visualize and interpret the results of their datasets.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Develop data mining and machine learning methods to analyze patterns and segregate or group data.
 Analyze performance and optimize solutions to enable analysis of big data.
 Integrate different sources of information with spatial genomics data in statistical models to enrich the data reporting.
 Develop graphical tools using statistical data visualization libraries to analyze the results.
 Architect and implement new solutions and validate new ideas by modifying existing solutions or developing new features.
 Qualifications: 
 
Proficiency in Python.
 Proficiency in statistical modeling and analysis.
 Proficiency in machine learning tools (TensorFlow, Keras, … ) and algorithms.
 Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, pandas, etc.
 Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science (M.S. or Ph.D.) D. (preferred) or Masters with 5 years of experience.


 Additional desirable skills to have:


 Familiarity with C++
 Experience in R Programming
 A solid background in biology
 Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Adapts to changing priorities. Drive for results.
 Embraces effective decision-making skills; uses good judgment and can bring closure to issues.
 Continually demonstrates reliability and delivery of measured results, executed with a sense of urgency.
 Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.
 Good process and people skills.
 Good business acumen with a positive solutions-oriented approach and ability to build productive relationships.

Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families around the world raise amazing children through Playlearning. To help us on this mission we’re looking for an exceptional Data Engineer.
 At Lingokids, we encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. We actively seek to hire individuals with different perspectives, and we are eager to continue diversifying our company's culture. We strive to be an inclusive, supportive place where you can do the best work of your career.
 Our offices are in Madrid, Spain, but the position is open to anyone working remotely. Some overlap with Central European Time is expected though, for those times when a video call is the most efficient way to communicate.
 About the job:
 The Data Engineering team is in charge of the Data Platform, which supports the Analytics needs and data-driven projects of the company. It is built around modern ELT pipelines deployed on AWS and uses Python, Spark, dbt, Redshift, and a wide range of AWS services.
 We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering Squad, where you will support, improve and extend our Data Platform. Your work will empower our Analysts and Data Scientists, enable data-driven Product features, and support the data-centered culture at Lingokids.
 More specifically, based on your experience, you will:

Design, build and support modern and scalable data pipelines using 3rd party platforms or internal solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists, other engineers, and stakeholders to understand what data is required and how best to make it available in our Data Platform.
Support the daily work of our Data Scientists by ensuring they have easy access to data and tools (development environment, notebook instances, etc.).
Write and maintain code to orchestrate our ELT workflows.
Improve the design and data feeding of our Data Lake.
Help and train Data Scientists to optimize SQL queries for performance.
Provide data and infrastructure for building and deploying ML models to production.
Use best practices around CI/CD, automation, testing, and monitoring of analytics pipelines (inspired by DataOps).

About you:
 The ideal teammate for us would be someone who believes that communication, empathy, inquisitiveness, and open-mindedness are fundamental to succeed in any endeavor.
 Ideally, it would help if you had some or all of the following:

Be interested in building a platform that enables our Data Analysts and Data Scientists.
Be fluent in one or more high-level programming languages (Python, Ruby, Java, Scala, or similar).
Be comfortable with analytical SQL.
Be familiar with software development best practices and their applications to Analytics (version control, testing, CI/CD, automation).
Have experience building modern ETL pipelines, possibly at a large scale.
Have experience working with a modern data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Have a self-driven approach to learning new technologies and moving projects forward.

We also consider these as nice to have:

Experience working with Data Scientists and Analysts.
Experience in data quality and governance.
Experience in the BigData ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, PrestoDB, etc.).
Familiarity with infrastructure and automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, or similar).

English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English. And although we don't care about certificates, we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.
 You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. Given the circumstances, we have become a fully remote company. We are firm believers that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.

 Life at Lingokids

Base Compensation Range: (Mid Data Engineer) €45-60k
Ideal starting date: September 12th or 19th


Benefits
 Unlimited remote working: you can choose to work from home indefinitely or attend our Madrid headquarters whenever you feel like it. This position is open to anyone within +/- 2 hours of the CET timezone.
 ️ Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.
 Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.
 Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.
 Professional growth: up to €2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.
 Language lessons: language learning is what we’re all about! We’ll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.
 Health care: we have optional health insurance as flexible retribution and 4 online therapy sessions for free to help your self-awareness and wellbeing.
 Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll.
 Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60€ voucher for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services you like the most.
 Home office setup: you'll have a 400€ voucher to set up your home office and a 35€ monthly allowance for remote expenses.
 Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360º assessment every month.
 If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Calificaciones

job_title: Cyber security: Senior Data Scientist with Statistics expert...
job_summary:
Job Description: 
Description of the job 

A vacancy for a Senior Data Scientist with Statistic expertise (m/f) in Airbus Detection and Response Department has arisen within Airbus (Commercial Aircraft) in Getafe. You will join the Cyber Security Department. 

About Cyber Security in Airbus: 

Security is not an option, be part of it! 
Today, governments, companies and private individuals are increasingly the target of attacks like theft of intellectual property, sensitive information and even money. 
Last year Norton Cybercrime Report estimated a global cost of cybercrime around 150 billion Euros. 
Airbus Group is more and more at risk due to its leading position in the market and the additional risks coming from the Extended Enterprise. We have been facing malware attacks which have become more and more sophisticated over the last months. 
IT Security measures can do a lot, but each of us, as Airbus employees, are the first line of defence. 

What is doing the Detection & Response team: 

Whilst a strong architecture and test initiative is required for protection, there will always be a need for cyber attack detection and response capabilities to ensure security operations and emergency/incident responses. 
Airbus Corporate Detection and Response team has a number of best-in-class missions and objectives including: 

CERT activities such as Threat Intelligence, Threat Hunting & Anticipation and Incident Response 
SOC activities such as strategy for; continuous monitoring, detection, and analysis of potential intrusions in real time and through historical trending on security-relevant data sources to provide situational awareness and reporting on cybersecurity status and incidents. Improving the links between CERT and SOC activities is key to manage and investigate escalated cyber incidents to support in times of declared crisis (managed by crisis team and processes) 


Insider Protection : A user-name and password are no longer sufficient to identify users and ensure all actions performed from internal accounts are legitimate. The Insider protection team is looking at other means such as user activity analysis via innovative technologies to build up a more comprehensive picture of our users and identify the intruders. Traditional enterprises identity based on username and password based credentials with a safe perimeter. As perimeter concept weakens, we need to track user behavior, context (activity, location etc) and device trust, as additional means of risk based user authentication 



Why do we need Insider Protection in Airbus: 

Traditional enterprises identity based on username and password based credentials with a safe perimeter. 
As perimeter concept weakens, we need to track user behaviour , context (activity, location etc) and device trust , as additional means of risk based user authentication . 


Your role: 
Your role as a Senior Data Scientist with Statistic expertise will be to examine data closely to reveal trends, patterns and actionable intel. 
You will lead analysis projects from start to finish including all aspects of data science (e.g. processing, cleaning, verifying the integrity of data used for analysis, statistical analysis, visualisations) and communicating results. 
You will also participate in the set-up of machine learning capability to detect threats and abnormal behaviours applying both supervised and/or unsupervised techniques. 
For this position, a high level of autonomy and pragmatic is required as you will integrate a self organised team. 

You are based in Getafe with some travels to Toulouse. 




Tasks & Accountabilities 

As the successful candidate your main tasks & accountabilities are: 


Participate to the set up a Machine Learning platform and framework 
Design solutions from Mathematical point of view and validate with a hypothesis approach. 
Develop Machine Learning or statistical solutions to reveal cyber threat anomalies 
Ensure the delivery of analysis project end to end from the anomaly case study to the final result analysis restitution into the dashboard and visualisation tools. 
Contribute to the evolution and improvement of the Insider Protection product framework 


T his role will involve some travel to Toulouse and as such you must be able to travel accordingly. 
Required Skills 

We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience: 


Master’s Degree specialised in Information Technology or Mathematics and Statistics 
Strong mathematica l skills (Algorithm design, Bayesian inference and statistical modelling ) 
Research and analytical mindset 
Capacity to transcript from business demand to data models 
Knowledge and experience of machine learning and deep learning, supervised and unsupervised learning. 
Good Knowledge of scripting languages (mainly Python ). 
Agile mindset required, experience in Agile, SAFE & Scrum methodology 
Organised with a proven ability to prioritise workload, meet deadlines, and utilise time effectively 


Good interpersonal and communication skills, works effectively as a team player 
Knowledge and experience in SPLUNK Enterprise Security is a plus 
Experience on Cybersecurity and/or fraud data analysis is a plus 
Experience for cloud platform (G-Suite, AWS, ServiceNow,) is a plus 
Fluent in English 


This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Lingokids' mission is to help 100 million families around the world raise amazing children through playlearning. To help us on this mission we’re looking for an exceptional Business Analytics Manager. The role can be fully remote or based in our sunny Madrid office.
 Our goal
 We’re reinventing early childhood education through an online language learning service for kids. With fresh content - games, books, videos, interactive episodes, etc - every week, we are helping more than 45M families and their children around the world learn English in a fun and effective way.
 Are you ready to Playwork with us?
 The Business Analytics Manager works to improve insight, prioritisation and strategic planning across Lingokids as a whole, giving the business clarity across the different verticals of marketing, growth and engagement. You will lead a team of analysts and data scientists that manage the performance review process, and build our measurement framework and overall reporting. You’ll work closely with the leadership team to understand business strategy and your teammates in the functional analytics teams who have deep insight into their areas.

 Responsibilities

Own the business analytics function and champion data driven approaches within Lingokids. 
Lead a team of data scientists and analysts. Provide your team with guidance, purpose, leadership and direction. 
Give clear insight at the business level, helping manage between competing views from our functional teams like marketing, product or content.
Build strong relationships with key stakeholders such as the leadership team and other parts of the data team, and ensure that the business analytics function has a good understanding of key commercial objectives. 
Ensure your team has the right tools and technologies. 
Hire well and build a high performing business analytics function as the company scales. 
Build our measurement framework - Define what we measure and how it’s reported 
Manage the process to dig into our trade and performance metrics, fixing problems and finding opportunities 
Provide insight and recommendations for cross business initiatives and strategic planning. 

Desired experience

Understanding of digital businesses (particularly subscription), with a history of commercial analysis and reporting
Expert in analysing business problems and communicating insight with senior teams
You enjoy leading others, and can build and coach a high performing team.
You’re a bright, high calibre candidate who enjoys working in a warm, fast-paced and collaborative environment.
You’re driven by solving business problems and making an important contribution to the overall success of the company.




English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English so, we don't care about certificates, but we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.
 You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. We have become a fully remote company so, we believe that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.
 Experience working closely with non-technical stakeholders to refine requirements and bring them to life is a must.
 Life at Lingokids
 Unlimited remote working: you can choose to work from home indefinitely or attend our Madrid headquarters whenever you feel like it. This position is open to anyone within +/- 2 hours of the CET timezone.
 ️ Flexible hours and work-life balance: we care about the results you bring to the team. 9 to 6 and constant commuting is not for us either.
 Stock options: joining Lingokids means you can choose to own part of the company.
 Visa sponsorship: if you need a visa to work in the EU, Lingokids will assist you during the visa process, costs included.
 Professional growth: up to €2.000 per year for conferences, books, and training.
 Language lessons: language learning is what we’re all about! We’ll cover language classes for you to learn Spanish, English or Portuguese.
 Health care: we have optional health insurance as flexible retribution and 4 online therapy sessions for free to help your self-awareness and wellbeing.
 Flexible compensation: you'll be able to include your monthly expenses in meals and transportations into your payroll.
 Meal allowances: every month, you will receive a 60€ voucher for you to spend on the restaurants and food delivery services you like the most.
 Home office setup: you'll have a 400€ voucher to set up your home office and a 35€ monthly allowance for remote expenses.
 Feedback culture: feedback is the breakfast of champions, and we take it seriously! We have a real-time and honest feedback culture, and a formal 360º assessment every 6 months.
 If you think you don't tick all the boxes, we'd still love to hear from you. Nobody checks every box, and we are looking for someone excited to join the team!

Master's degree in fields such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning, TTS, ASR, NLU or Statistical modelling.
 Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, C/C++.



 Job summary
  Our team undertakes research together with multiple organizations to advance the state-of-the-art in speech technologies. We not only work on giving Alexa, the ground-breaking service that powers Echo, her voice, but we also develop cutting-edge technologies with Amazon Studios, the provider of original content for Prime Video. Do you want to be part of the team developing the latest technology that impacts the customer experience of ground-breaking products? Then come join us and make history.
 
 We are looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive Applied Scientist with a background in Machine Learning to help build industry-leading Speech and Language technology. Our mission is to push the envelope in Text-to-Speech (TTS) in order to provide the best-possible experience for our customers.
 
 As an Applied Scientist at Amazon you will work with talented peers to develop novel algorithms and modelling techniques to advance the state of the art in speech synthesis.
 
 Key job responsibilities
 

 Participate in the design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models for text-to-speech applications.
 Participate in research activities including the application and evaluation of text-to-speech techniques for novel applications.
 Research and implement novel ML and statistical approaches to add value to the business.

 A day in the life
  As a scientist in the Amazon TTS team you will be in charge of solving real customer problems, and for that you will need to innovate and think outside of the box.
 
 A normal day will begin with a quick catch-up with the rest of your project mates to make sure nobody is facing any issues, but then it will depend on your goals. 
 
 Some days you will be focusing on your experimentation and research, trying to develop the next generation of Text-to-Speech models, and other days you will be involved in brainstormings and technical discussions with your team or other teams to contribute to the technical plans of a project for the upcoming months.




PhD with specialization in text-to-speech, natural language processing, or machine learning.
 Experience in developing speech synthesis and natural language processing models (e.g., commercial speech products or government speech projects).
 Scientific thinking and the ability to invent, with a track record of peer-reviewed publications.
 Hands on experience with machine learning frameworks such as MXNet, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
 Good written and spoken communication skills.

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Who You'll Work With
You will join our Madrid office for 4-8 weeks during the summer. As a data scientist intern in our McKinsey Analytics team, QuantumBlack , you will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects.
 This global practice supports clients in many different industries facing challenges of developing and implementing tailored concepts for prediction and prescription.
 The applications for the Summer internship 2022 are closed.




What You'll Do
You will focus on the development of advanced analytics models to optimize underlying business problems.
 In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and use that data in creative ways. You will create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations. You will create valuable, transformative business strategies through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data.
 You will apply and advise on state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions. Additionally, you will review, support and advise on the day-to-day analytics requirements of clients’ key operational processes while continually improving the impact of these processes.


 Our Tech Stack
 While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro (check out a Kedro tutorial video here), container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more!





Qualifications


Student in your penultimate year of studies.
 Background in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering.
 0-1 year of professional experience in programming; experience applied to business problems is a plus
 Knowledge in programming (focus on machine learning) Python (must), R (highly valued), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued)
 Statistical knowledge is a plus
 Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
 Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
 Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
 Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization
 Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively
 Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English and Spanish
 Knowledge of other languages including Portuguese, German, French and Italian will be valued

IMMO was founded with two ambitious goals:
 

   To totally reimagine residential real estate, not only how you can improve buying and selling homes, but improving the experience of tenants with a new higher level of customer service that they’ve never had before
 

   Create a working experience that allows employees to astound you with their innovation, passion, and empathy for each other.
 


 Every member of IMMO (or our “IMMORTALS” as we call them), knows that if we are to hit these goals there’s no place for hiding behind a job description or passing the buck. We look for answers, not problems, we act, not react, we work together, not on our own, and we don’t mind failing at something new if we learn something.
 


 Don’t get us wrong, we aren’t perfect, there’s lots for us to improve on, lots to learn, and a heck of a lot to do. If you aren’t someone who likes the uncertainty of not knowing what the answer is, like to hog the limelight instead of sharing it, and don’t have a high level of empathy for others, then that’s fine but we are not going to be right for you.
 
 You Will

 Empower people across the business with easy access to relevant data
 Support Analysts and Data Scientists, so that they can easily iterate through data, set up new ETLs, and execute experiments. 
Help them set up automated reporting and deploy models to production
 Cooperate with software engineers in order to identify and implement the best ways to integrate data from source systems: Considering the business requirements, systems performance and data quality
 As part of the BI & Analytics team build and extend the core data model in our cloud data warehouse: enriching and modelling raw data into the main business dimensions and facts for use in reporting and analytics
 Identify opportunities on how we can use modern tools and methods to automate and optimise our processes and solutions. Drive the adoption of your proposed changes by influencing stakeholders and colleagues
 As the team scales, support on hiring and onboarding of new engineers

 You Have

 A track record creating and managing modern and effective BI & Analytics solutions including data integrations and pipelines, data models and reports. 
Strong experience working with SQL and RDBMS. Ideally, you already worked with or even managed cloud data warehouses like Snowflake or BigQuery. 
Experience with data modelling and maybe already designed your first relational data models for business use.
 Experience with ELT processes. Knowledge of associated tools like Fivetran and DBT is a plus.
 A solid understanding of software design principles and DevOps.
 A self-starter attitude and you are comfortable working autonomously and with teams located across our offices. You are not afraid to get your hands dirty, prioritise your focus based on impact, and are able to own a project from start to finish

 Benefits

 Flexible leave policy
 Flexible working policy, we believe that work is something you do not when you have to do it
 Mental Health Assistance
 A truly collaborative culture where the best ideas win, not the person with the most senior title
 The ability to figure out your own solutions, and the responsibility to implement them
 A culture that is devoid of egos, where People > Product > Profits

Más sobre esta posición
    



      Sabemos que quieres encontrar un lugar que te permita innovar, donde valoren tu talento e impulsen el crecimiento de tu carrera profesional, participando en proyectos globales y enfocados en las últimas tendencias tecnológicas. Todo esto en un entorno flexible y ágil rodeado de excelentes profesionales de todo el mundo… ¡has llegado al lugar correcto!
    

     En la 
     Dirección Corporativa del Dato en MAPFRE estamos buscando un/a Expert Data Scientist que maximice el impacto de Advanced Analytics, centrando los esfuerzos en las líneas de trabajo que mejor contribuyan a la estrategia y a los objetivos de negocio de la compañía. Asesorará a los equipos locales donde lo precisen, y promoverá la compartición de experiencias entre operaciones, apoyando a los países en la identificación de casos de uso que generen impacto económico a corto plazo y relevante, así como en su implementación real.
    





      ¿Qué realizarás en esta posición? 
    



Establecerás los ámbitos de exploración y las líneas maestras de actuación de Advanced Analytics en distintos horizontes temporales.
Acompañarás y asesorarás a los países en el diseño de su roadmap de implantación de casos de uso, impulsando la incorporación de oportunidades que contribuyan a mover la aguja en las compañías. Aportarás definiciones técnicas sobre las distintas funcionalidades y servicios del Ecosistema de Big Data & Analytics.
Atenderás las demandas de los países y les apoyarás en la ejecución y consecución de los objetivos.
Realizarás el control y seguimiento de los portfolios de los países, así como verificar la idoneidad y relevancia de los modelos desarrollados. Controlarás la implantación, evolución, y uso del Ecosistema de Big Data & Analytics.
Identificarás las best practices y los modelos best in class, y divulgarás entre los restantes países para su reutilización y aprovechamiento.
Coordinarás los comités establecidos. Definirás y velarás por la vigencia, aplicación y cumplimiento de las políticas, normativas y metodologías establecidas para garantizar los debidos controles de calidad y de exactitud de la información.
Identificarás tendencias, testearás técnicas o algoritmos novedosos, y propondrás casos de uso en los que aplicarlos.






     ¿Qué necesitamos que sepas? 
    



Diplomatura, Licenciatura o Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, o ADE.
Se valorará tener Máster en Data Science, Análisis de datos, Inteligencia Artificial, Big Data, …
Se valorará tener certificaciones de AWS Certification.
Tener una experiencia superior a 5 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia demostrable en desarrollo e implantación de modelos predictivos end-to-end en proyectos de Data Science:
Aplicación imprescindible de técnicas de machine learning supervisadas y no supervisadas.
Aplicación valorable de deep learning, text mining, analítica de grafos o análisis de Sentimiento.
Experiencia en el análisis y tratamiento de datos, así como en la presentación de resultados.
Experiencia en visualización.
Experiencia en explotación de datos en Ecosistemas Big Data cloud.
Conocimientos en Python.
Conocimiento bases de datos estructurados (Oracle, DB2, …) y no estructurados (BBDD No SQL, Mongo, ...)
Otros lenguajes de programación: Python, R/ Spark/ Scala, SQL, ...
Conocimiento alto de herramientas de visualización: Tableau y Amazon Quicksight.
Conocimiento de tecnologías de Ecosistemas Big Data (Cloudera, Hortonworks, Hadoop HDFS, ...).
Imprescindible alto nivel de inglés, al menos un C1. Se valorará conocimientos en portugués.





     Sobre todo, buscamos una persona proactiva, con iniciativa, con gran motivación por el trabajo orientado al orden y la calidad y precisión técnica, con atención al detalle y buenos dotes de comunicación. Valoraremos el compromiso, el alto sentido de responsabilidad, la orientación al logro y a la resolución de conflictos, el disfrute de trabajar en equipo y la iniciativa. Flexibilidad y adaptabilidad a entornos de trabajo heterogéneos y dinámicos en el tiempo.

Horario flexible, para que lo adaptes a tus necesidades.
Un programa de retribución flexible en el que tendrás: subvención de comida, cheques guardería, seguro médico, seguro de vida, descuentos para empleados, etc. Y si vives en la ciudad de Madrid, tendrás disponible una ruta de autobuses para llegar a la oficina.

Jornada intensiva de verano.
Serás el protagonista de tu ruta de aprendizaje, por lo que contarás con miles de recursos para seguir impulsando tu conocimiento técnico. Además, de forma extra contarás con 1100€ anuales para que puedas ampliar aún más tu expertise.

Brand Manager Larios (Temp.)


What makes this a great opportunity?

JOB OBJECTIVE/ PURPOSE
Brand Manager is accountable for consumer, markets trends-driven, opportunity identification and development of marketing strategies & programs to drive profitable volume growth for Larios TM.
“Lead the development and growth of a brand/s within the Spanish market with a particular focus on gaining brand power and sustainably grow value share”


Role Responsibilities

SCOPE OF ROLE:


The Brand Manager will report directly to the Marketing Manager of White Spirits and also work closely with Larios and MK Team, Media Managers and Research Team as well as other Company departments as Trade Marketing, Finance, logistic…
Essential Responsibilities:


Opportunity Assessment: monitoring of market and consumers to identify and prioritize sustainable growth business opportunities to be addressed.


Brand Strategies: definition and development of strategic paths with local relevance (while ensuring a global perspective// easily implementation).


Brand Plans: the Brand Manager will be also responsible to lead and supervise in detail the implementation of the overall MK Plan managing all variables of an integrated program: trade, finance… to ensure excellence and timely execution.


Tracking and Brand performance analysis: ensure discipline on programs evaluation thru success metrics criteria to allow learnings development and continuous Improvement on brand business performance.


Business Orientation: accountable for Brand P&L (volume, contribution…)


Innovation: to support innovation pipeline and development to assure brand growth (volume & value) upgrading brand quality perception while being coherent with brand positioning


Ensure leadership of its brands within category while improving brand Power growth parameters (Meaningful, Difference)


Ensure P&L targets accomplishment


Gain sustainable scale of new brands/variants generating desire ahead of distribution


Set annual and long-term vision and align with key local & international stakeholders 


Manage brand investments of its brands within the category 


Support development and train of Brand ambassador


Collaborate with international / global teams to leverage best practices, share knowledge and reporting


Develop and maintain a relationship with key internal partners (MK, research, Trade MK, Commercial, Finance, logistic, LT, etc.) and also external stakeholders (agencies, wholesalers, clients, etc.)


SUCCESS CRITERIA




Work requires the analysis of information where the decision/action taken would establish precedent or major change to current operations.


Work requires the identification a resolution of strategic and operating problems requiring extensive cross-functional support and creativity to develop innovative solutions.






Qualifications & Experience

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Education
University Degree. Additional Master will be considered positively
Language
Fluent in both Spanish and English
Experience required

+5 years work experience
+3 years in Marketing Brand Management
Minimum of 3 years in MK solid position in other Market or Company (companies of recognized prestige and references in the marketing area) 

Functional Competencies/Knowledge and skills

Driving Consumer Value


Strong Communication and Presentation Skills


Presentation and speaking (ability to present complex information in a persuasive way to different attendants / ppt. ability)
Writing (ability to capture information and present it in a structured logical way that helps readers arrive to a desired conclusion
High ability to generate close and honest relationships with other areas in the company 
Persuading and negotiating to gain commitment around new opportunities and obtain alignment on projects both internally (System) and externally (resource networks, brand owners, third parties, etc.)


Orientation to problem solving beyond conventional wisdom. Generating creative solutions.
High level of alertness and curiosity towards trends, brands, consumer insight/ behaviors/ passion points.
Sustaining Operational Excellence.
Brand Business Health Analysis.
Optimizing Strategic Relationship and Networks.


 
Travel

Expected around 10% of his/her time spent travelling.


 
PERSONAL QUALITATIVE REQUIREMENTS
The candidate should be (or have):


Intellectually and socially curious and trend seeker: that means to show a general Marketing Passion for brands, markets and consumers (MUST). Always updated in general Marketing should be his way of professional thinking and living.


Marketing Scientist: more strategic oriented than trade marketing experienced.


Thinking Different: always in that strategic orientation should show a quick ability to analyze the main problems and give possible and creative solutions based on data figures that imply common sense (MUST)


Excellent communicator, able to engage and convince the others: being natural leader, emphatic (must).


Good Negotiator: able to manage project internal and externally (Brand Owners, Suppliers…)


People Developer & Team Builder: at least to have the seed and compromise of carrying this direction with all Larios Team Members. Honest & Integrity. (MUST)


Passionate and able to generate that passion in other people (MUST)


Courageous: new ideas and projects defense. Quicker and hustler but with a solid background in the project and a solid head in his shoulder (MUST)


Able to see the big picture of the Company and also the Market (Good Knowledge)


Good Project Manager: preparing the Business Plan and its control are basics


.

¡ÚNETE AL EQUIPO COMO DATA SCIENTIST!
 ¿Quieres formar parte de una organización que apuesta por cuidar de las personas y su crecimiento personal y profesional?
 En Kairós DS buscamos personas con experiencia como Data Scientist para formar parte de nuestra capacidad de Data & IA. Nuestra capacidad de Data & IA es la de más reciente creación. Con credenciales dentro del ámbito de la salud, la ciencia e investigación, medio ambiente y proyectos en banca y seguridad, está liderada por Inés Huertas y crece incorporando perfiles diversos, con mucho que aportar.
 Actualmente buscamos perfiles con diferentes experiencias, desde profesionales más junior a expertos en Data Engineering.
 Nos encanta que nuestras compañeras y compañeros enseñen a los demás y puedan aprender de las personas más expertas, siempre en el mejor ambiente, tanto profesional como personal.
 ¿Quiénes somos?
 Acompañamos a nuestros clientes en proyectos de transformación tecnológica y ágil. Trabajamos en equipos organizados por Capacidades y en squads multidisciplinares en proyectos muy diversos (retail, investigación sanitaria, banca, seguridad, movilidad…).
 Aunque hemos crecido mucho en el último año, no queremos olvidarnos de nuestra esencia, centrados siempre en las personas: hacemos seguimiento personal constante con el equipo técnico y de Talento. Además, apostamos siempre por la transparencia y la claridad.
 Estamos en España, México, EEUU, Perú, Colombia y Singapur. En Kairós DS encontrarás proyectos en los que podrás trabajar desde casa, ¡sin perder la cercanía con el resto del equipo!
 ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?
 Somos empresa Great Place to Work por segundo año consecutivo gracias a nuestros valores, nuestra cultura y a los beneficios e iniciativas internas que lanzamos centradas en las personas. Por ello, en Kairós DS encontrarás: 
Bolsa individual de formación de 1.750 euros, formación continua corporativa y certificaciones técnicas.
 Clases de inglés gratuitas, en grupos reducidos.
 23 días de vacaciones, 24 y 31 de diciembre libres, 1 día para eventos y ¡3 días de libre conciliación!
 Posibilidad de trabajar desde casa.
 Disfrutar del verano con nuestra jornada reducida en agosto y horario intensivo todos los viernes del año.
 Retribución flexible a través de Cobee, para hacer uso en restauración, transporte público, formación y ticket guardería.
 Seguro médico con Cigna o Sanitas: nos preocupamos de tu salud física y mental.
 Acompañamiento psicológico continuo a través de nuestro programa Wellness 3.0 y mentoring técnico constante.
 Paquete de Acciones gratuitas del Grupo Kairós.
 Fortalecimiento de tu marca personal en eventos internos y externos.
 Formar parte de una gran comunidad y contar con el apoyo de personas increíbles y referentes dentro del sector.
 Pero sobre todo... ser parte de una empresa donde se te escucha, se te cuida y donde intentamos hacer todo lo posible por cubrir tus necesidades y expectativas. 
¿Qué harás en tu día a día?
 Como Data Scientist tendrás un papel clave dentro de los proyectos en los que trabajes.
 Éstas serán tus funciones en el día a día:
 Participar en sesiones diarias o semanales de alineamiento con el equipo.
 Idear, identificar mejoras o implementarlas, según proyecto.
 Trabajar mano a mano y de forma coordinada con tu squad.
 Comunicarte periódicamente con tu Head, para trasladar tus necesidades y dibujar tu mapa de crecimiento técnico.
 En los primeros días…
 Asistirás a una sesión de onboarding, en la que conocerás todo sobre Kairós DS y las personas que pueden ayudarte, así como los procesos internos, y podrás hablar directamente con los Heads de tu Capacidad y conocerlos mejor.
 Tendrás oportunidad de preguntar cualquier duda de manera pública o privada para resolver cualquier cuestión que te plantees.
 Te familiarizaras con las diferentes herramientas internas.
 Recibirás tu equipo informático y, poco después, ¡tu kit de bienvenida con regalos Kairoseros!
 Conocerás a tu embajador o embajadora, tu apoyo en el cliente o espacio de trabajo en el que crecerás las primeras semanas.
 A los 3 meses
 Habrás tenido oportunidad de aterrizar poco a poco, conociendo mejor al equipo de trabajo interno o en el cliente en el que estés trabajando.
 Ya habrás recibido notificaciones y publicaciones de comunicación interna, que te habrán ayudado a generar vínculos con la compañía.
 Tendrás una sesión 1:1 con el equipo de Talento para saber cómo están yendo estos primero meses y seguir ayudándote en tu onboarding.
 Podrás asistir a algunas de nuestras meriendas virtuales o presenciales de equipo. 
A los 6 meses
 Habrás terminado tu onboarding y tu adaptación dentro de Kairós DS habrá llegado al 100% aportando todo tu talento y tu valor. 
Habrás tenido oportunidad de participar de manera activa o como asistente en diferentes eventos o formaciones que organizamos.
 A partir de ahora tendrás un seguimiento 1:1 cada 6 meses tanto con el equipo de Talento como con los Heads. 




REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS


 ¿A quién nos gustaría encontrar?
 Estamos buscando personas...
 Buscamos a una persona...
 Con experiencia en librerías de python cómo SpaCy para NLP o Redes Neuronales.
 Con experiencia con Azure.
 Que tenga un nivel intermedio de inglés, que le permita comunicarse sin problemas con el resto del equipo. 
Sería un plus…
 Si tienes certificación en AWS.
 Si tienes experiencia con metodologías Agile.
 Si tienes conocimientos sobre diseño, optimización y normalización de bases de datos relacionales.
 Si tienes conocimientos sobre el diseño y optimización de bases de datos analíticas/ Data Warehouse.
 Si tienes conocimientos sobre creación y explotación de Data Lakes.
 Si tienes conocimientos de bases de datos NoSQL.
 Si tienes experiencia trabajando con SQLAlchemy y Pandas Dataframes e integrándolos para el uso transparente de la capa de acceso a datos en capas de persistencia relacionales.
 Si tienes experiencia trabajando con bases de datos relacionales en entornos de producción.
 Si tienes conocimientos sobre análisis del software (análisis de requisitos, ya que el puesto exige interactuar con "stakeholders" de diferentes áreas de negocio de la empresa, no necesariamente tecnológicas).
 Si tienes conocimientos y/o experiencia en Gobierno del Dato.
 Si tienes conocimientos sobre patrones de diseño del software.
 Si tienes conocimientos y/o experiencia en la creación y consumo de API REST y el servicio de AWS API Gateway.
 Vas a encajar genial si te gusta aprender, compartir tu conocimiento y tratas a la gente con respeto y cariño. Si eres una persona interesada en participar en una cultura abierta, transparente y de confianza y si además, tienes capacidad de organización, responsabilidad y compromiso.
 ¿Cómo es nuestro proceso de selección? 
En Kairós DS velamos en todo momento por cuidar al máximo la experiencia del candidato o candidata y humanizar nuestro proceso de selección. Incorporar a alguien al equipo es algo a lo que le dedicamos tiempo y cariño y nos aseguramos de dar feedback constante. 
Nuestro proceso de selección general suele durar en torno a dos semanas (dependiendo de la disponibilidad de las partes) y consta de estas fases para asegurarnos de la calidad y objetividad del proceso: Siempre apostamos por atraer talento diverso y cultivar un entorno inclusivo que fomente la colaboración y la innovación. Ofrecemos un proceso de selección con igualdad de oportunidades independientemente del sexo, edad, raza, color, religión, orientación sexual, identidad de género, etc.

Data Scientist Coordinator - SCF 
 Boadilla del Monte, Spain 
 
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 

Santander Consumer Finance is looking for a Data Scientist Coordinator, based in our Boadilla del Monte office. 

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY 

At Santander ( www.santander.com ) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us? 

Santander Consumer Finance focuses on business development related to consumer finance products, sales channels and commercial agreements with dealers, vehicle manufacturers or retail distribution establishments, as well as commercial functions associated with direct sales (branches, call centers or digital channels) and indirect sales (through third parties) of consumer finance products. 

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper. 

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING 

As a Data Scientist Coordinator you will help with the design thinking process to detect data explotation business opportunities, communicate those opportunities and results to key stakeholders, and manage a multi-cultural team of data scientists and engineers on diverse projects. 

We need someone like you to help us in different fronts: 

Define data needs from internal or external sources 
Define machine learning models control frame for local models 
Explore large data sets and combine data analytics with programming skills to identify business potentials 
Manage project execution and follow-on delivery validation 
Lead and “Self-execute” end-to-end projects and/ or model development 
Lead the implementation and control of model governance across SCF 
Execute data analysis process, including data cleaning, enhancement, feature extraction, etc. 


EXPERIENCE 

+5 years of hands-on data science experience 
+1/2 years of experience managing data science/big data teams. 


EDUCATION 

Degree MS/PhD in a quantitative field (Engineering, Math, Physics, … ) 
MBA nice to have 


SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE 

Strong working knowledge of regression, classification, clustering, and other standard algorithms 
Strong programming experience in Python and its data science ecosystem (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy) 
Strong knowledge in MLOps infrastructure capabilities (Azure and/ or AWS) 
Good knowledge of BI tools like PowerBI, Tableau, Microstrategy, Spotifier, Qlik, … 


OTHER INFORMATION 

High level of English (C1) 


If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander
