About BSC




      The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, and is a hosting member of the PRACE European distributed supercomputing infrastructure. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 770 staff from 55 countries.
      
 Look at the BSC experience:
       BSC-CNS YouTube Channel
       Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!
     



Context And Mission




      We are looking for a climate scientist to work with both observatioanl datasets and climate projections.
      
 The person appointed will be involved in different EU and applied research projects, with the aim of assessing climate-related indicators and trends for different variables in the European region. The selected candidate will work with observational dataset and state-of-the-art climate projections at both regional and global domain to obtain climate-related indicators and understand their associated trends. This position, therefore, presents the opportunity to work alongside a wide range of leading international climate scientists delivering cutting-edge climate science across Europe. The position holder will enjoy joining one of the leading and most dynamic European groups in the field of climate services.
      
 Successful candidates will benefit from expert training and BSC-CNS staff benefits: an international multidisciplinary scientific environment and advanced applied research training. We encourage applications from highly motivated candidates with demonstrated experience in climate science and interest in applied research projects within the context of climate services.
     



Key Duties




Perform statistical data analyses and disseminate the results in peer-reviewed scientific papers and international conferences
Team work: Interaction with scientists in the group and the department to favor synergies




Requirements




Education 
       
Having a Degree in Physics, Enviromental Sciences, Mathematics (or equivalent) 

Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience 
       
Master student in atmospheric sciences, applied statistics or related field
Experience handling, analysing and validating large climate model datasets
Experience with climatic statistical analyses
Proficiency in scientific programming in a suitable language (e.g. R, Python, Matlab) and familiarity with working in a UNIX environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, especially for scientific publications
Ability to work in a professional environment within a multidisciplinary and international team

Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience 
       
Experience working with climate projections
Knowledge on some of the following topics: statistical downscaling, multi-model combination techniques, bias adjustments techniques or tropical/extratropical teleconnections will be positively evaluated

Competences 
       
Problem-solving, pro-active, result-oriented work attitude
Capability to work in an international and fast-paced work
Good communication skills
 




Conditions





The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
 We offer a full-time contract, a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, tickets restaurant, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures
 Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration 
Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
 Starting date: Quan toqui







Applications procedure and process




       All applications must be made through BSC website and contain:
       


A full CV in English including contact details 
A Cover Letter with a statement of interest in English, including two contacts for further references - Applications without this document will not be considered  In accordance with the OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for every vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will start the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. A profile questionnaire as well as a technical exercise may be required during the process.  The panel will make a final decision and all candidates who had contacts with them will receive a feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.  At BSC we are seeking continuous improvement in our recruitment processes, for any suggestions or feedback/complaints about our Recruitment Processes, please contact recruitment [at] bsc [dot] es.  For more information follow this link







Deadline




       The vacancy will remain open until suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.
      





OTM-R principles for selection processes




       BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment planels and recognizing career breaks etc.
        BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. Director, Insights & Analytics






Location: Barcelona, Spain
Reports to: Head of Data, Insights & Analytics


This is what you will do:
Alexion is looking for a sharp-minded, assertive, and energetic data leader who will be responsible for developing strategies and delivering technical projects/programs to meet the short- and long-term data management goals. They should be able to architect and design analytical solutions to meet demands across the company, driving value from information and ensuring end-to-end delivery. 
This individual will play a critical role in the success of the Alexion organization. S/he will be a highly visible IT leader with an interface to all levels of Alexion leadership. S/he will partner cross-functionally to proactively identify opportunities and to enable better decision making at Alexion. S/he will also support the development of models and predictive analytics to support the global business. The individual must be confident and be an exceptionally strong collaborator, capable of contributing innovative thoughts and ideas to create meaningful value for the functions and for the enterprise.
Alexion is looking to build the next generation of patient-centric data analytic and application platforms and we are looking for a qualified individual whose passion is understanding how to best utilize healthcare data and platforms to drive business innovation.
The candidate needs to be client-oriented, capable of independently developing sophisticated analytical solutions, and skilled at presenting solutions to broad audiences within IT and Business groups. The right candidate for this position should have a proven track record for an international Pharma/Biopharma company. They should have project and team management capabilities, strong technical skills, and the ability to manage vendor relationships and analytics service providers.


In addition, the candidate must stay abreast of new technologies and be willing to present and/or train fellow team members on those technologies. 
S/he must also adopt corporate leader competencies; attract and develop top talent, drive results, possess a strategic mindset, mange ambiguity and complexity, optimize work processes and drive engagement.


You will be responsible for:

Proactively identify opportunities/threats leveraging data and business context to enable better decision making at Alexion
Act as a central point of expertise and drive cross-functional collaboration to provide advice on key strategic questions
Educate executive, business and IT team members about the business value of data management and analytics
Collaborate with leadership and within IT to support cross-functional strategies and tactics using data and derived insights, which contribute directly to the growth and optimization of Alexion’s business
Work with cross functional teams to structure problems, identify appropriate data sources, extract data, and develop integrated information delivery solutions
Working seamlessly with cross-functional subject matter experts within Alexion to drive data management, analytics modeling, and business analysis capabilities
Participate and provide technical leadership in all phases of a project from discovery and planning through implementation and delivery
Evolve analytical platforms, tools, and methods
Responsively provide high quality solutions and answers to ad-hoc analytic requests


 
You will need to have: 

Exceptional verbal and written communication and creative problem-solving skills including the ability to convey analytical insights in actionable business terms 
Highly motivated self-starter with the confidence and ability to present complex information concisely and effectively to all audiences, including senior leaders and groups 
Advanced knowledge and application of analytics, modeling, and valuation concepts in the biopharmaceutical industry
Strong analytical, logical thinking and organizational skills, backed by a logical approach, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously 
Ability to anticipate future business trends and to integrate that context into business practices
Experience leading technical teams and individuals across geographies 
Track record of effective functional and cross-functional collaboration and leadership
Detail-oriented, self-starter, able to work both independently and in a team environment
Experience using web services and pre-built Data Lake architectures
Desire and ability to learn/implement new tools and analytic capabilities
Experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building, and implementing models, using/creating algorithms (forecasting, classification, clustering, decision tree learning, NLP, graph networks, etc.), and creating/running simulations
Querying databases and using statistical computer languages (SQL, SAS, R, Pyrthon, etc.) to manipulate and draw insights from large data sets
Experience testing alternative modelling and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
Git-hub portfolio of projects/kaggle competition participation or personal website/blog
Hands-on experience building production models with focus on data science operations including serverless architectures, Kubernetes, Docker/containerization, and model upkeep and maintenance


Experience building collaborative environments optimized for data scientists with elastic compute configurations, and a focus on enabling reproducible research and markdown


 
We would prefer for you to have:

Master’s degree in a technical or healthcare-related field of study
Prior experience of 10+ years in as a Data Scientist or Technical Leader in data preferably in the biotech/pharma industry
Prior experience working on digital health initiatives



Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.


Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Position reports to:  Line management to the Discipline Manager. Project reporting to the Project Manager or Engineering Manager 
Primary objectives 
The HVAC Lead Engineer will provide discipline team supervision on projects by directing project execution activities and discipline deliverable creation for one larger or several smaller projects. Accountable for the safe/sustainable engineering, quality, cost and schedule delivery of all work by the discipline. Completes discipline technical work for projects, as time permits.  Additionally, will have a strong background and expertise in HVAC systems. The HVAC Lead Engineer will play a leading role in providing leadership for HVAC & Utilities Department. Using technical experience and excellent people skills, will make independent decisions and recommendations for large independent projects and/or several small independent projects 
Specific accountabilities  . Organise and manage all aspects of the workload of a team of HVAC & Utilities discipline engineers and designers, within the parameters of a project schedule.  . Establish a list of discipline deliverables. Control, monitor and progress these deliverables to an agreed schedule.  . Organise and manage the resource requirements for the HVAC discipline.  . Preparation and checking of engineering and design deliverables  . Direct the work of both detail and design drafters and ensure the drawings are in accordance with the client’s requirements and the relevant project specifications  . Have the experience to participate in design review with various clients and to advise on technical design and drafting issues and compliance requirements as appropriate  . Be able to demonstrate a proven track record of completing a given work scope within time and budget constraints.  . Monitors all engineering, design, 3D CAD and CAD drafting activities to assure conformance with Client and/or Company specifications, governing codes, and good engineering practice.  . Must have enough knowledge in HVAC systems’ analysis, MTOs control, material requisitions, bid evaluation and 3D design model reviews to be able to manage a team of specialists.  . Responsible for issue of all HVAC deliverable documents. Organize inputs and supervise for preparation general layout, equipment layout, key plans, support design, isometrics, material take offs, materials specifications and material requisitions.  . Perform basic and complex HVAC calculations including thermal loads, sizing of pipework and ductwork, air diffusion analyses and valve sizing. The calculations will be simplified or computational.  . Perform computational efficiency analysis using approved software tools for national and international projects (LIDER/CALENER/HULC, IES VE, HAP simulations, etc)  . Coordinate with electrical and BMS teams defining electrical and control requirements including definition of control loops.  . Must have deep knowledge of all-air, air-water, all-water systems. Including the different elements that compound them as air and water condensed chillers, cooling towers, pumps, etc.  . Knowledge of the reference suppliers for HVAC equipment and their catalogues.  . Knowledge of national and international Standards  . Being able to assist in utilities systems’ design including plumbing, drainage and fire fighting systems will be a plus  . Appraisal, training and development of personnel.  . Quality Assurance – Responsible for working within the provisions and guidelines of the Quality Assurance systems.  . Safety – Responsible for personal safety and working within the OHS&W procedures.  






     . Bachelor or master’s degree in Engineering or equivalent with proven leadership experience in HVAC design for different markets. 
      . Minimum of 12 years HVAC engineering experience in power, oil and gas or petrochemical industry. Experience in logistic facilities would be a plus too. 
      . Has a good background in design of HVAC systems for large spaces and in diverse climate conditions. 
      . Has already been responsible for large teams 
      . Has high knowledge of the most relevant codes used in HVAC systems’ design. 
      . Multi-office project execution experience 
      . Solid knowledge of relevant IT systems. (HAP, HULC, IES VE) 
      . Experience and affinity with Project controls; Scheduling and progressing 
      . Should have experience in lead role for FEED and Detail Engineering projects with exposure to field engineering activities. 
      . Ability to report in English, both verbal & in writing. High English level is a must. 
      . Knowledge of International codes. 
      . Knowledge of BREEAM and/or LEEDs certification would be a plus 
      . Flexible for business travelling 
    


What we offer you  Providing our people with an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.   Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.   If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it's time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

About the job 
 Each time we eat and drink, we vote for the world we want to live in.  Danone’s mission is Bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. We recognize the power people have to impact the world through their daily choices. Healthy food needs a healthy planet, and this is what our new signature One Planet One Health embodies.
 Danette, Evian, Activia, Volvic, Blédina, sound familiar to you? Do you know that behind these brands there is always Information Technology pushing them forward?
 At Danone, we use advanced and innovative IT solutions which are implemented in all Danone units around the world to contribute to our mission: bringing health through food to as many people as possible. Don’t wait, click and discover the Danone IS/IT universe and join the movement: your IT skills could be a real asset for the alimentation revolution!

 About you
 
 
Profile & Experience



At least [10+] years of experience in leading complex Data Science / Big Data projects from MVP to industrialized solutions




A MSc, PhD or other Advanced Degree in a field linked to computer science, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or closely related fields





Experience in Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry is a plus.





English is a must




 Competencies


 We are looking for people having the following technical skills:



Programming: python (pandas, numpy), Spark, Git





Modeling: semi-supervised learning, Boosting, time series forecasting, supervised and unsupervised learning





Infrastructure: Cloud (Azure is a plus)





Data Science tools/modules: Databricks / MLFlow




 Experience in managing an Advanced Analytics project will be challenged:



Explore the potential of a raw data set and propose some innovative ideas





Build relevant and performant models and analyses





Frame the project





Follow the developments and ensure team success





Monitor performance and ensure change management




 Mandatory skills:



Substantial experience working on full-life cycle data science project





Experience in leading a team





Ability to meet tight deadlines and work in an environment with multiple priorities.





Ability to communicate and discuss vision with head of D&A, CDO, and key data or business stakeholders within the Group





Curious, motivated, team-player, and with a good work ethic;



 About us 
 The Danone Data & Analytics organization (D&A) is looking for a Data Science Lead. Data & Analytics has the mission to deliver-leading edge, business-focused data powered products & services that will help strengthen Danone transformation & growth.


 The global Data Science team mission is to develop some new Data Science & AI tools to provide valuable insights to everybody at Danone, from Commercial to Operations. Danone is accelerating its data transformation, and we are strengthening our Data Science team, by creating new positions around Europe.


 Your mission, as a Data Science Lead, will be to lead the local Data Science team to deliver new data science solutions, and provide the business with a Data Science strategy by proposing creative solutions to their complex problems. Our target is to work for all of Danone’s businesses and address topics such as demand/supply forecasting, commodity pricing, milk collection optimization, marketing optimization and environmental impact reduction.

 Responsabilities & Duties



Provide compelling and well thought input regarding the Data & Analytics vision




Build & Keep strong connection with external ecosystem (research and academic, start-ups, technology providers)





Prescriber of best of breed technologies





Define the best practices in terms of programing / coding, implementation of ML Ops, model review protocols, documentation standards…





Guide the team on the algorithms/methodologies to be leveraged in the use cases





Inspire change and make an impact within Danone to promote a data enabled culture





Manage a team of 5 Data Scientists & ML Engineers




 She/he will be responsible for the quality, reliability and maintenance protocols of the models deployed.
 She/he shall be aware of ethical and compliance issues that can arise from the use of advanced Data & Analytics models.

job_title: AI & Machine Learning Scientist - R&D Projects
job_summary:
About Loyal Guru
 Loyal Guru is the Only Customer Data Platform Built For Retailers To Activate Loyalty.   Top-notch technology and retail expertise under one cloud-based platform to help our customers achieve next-level omnichannel marketing. We transform customer data into actionable loyalty programs and personalized coupons, providing retailers with an unparalleled competitive edge.   Our platform helps to enhance the spending of customers no matter if they prefer shopping in-store or online.
 The team behind
 We are an international team of passionate, humble, and dynamic professionals gathering each individual’s potentials and contributing in many different ways to the same mission. 
AI & Machine Learning Department.
 This department is responsible for:

R&D Projects: Managing and organizing R&D and Innovation Projects at the company, orchestrating ongoing projects and shaping future ones. 
AI developments: Formulating -through continuous dialogue with other development teams and customers- new initiatives to endow our Product with cutting-edge AI & ML algorithms that increase its value. 
Setting up an AI culture across the company: - Building our company’s AI roadmap and strategy aimed at positioning ourselves as an AI-driven product with Machine Learning solutions at its forefront. - Evangelize colleagues and teams in the emergence of AI as a new core feature of the whole product. - Providing training and learning resources to bring this impactful yet sometimes complex area close to everyone.

The role
 We are looking for an experienced AI & Machine Learning Scientist to be part of our AI&ML team, responsible for injecting innovation and “a pinch of intelligence” in every aspect of our product and turning it into a leading AI-based solution across the retail sector, with data-driven personalization, optimization, insight, predictions and process automation among its salient characteristics.
 You'll work at the intersection between business challenges and state-of-the-art research ideas leading to innovative solutions: you will spearhead the implementation of R&D Projects involving AI developments, investigate the adoption of state-of-the-art techniques into Loyal Guru’s rapidly evolving product, provide support in writing technical project documentation, help coordinate efforts and communicate results across teams.  Requirements:

A PhD degree in AI, Machine Learning or a closely related subject. Minimum 1-2 year experience in industry, external collaborations or knowledge-transfer projects with enterprise, would be a big plus.
Strong intellectual curiosity and willingness to continuous self-learning in the constantly evolving field of AI and Machine Learning
Great passion for translating AI research into practical solutions with real-world impact 
Outstanding scientific-technical writing skills
Strong working knowledge of various supervised and unsupervised learning techniques across their development lifecycle
Experience in data engineering, data mingling and preparation for ML algorithms
Experience in evaluation, fine-tuning and optimisation of ML models
Mastery of Python or similar AI-oriented programming languages and libraries: Tensorflow, scikit-learn, pandas, etc.
Experienced in AI tools and services in the cloud: Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure or similar
Familiar with Agile/SCRUM development methodologies
Proficient in written Spanish
A Certificate of disability of at least 33% or more is positively valued.  In addition, you are a outstanding candidate if you also have proven experience in at leasttwo of the following six topics: 
AI-driven Recommender Systems for user personalization
AI cloud tools: Vertex AI and/or BigQuery ML
Complex data modeling and representation
Labeling data for building effective predictive ML models at scale
Emergent AI topics such as Reinforcement Learning, NLP and/or Explainable AI.
MLOps methodology  Soft skills: 
Strongly analytical and critical thinking.
Able to work with a diverse group of internal stakeholders.
Solid cross-functional collaboration skills
The ability to bridge the gap between business problems, research innovation and technological solutions
You are a real team player who wants to work but also have a great time with Product and Engineering teams
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, able to transmit complex content to non-technical audiences

Benefits:
 We are remote-friendly! No matter your location what's important is your contribution. Flexible schedule. Fridays are short days. Birthdays day-off. Training budget and free access to O'Reilly  25 days of paid vacation  English lessons  Gym discounts ️‍️ Flex compensation with Cobee  50% discount on private health care with Sanitas. Team building activities

General description
 The Institute of Chemical Research of Catalonia (ICIQ) is seeking a postdoctoral researcher.
 ICIQ is committed to performing excellent research at the frontier of knowledge in the broad area of chemistry (Catalysis, Artificial Photosynthesis, Activation of Small Molecules, Photovoltaics, Functional Molecular Assemblies and Chemical Biology, from either theoretical or experimental perspectives). The institute also aims at training the future generation of scientists by offering high-quality educational programmes to master, PhD students and postdoctoral researchers (Full details on http://www.iciq.org/).
 ICIQ is looking for a postdoctoral researcher to work in a challenging project on Smart Characterization tools, which implies the analysis of experimental data to merge them with Density Functional Theory simulations. The ideal candidate will have high programming skills (Python) and a strong background in Neural Networks and related deep learning technologies, high versatility and good communication and training skills. The candidate needs to have an interest in materials modeling.

At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world. 

 We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. 

 Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world. 

 Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity. 

 Due to continued growth, we are now looking to strengthen our Railway Systems capability and support the growth and the delivery of existing and new projects in this business area. The role we are seeking to fill is that of a Railway Signalling and/or Communications Engineer with knowledge of specific systems used in Italy. 

 He/she will work on the delivery of projects providing technical support on signalling systems, communications and control systems, and engineering services to the project deliverables and directly to the client as required. 

 He/she will assess the design of signaling systems and communications and control systems to confirm compliance with the relevant standards in the destination countries. He/she will also be involved in developing market opportunities and preparing winning proposals. 


Main duties:
 + Develops signalling systems schemes, specifications, interfaces with other systems and RAMS, direct communication with the client and supervision of the design activities. 

 + Liaises with the client and the supplier to ensure that the design meets the requirements and that it is approved by the Sponsors. 

 + Provides specialized technical input to studies and design for staff's specific area of expertise. 

 + Participates in interdisciplinary review of project deliverables. 

 + Develops study and design procedures to facilitate high-quality cost-effective work by others. 

 + Develops construction cost estimates and estimates of technical efforts for projects. 

 + Uses expertise in all steps of completing the discipline component of the package. 

 + Performs quality control review of design calculations or drawings. 

 + Prepares technical specification sections. 

 + Provides input to the development of the engineering budget and schedule to meet requirements. 

 Minimum Requirements 

 + Provide expertise and advice on good engineering practice, potential solutions, railway standards and legislation. 

 + Experience in developing one or several technologies of Data Transmission Network, Radio systems (WIFI, GSM-R, TETRA, 4G, LTE), Video Surveillance Systems, Telephone and Intercom Systems, Voice Recording systems, Access Control and Intrusion Detection systems, Customer Information System, Public Address and Voice Alarm, Data Center, Operation Control Centre, Automatic Fare Collection and SCADA. 

 + Knowledge of Specific Railway Signalling Systems used in Italy: BACC, RSDD/SCMT y SCC. 


+ Expertise in at least one train control technology: Communication Based Train Control (CBTC), European Rail Traffic Management System (ERTMS / ETCS). 

 + Proficient in signaling principles such as Automatic Train Control and Automatic Train Operation under various Grades of Automation: ATC, ATO, DTO, UTO. 

 + Familiar with the interfaces between train control systems and rolling stock subsystems: braking systems, doors, propulsion systems, Train Control & Management System (TCMS), onboard communications, etc. 

 + Application of applicable standards (including railway standards, Spain and EU Rail Regulations including the CCS TSI). 

 + Previous experience in Mass Transit / Metro Signaling is welcome (CBTC, ATO, ATP, CTC, etc.). 

 + Previous experience in the railway services industry as a consultant or assessor. 

 + Strong communication skills, written and verbal, in the Italian language written and spoken and in English and Spanish as well. 

 Preferred Qualifications 

 + Electrical/Electronic/Industrial/Telecommunications Engineer. 

 What We Offer 

 We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. 

 You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. 

 We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. 

 We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. 

 When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started. 

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Transforming the Future with the Convergence of Simulation and Data


 HR Internship -Technical Sourcer


 Do you like a challenge, are you a complex thinker who likes to solve problems? If so, then you might be the new Altairian we are searching for. At Altair, your curiosity matters. We pride ourselves on a business culture that enables open, creative thinking, and we deeply value our employees and their contributions towards our clients' success, as well as our own.


 Job Summary:
 The Technical Sourcer Intern is responsible for bringing Altair a strong candidate pipeline of innovators in technical and non-technical disciplines. This will be achieved through building relationships with our internal customers to determine the talent pipeline required to support Altair’s future growth strategy. This position plays a critical role in ensuring that we are attracting and engaging diverse talent and bringing awareness of Altair’s support for global diversity.


 What You Will Do:

Maintain applicant pools by studying current and projected job needs and qualifications; identify and qualify sources; research, target, and cold-call potential candidates; resume management, data integrity, skill set matching and tracking.
Efficiently and effectively fill open positions in a timely manner by cold calling applicants and sourced candidates.
Evaluate and review applicants’ qualifications, skills and experience to determine if they meet position requirements.
Design, develop, and implement marketing concepts for recruitment campaigns that attract top diverse talent and builds brand recognition
Utilize various social media platforms with the goal of attracting the best & brightest, promoting our brand, and building long-term relations with potential talent.
Explore innovative sourcing methodologies and non-traditional channels for finding new candidates
Be a strategic sourcing partner that masters the craft of ‘the hunt’ and serves as a strategic partner to the business
Network through industry contacts, association memberships, trade groups, social media, and employees.
Maintain knowledge and understanding of engineering and information technology terminology, stay abreast of niche sources, websites, universities, and other potential sources.



 What You Will Need:
 Basics:

Currently enrolled in an accredited university or college as a part or full-time undergraduate or graduate student.
Business acumen and a strong desire and passion to be in sales.
Strong interest in social justice issues and creating diverse, equitable and inclusive workplaces, human resources, marketing and communications..
Experience with social media and social networks required.
Excellent written and communication skills.
Must be able to interact professionally with individuals at all levels internally and externally.
Ability to be professional and maintain confidentiality a must.
Ability to articulate the Altair employee brand and value proposition to candidates.
Self-motivated with a desire to engage with passive and active candidates.
Ability to multi-task and take initiative.
Well organized strategic thinker.

How You Will Be Successful:

Envision the Future
Communicate Honestly and Broadly
Seek Technology and Business “Firsts”
Embrace Diversity and Take Risks



 What We Offer:

Paid Internship
Outstanding Work/Life Balance
Flex Time
Collaborative environment
“Great Place to Work” Award 2021



 Why Work With Us:
 Altair is a global technology company that provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of product development, high performance computing (HPC) and data analytics. Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.


 For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration.
 To learn more, please visit altair.com .

job_summary:
We all know that a company’s ultimate goal is to increase their revenue, raise sales, and optimize costs. What better way to do this than through data?

location: Sant Feliu de Llobregat, Barcelona provincia
job_summary:
Date: 04-Aug-2022 
Location: SFEL - R&D SANT FELIU DE LLOBR, ES, ES - Spain 
Company: Almirall 




Mission


 We are seeking a talented chemist to drive the exploration of new small molecule modalities, such as Protein Degraders, Glue Degraders, Covalent inhibitors, RNA-targeting small molecules and/or Antibody Drug Conjugates, for the inception and advancement of drug discovery programs within Almirall Research Department. The candidate would design and synthetize novel small molecules to engage disease modifying targets of interest in the field of immune-modulated inflammatory skin diseases and contribute decisively to the advancement of drug discovery programs from hit finding to early development. To do so, the candidate will optimize lead compounds to improve potency, selectivity, physicochemical properties and DMPK to meet the desired target product applying all available in silico tools for in-depth analysis of results and multiparametric optimization of the chemical series. In addition, the candidate will bring a strong innovative drive, should be comfortable working in a very dynamic cross-functional team environment and should have demonstrated creativity in solving complex medicinal chemistry challenges. 




Tasks and Responsibilities



Drive hit finding activities in adequacy with selected modalities and targets, including the design of screening campaigns and the selection of libraries
Design and synthetize novel small molecule hits analogues to explore structure-activity relationships. Optimize hit compounds to improve potency, selectivity, physicochemical properties and DMPK to meet the desired target product
Use molecular modelling and chemo-informatics tools in the design and optimization of bioactive compounds
Collaborate with cross-functional team to conduct hypothesis-driven research enabling drug discovery in skin inflammatory diseases, non-melanoma skin cancer and orphan diseases
Present research plans, experimental results, and data analysis at cross-functional meetings
Interact with internal and external experts, academic groups and CROs to establish, manage and follow-up project and collaborations








PhD or MSc in Organic Chemistry with demonstrated experience (3+ years) in new drug modalities such as Protein Degraders, Glue Degraders, Covalent inhibitors, RNA-targeting small molecules and/or Antibody Drug Conjugates, either in pharmaceutical industry or academic experience
Strong Synthetic Organic Chemistry skills with deep and extensive working knowledge of modern synthetic chemistry methodologies, experimental work, isolation/purification techniques and structural analysis
Working knowledge in optimizing small molecules including new modalities in terms of structure-based design, and deep understanding of protein-ligand interactions
Robust track record of scientific contributions including peer reviewed publications, patents, and presentations
Excellent English language oral and written communication skills.
Ability to maintain awareness of latest literature of medicinal chemistry and chemical transformations








Familiarity with a range of biophysical and biochemical assays, as well as DMPK assays used in Drug Discovery.
Good knowledge of the drug discovery process with a proven track record of delivery to progress drug discovery projects
Ability and enthusiasm to propose innovative out-of-the-box solutions, critically evaluate data, generate testable hypotheses, and solve challenging problems
Team player with effective communication skills for working in interdisciplinary teams that include chemists, biologists and DMPK scientists
Strong problem-solving capacity, and a high level of learning agility
Experience managing interactions with external partners, collaborators and CROs.








Care; we listen & empathize, we value diverse perspectives & backgrounds and we help each other succeed.
Courage; we challenge the status quo, we take full ownership and we learn from our success & failures
Innovation; we put the patient and customer at the center, we create novel solutions and we empower entrepreneurial mindsets.
Simplicity; we act decisively and avoid over-analysis, we understand why before we act and we are agile & keep things simple.

job_title: Machine Learning Engineer ​ ‍ |working in an open science...
job_summary:
About us.
 Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open-access scholarly publisher. We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities, and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability and we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

 Our Proposal
 We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer who can work on the productization, deployment, and maintenance of machine learning algorithms to join our Machine Learning Engineering team.
 Responsibilities

Work in a team of machine learning engineers responsible for the productization of models developed by data scientists.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and data engineers to design scalable state-of-the-art infrastructure to serve machine learning models in production.
Research and adopt the best MLOps standards to design and develop scalable end-to-end machine learning pipelines.
Identify opportunities for machine learning process automation.
Establish and enforce best practices (e.g. in development, quality assurance, optimization, release, and monitoring).


 It can be a perfect match if you meet...

  Degree in Computer Science or similar.


Solid understanding of software development best practices. 
Extensive experience in Python (more than three years). As well as machine learning / deep learning-related libraries.
Experience writing production-grade code and maintaining production-grade web services.
Experience with REST API design in Python (e.g. Flask, FastAPI, Celery).
Experience with machine learning model development and deployment.
Experience with a Cloud Platform (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP).
Solid understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms.
Experience with containerization technology (Docker/Kubernetes).
Detailed understanding of MLOps project life cycle, as well as different solutions for each stage.
Experience with Machine learning platforms and frameworks such as MLflow, Kubeflow, TFX, Seldon, etc.
Great communication, teamwork, problem-solving, and organizational skills.


 What do we offer? 

Continuous catch-up with latest technology, you won’t get bored!‍
Really senior colleagues in all fields of IT, you will learn new things every single day.‍

 Yego was born in 2016 when shared mobility with a light vehicle was still at an experimental stage.  Reporting to the Data Scientist Lead, this role is embedded in the day-to-day business performance and holds the reporting responsibilities for Yego.

Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL (MySQL or Postgresql), and understanding of ETL programming (Python).
Expertise in statistical analysis and experience using tools to report and visualize (Tableau, R, Python, Cluvio, and others).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

job_summary:
Syngenta Group is a leading science-based agritech company; dedicated to bringing plant potential to life. Each of our 48,000 employees in more than 100 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Join us and help shape the future of agriculture.
Syngenta’s 25 billion$ business is in need for an experienced, pragmatic Data science platform engineer to join our Data & Analytics team, support Syngenta Group. For this role, we are offering a permanent contract. The position is based in our office in Guyancourt (78).

The mission is building a scalable data foundation for a rapid growing data savy Agriculture company. Therefore we are looking for A-players who are ready for the challenge of creating a Data Science Platform based on mostly AWS services (Sagemaker, Lambda, Glue, Python, Jupyter notebooks, Stepfunction etc… ).
The Data science platform engineer (large focus on machine learning) will be a key contributor to the data science Platform Development and Operations, in line with functional and cross functional needs.
This engineer is a co-owner of the data science platform and manages it in order to serve current and future business needs. In this respect he/she is accountable to create, maintain and deploy a platform roadmap aligned with prioritized business requirements and Data & Analytics strategies, and monitor this platform.
 - The Platform lead supported by the data science platform engineers must ensure his platform is flexible and scalable to serve both short- and long-term purposes. Consequently, the data science platform engineer has to help dimension the platform adequately at all times in order to guarantee a cost-efficient service, drive continuous improvement, and proactive service management.
  

The Data science platform engineer collaborate with other IT and digital functions to ensure comprehensive and suitable integration of his/her platform in the overall IT landscape.

Accountabilities:

To contribute evaluate, select, configure and deploy the tools operating within the platform area’s remit, when appropriate own these tools on behalf of business user’s community.
Contribute to establish and deploy a roadmap for his/her platform area and drive its adoption.
To manage business stakeholders / data scientist community having a dependency with the platform content and/or usage, and educate workforces about this platform usage.
To coordinate platform content exploitation, mitigate conflicting interests and risks associated to the platform, and create and scale associated services.
To establish clear accountabilities and ownership of content and tools being part of the platform landscape.
You will help lay the foundation that allows the Data Scientist to accelerate and therefore more effectively scale its impact.
To monitor and optimize platform usage.
To promote effective sharing of best practices across the organization. Lead, direct, coach and develop stakeholder community ensuring platforms adoption to meet business needs.
To define and deploy the platform necessary support model that guarantee meeting operational requirements.
To govern necessary changes modifying platform landscape, content and usage.



Experience, competences and soft skills required for the job:

Expertise of cloud-based data science platform management, ideally AWS Sagemaker (AWS certifications, Sagemaker, cloud Architecture etc…, data science is a plus).
Can showcase strong coding experience (e.g. Python, SQL,R,…).
Track record of managing 3rd party, external suppliers, and internal/augmented delivery teams.
Experience with Agile methodology (ideally LeSS). and DevOps delivery concepts.
Strong experience in data scientist stakeholder management.
Demonstrated ability to enable delivery of visualization and analytics for business outcomes and an extensive knowledge of the tools available on the market.
Awareness of current best practices in data science domain.
Ability to articulate vision and mission and goals that inspires and motivate teams to action.
Ability to gather right people together to solve problems from any place within and or outside the organization.
Ability to transform business requirement into expected platform outcome.
Excellence in network building, stakeholder management and influencing skills.
Fluency in English and French.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. #LI-DD

About Glovo:

  We're a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
 


  At Glovo, you'll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!
 


  We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
 


  In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
 
Your work-life opportunity:

  As a SEM Campaign Specialist, you will be part of the Global Performance Marketing team in a quickly growing data driven company. You will work alongside performance marketers, data engineers & data scientists and be responsible for using data to proactively uncover untapped opportunities, designing new programs and processes, measuring performance and optimising all aspects of Glovos marketing efforts.
 
Be a part of a team where you will:



    Execute, develop and optimize search campaigns directly across all regions and new launches (Africa, Eastern Europe, Western Europe, CIS)
    


    Focus primarily on campaigns (web and mobile web) in platforms like Google, Bing, Yandex, etc.
    


    Support the team in the daily business with your hands-on and analytical mentality
    


    Work closely with a very experienced marketing team to support new initiatives through SEM
    


    Be given the trust and support to grow, develop, and make a difference whilst being encouraged to bring your unique perspective to the table
    


    Collaborate together and learn from each other
    


    Have specific targets to reach that you will be measured upon
    


    Drive excellence across markets you are responsible for and communicate results and best practices to the team
    


    Proactively do continuous A-B testing and performance analysis in order to optimise the channel performance with a dedicated data analyst
    


    Work cross departmental (comms, local marketing teams, BI, Martech, SEO) to define the best strategy for SEM campaigns
    


    Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
    

You have:



    3+ years of SEM experience
    


    An excellent understanding of Google Editor, Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets (this includes familiarity with VLookups, Pivot Tables and other such functionalities)
    


    Comfortable with being accountable for major advertising programs, collaborating with data and tech teams
    


    Passionate about numbers, experimentation, online advertising and hungry to learn new things
    


    Deep interest in web and app technologies and the latest developments and trends in online behaviour
    


    Proven analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, discover root causes and identify opportunities
    


    Ability to prioritise workload and deliver results for multiple deadlines in a fast-paced environment
    


    Ability to think outside the box and introduce fresh ideas
    


    Excellent verbal and written communication skills (in both English + any other language is a plus)
    


    An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude
    


  We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
 
Nice-to-haves:



    Experience or understanding of other channels of performance marketing (Display, Youtube, mobile marketing)
    


    Experience in Apple Search Ads is a plus
    


    Experience in the food or delivery industry is preferred
    


    Understanding of attribution and tagging platforms
    

Experience our Glovo Life benefits:



    Enticing equity plan (if applicable)
    


    Top-notch private health insurance
    


    Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!
    


    Discounted gym memberships
    


    Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)
    


    Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!
    


    Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
    


    External learning budget
    

What you'll find when working at Glovo:



    Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly
    


    Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly
    


    Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning
    


    Care: Uplift people and the planet
    


    Glownership: Act as proud owners
    


    High Bar: Focus on Top Performance
    


  If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
 


  Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
 


Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

The Data Engineering team is in charge of the Data Platform, which supports the Analytics needs and data-driven projects of the company. It is built around modern ELT pipelines deployed on AWS and uses Python, Spark, dbt, Redshift, and a wide range of AWS services.
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering Squad, where you will support, improve and extend our Data Platform. Your work will empower our Analysts and Data Scientists, enable data-driven Product features, and support the data-centered culture.
More specifically, based on your experience, you will:

Design, build and support modern and scalable data pipelines using 3rd party platforms or internal solutions.
Collaborate with data scientists, other engineers, and stakeholders to understand what data is required and how best to make it available in our Data Platform.
Support the daily work of our Data Scientists by ensuring they have easy access to data and tools (development environment, notebook instances, etc.).
Write and maintain code to orchestrate our ELT workflows.
Improve the design and data feeding of our Data Lake.
Help and train Data Scientists to optimize SQL queries for performance.
Provide data and infrastructure for building and deploying ML models to production.
Use best practices around CI/CD, automation, testing, and monitoring of analytics pipelines (inspired by DataOps).

About you:
The ideal teammate for us would be someone who believes that communication, empathy, inquisitiveness, and open-mindedness are fundamental to succeed in any endeavor.
Ideally, it would help if you had some or all of the following:

Be interested in building a platform that enables our Data Analysts and Data Scientists.
Be fluent in one or more high-level programming languages (Python, Ruby, Java, Scala, or similar).
Be comfortable with analytical SQL.
Be familiar with software development best practices and their applications to Analytics (version control, testing, CI/CD, automation).
Have experience building modern ETL pipelines, possibly at a large scale.
Have experience working with a modern data warehouse (Redshift, Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar).
Have a self-driven approach to learning new technologies and moving projects forward.

We also consider these as nice to have:

Experience working with Data Scientists and Analysts.
Experience in data quality and governance.
Experience in the BigData ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, PrestoDB, etc.).
Familiarity with infrastructure and automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, or similar).

English is a must. We are a multicultural team, and we are providing a service in English. And although we don't care about certificates, we expect you to be able to communicate fluently.
You should feel equally comfortable communicating in long-form writing. Given the circumstances, we have become a fully remote company. We are firm believers that being articulate in both spoken and written long-form asynchronous communication is key to working efficiently together.

Base Compensation Range: (Mid Data Engineer) €45-60k
Ideal starting date: September 12th or 19th

We are looking for a talented Backend Engineer to help us change the world of digital advertising together.

 WHO WE ARE
 At Seedtag our goal is to lead the change in the advertising industry, because we believe that effective advertising should not be at odds with users’ privacy.
 By combining Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision our proprietary, Machine Learning-based technology provides a human-like understanding of the content of the web that finds the best context for each ad while providing unparalleled risk-mitigation capabilities that protect advertisers from showing their ads on pages that could be damaging for their brand. All of this, without relying on cookies or any other tracking mechanisms.
 Every day, our teams develop new services that reach over 200 million users worldwide with fast response times to ensure that we deliver the best user experience. We’re fully committed to the DevOps culture, where we provide the platform that our Software Developers and Data Scientists use to manage over 100 different microservices, pushing dozens of changes to production every day. All of this is built on top of Kubernetes in Google Cloud Platform and Amazon Web Services.
 If you are interested in joining one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe and work on massive scalability challenges, this is the place for you.

 Macbook Pro M1

 Job summary 
Are you interested in building state-of-the-art software applications and machine learning systems for the most complex, and fastest growing, transportation network in the world? If so, Amazon has the most exciting, and never-before-seen, challenges at this scale (including those in sustainability, e.g. how to reach net zero carbon by 2040). 

 Amazon’s transportation systems get millions of packages to customers worldwide faster and cheaper while providing world class customer experience – from online checkout, to shipment planning, fulfillment, and delivery. Our software systems include services that use tens of thousands of signals every second to make business decisions impacting billions of dollars a year, that integrate with a network of small and large carriers worldwide, that manage business rules for millions of unique products, and that improve experience of over hundreds of millions of online shoppers. 

 As part of this team you will lead an Engineering organization to develop software applications and services for Amazon Transportation Services, while working close together with Applied and Research Scientists developing a wide array of Machine Learning to improve and optimize transportation planning and business processes. 

 If you are a strong technical and experienced Engineering leader who is passionate about growing a team of Software Engineers to deliver new applications to help fuel the explosive growth of ATS, then this is the job for you. 

 At Amazon, we strive to continue being the most customer-centric company on earth. To stay there and continue improving, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, and deliver in the most efficient and greenest way possible, this is your chance to make history. 

 Key job responsibilities

Keep your technical skills current to contribute to architecture and design discussions. Lead your team to evolve our service architecture with quality, robustness and Amazon sized scale as top priorities. You will regularly take part in deep-dive troubleshooting exercises and drive technical post-mortem discussions to identify the root cause of complex issues.
Set a vision for your team and create product roadmaps. Help your team sort out technical and product requirements and priorities. Use project management skills to deliver product roadmap items and other cross-team projects.
Contribute to and lead design, architecture, process and development discussions
Drive strategic communication across senior leadership, understanding the strategic importance of software to the larger business
Work with local and global teams to deliver the best in-class delivery experience for our customers while balancing critical business objectives - Build the next generation supply chain technology focusing on growth, execution and visualization of our network across Central Europe and United Kingdom.
Influence Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence initiatives to select the best delivery speeds and options for customers.

Experience using AWS technologies
Masters or PhD in Computer Science or related field
Experience in logistics/operations

Job Reference

      348_22_ES_CVC_R2
    




Position



       Vegetation dynamics scientist (R2)
      






Closing Date



       Wednesday, 30 November, 2022
      









Reference: 348_22_ES_CVC_R2
    

Job title: Vegetation dynamics scientist (R2)
    




About BSC




      The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain. It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, and is a hosting member of the PRACE European distributed supercomputing infrastructure. The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress. BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 770 staff from 55 countries.
      
 Look at the BSC experience:
       BSC-CNS YouTube Channel
       Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!
     



Context And Mission




      This position is hosted by the Climate Variability and Change (CVC) Group within BSC's Earth Science Department. The CVC Group undertakes fundamental research to (1) understand climate variability and change, including for climate extremes, (2) investigate global biogeochemical dynamics, effectiveness and impacts of carbon removal technologies to mitigate climate change, (3) developing new Earth System modeling capabilities, and (4) improving our ability to forecast the climate variations from one month to multiple decades into the future, both at global and regional scales.
      
 The offered position is funded by the European projects LANDMARC and RESCUE. LANDMARC explores the potentials for land-based climate change mitigation, whereas the RESCUE project aims to improve knowledge and understanding in climate and Earth System responses to climate neutrality and net negative emissions. This position will also contribute to the 4C project, which aims to establish near-term prediction systems of climate and atmospheric CO2 growth rate to assist the implementation of the Paris agreement.
      
 The successful applicant will be responsible for a process-based evaluation of the vegetation and carbon fluxes of the EC-Earth3-CC model, comparing historical simulations and near-term predictions performed by the CVC group with state-of-the-art observations. The applicant will also study the contribution of vegetation and land-use change to atmospheric CO2 variability and its predictability. This position will further contribute to the implementation of Land-based mitigation technologies (LMTs) in the EC-Earth3-CC model and will study the future effects of different LMTs on the global carbon cycle and key atmospheric processes. The candidate will contribute to scientific planning and development of the next generation of the EC-Earth ESM, version 4.
     



Key Duties




Contribute to the development of Land-based mitigation technologies (LMTs) in the EC-Earth3-CC ESM, focusing on the vegetation/land use aspects
Perform and analyze the experiments performed with the EC-Earth3-CC model and LMT scenarios developed in the LANDMARC and RESCUE projects, in regard of effects on land-use change, the carbon cycle and atmospheric processes
Analyze the contributions of vegetation and land-use change to projections and near-time predictions of the global carbon cycle
Lead the preparation of scientific publications, extend the group’s international network in the candidate’s area of expertise and actively participate in grant preparation activities
The candidate will work closely with scientists within the Climate Variability and Change Group and other groups of the Earth Sciences Department




Requirements




Education 
       
PhD in ecology, atmospheric or climate science, or a related discipline

Essential Knowledge and Professional Experience 
       
Experience in working with Dynamic Vegetation models and/or Land-use change models. Experience with LPJ-GUESS is highly valued
Proven ability to prepare and submit manuscripts to peer-reviewed scientific journals
Well-established scientific network in vegetation, land-use and climate modelling
A demonstrated ability to analyse climate and vegetation data
Programming skills: scripting (e.g. bash, Python), programming (Fortran, c++) data analysis and visualization software (e.g. CDO, NCO, R, Python, QGis)

Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience 
       
Interest and capacity in participating in the writing and, when possible, leading the preparation of research and computing proposals 
Knowledge of version control systems (git, svn, cvs…)
Interest in tutoring and/or advising master and PhD students
Previous postdoctoral experience will be valued

Competences 
       
Fluency in spoken and written English, while fluency in other European languages will be also valued 
Highly collaborative spirit and ability to work as part of a large, strongly-coordinated team and to continuously share both knowledge and tools
 




Conditions





The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department
 We offer a full-time contract, a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, tickets restaurant, private health insurance, fully support to the relocation procedures
 Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration
 Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona
 Starting date: ideally by October 2022







Applications procedure and process




       All applications must be made through BSC website and contain:
       


A full CV in English including contact details 
A Cover Letter with a statement of interest in English, including two contacts for further references - Applications without this document will not be considered  In accordance with the OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for every vacancy at the beginning of the process. After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will start the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview. A profile questionnaire as well as a technical exercise may be required during the process.  The panel will make a final decision and all candidates who had contacts with them will receive a feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.  At BSC we are seeking continuous improvement in our recruitment processes, for any suggestions or feedback/complaints about our Recruitment Processes, please contact recruitment [at] bsc [dot] es.  For more information follow this link







Deadline




       The vacancy will remain open until suitable candidate has been hired. Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.
      





OTM-R principles for selection processes




       BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R). This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment planels and recognizing career breaks etc.
        BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

Job summary Come and build innovative services that protect our cloud from security threats.  As an Amazon Security Senior Software Development Engineer (SDE), you’ll help to build and manage services that detect and automate the mitigation of cyber threats across Amazon’s infrastructure. You’ll work with data scientists, security engineers, and other software development engineers across multiple teams to develop innovative security solutions at massive scale. Our services protect the Amazon cloud for all customers and preserves our customers’ trust in us. You’ll get to use the full power and breadth of Amazon technologies to build services that proactively protect every single Amazon customer, both internally and externally, from security threats – not many teams can say that!  About the team Inclusive Team Culture  Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.  Work/Life Balance  Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.  Mentorship & Career Growth  Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
